loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Soutoura (3 femmes mariées et une veuve) ont en moyenne 45 ans, 4 enfants et  vivent dans des familles polygames à Hamdallaye  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur dixième  prêt solidaire. Tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés. 
Elles font la vente de condiments alimentaires, de  poissons,  de sucre, de cola  et des fruits et légumes etc.
Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 5 paniers de poissons séchés, 2 paniers de cola, 6 sacs de 50 kg de sucre et 2 chargements de charrette  en oranges. 
Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages avoisinants. Elles vendent à domicile, dans les marchés et dans les quartiers de façon ambulante. Elles vendent au comptant souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45.500FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Soutoura group (three married women and a widow) average 45 years of age, have an average of four children and live in polygamous families iin Hamdallaye, one of the districts of the town of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to satisfy their customer demand and are on their tenth group loan. All their previous loans have been paid without incident. They sell condiments, fish, sugar, cola, fruit and vegetables etc. With their new loan they are planning on buying five baskets of dried fish, two baskets of cola, six 50kg bags of sugar and two barrowloads of oranges. They get their supplies at the large market in Sikasso town and in the neighboring villages. They sell at home, in markets and walking around the various neighborhoods. They sell for cash and often on credit to a customer base composed of men and women. They are expecting to make an average monthly profit of 45,500 FCFA each, of which part will be used for savings and family needs and the rest invested in their business.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various items

loans.name: Leoncia

texts.en: Leoncia C. wishes to find a way to improve her family's quality of living. For this motivation, she joined Kiva and felt very happy to be given a loan and group support. The previous loans she received enabled her to support her husband’s fishing business, maintain her general store and canteen eatery. The profit from these businesses has been the main source of family income and funding for the education of her four children in college. Now that Leoncia has access to funding, her profits are better than before. Therefore, she is now requesting another loan through Kiva for a much bigger amount to purchase fishnet, bamboo, and other raw materials of her fishing business and pay for 120 sacks of charcoal for maintenance of her store . This will allow her to grow their businesses further so that their children can fulfill their dreams of achieving college degree and find good jobs.

loans.use: To purchase fishnet, bamboo, and other raw materials of her fishing business and remaining money will be use to pay for 120 sacks of charcoal for maintenance of her store.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi D. sells cooked rice with tomato sauce at Abura.  Esi has no educational background.  She is a widow and lives with her four children. Esi has been selling cooked rice exactly two years now. She is entirely responsible for the welfare of her four children. Her loan will be used to buy bags of rice to be able to cook to meet the demand of her eager consumers. She hopes to use the new income from her business to save to build a shop.

loans.use: buy bags of rice to cook for sale

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is 49 years old, a widow with 3 children. She sells groceries and drinks at retail prices to her customers. She hopes to own a super market in the future. She   wants to expand her business in order to make more profits to cater for her children. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Sahar Gul Group

texts.en:
Khysta Gul is the leader of 'Sahar Gul' group. He lives in district three of Jalalabad City. He is 67 years old, and he's married with three children who are all in school. He is a hard-working man. He  runs a business selling fuel. 

Khysta Gul wants a loan to purchase diesel and petrol oil for his shop in order to expand his business capacity. This is the only source of income through which he completes the requirements of his family. He would like to thank both AFS and Kiva lenders for their effective process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: purchase diesel and petrol oil for his business

loans.name: Walid

texts.en:
Walid is a 30-year old man from Lebanon. He currently lives with his parents and sibling. In 2009, he started working as a van taxi driver. He is requesting a loan of $1,500 from Kiva partner A. Majmoua to pay the rent of the van since it is expensive. Unfortunately, Walid doesn't have enough cash to buy a van, therefore he rents it, which in the end costs him a lot.

Walid says that he is well known especially thanks to his punctuality. In the future, he plans on buying his own van.

He will also use some of the loan to purchase aluminum to renovate his house.

loans.use: To pay the rent of the van.

loans.name: Cathérine

texts.fr: Née en 1966, S. Cathérine est mariée à HOUANSOU Rufin, un revendeur. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Cathérine s'est installée depuis une dizaine d'année au quartier Placodji à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, où elle vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Cathérine assure avec son mari les différentes charges de la famille. Cathérine n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et apporter une assistance fianncière à sa famille, Cathérine vend des poissons fumés et des condiments de sauce. Cathérine s'approvisionne à Cotonou. Cathérine a obtenu antérieurement deux crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. En vue de rehausser le niveau de son activité et d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaire par la vente de ses produits, Cathérine sollicite pour une troisième fois, un appui financier auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born in 1966, Cathérine S. is married to Rufin HOUANSOU, a retailer. The couple has three children, all in school. About ten years ago Cathérine settled down in Placodji, a neighborhood of Cotonou, Benin’s economic capital, where she lives with her husband and their children. Together, Cathérine and her husband look after the family’s various needs. Cathérine never went to school. To support herself and her family financially, Cathérine sells smoked fish and sauce condiments. She gets her stocks in Cotonou. Cathérine has benefited from two previous loans, which were repaid without incident. In order to boost her level of activity and increase her revenues through the sale of her products, Catherine is seeking a third loan with ALIDé.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase boxes of fresh fish and condiments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase 4 young bulls.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 48 years old. She is married and has been blessed with six children with ages ranging between 10 and 30. Three of the children are attending school. Rosemary has been farming for the last five years on the outskirts of Kitale town in Western Kenya. Her farm produces maize, beans and eggs which she sells at the local market. She is also a food vendor. She says that she faces the challenge of poultry diseases and so far there is no insurance coverage for the poultry trade.

Rosemary has requested a loan of 70,000 Kenyan shillings from Juhudi Kilimo to expand her poultry project. This being her fourth loan from Juhudi, she is optimistic that her income will increase and that she will be able to pay for the education of her children. She hopes that the business will have expanded in five years' time and she will be reaping the full benefits of the project.

loans.use: To expand her poultry project

loans.name: Jurabek

texts.ru: Хочакулов Чурабек проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 42 года. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Чурабек не имеет высшего образования. Более 5 лет занимается торговлей на рынке. У него магазин, где он продает мясо. Кредит берет для закупа крупно - рогатого скота. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и улучшить финансовое положение семьи.
texts.en:
Jurabek K. lives in the town of Kulob. He is 42 years old. He is married and has six children. His wife is a homemaker. Jurabek does not have high education. He has been selling on the market for more than five years. He has a store where he sells meat. He is taking out a loan to buy large cattle. He wants to expand his business and improve the financial situation of his family.

Translated from Russian by Elena Bortnikoff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy large cattle

loans.name: May's Group

texts.en:
May F., 36, is married and has four school-aged children. She is from the village of Disimuray, a part of Cauayan City within the province of Isabela on the Luzon islands. May is just starting to raise pigs for fattening and sale. She is also the group leader of an eight-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

In 2010, May joined ASKI to gain access to its financial services. May is requesting a loan, her first, of 5000 PHP that will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell in the future. She plans to use all revenue generated to expand her business.

About ASKI:

Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc., or ASKI, is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and -women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Bridgit

texts.en:
Bridgit is 33 years old and married with four children who are now between the ages of 3½ and 13. Three of her children attend school. She has a mixed farm in Kitale town, western Kenya, where she has been farming for ten years. She employs one person from her community. She also earns income from charcoal sales and fish mongering.

Bridgit has requested this loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The income from this loan will go towards the education of her children, and the milk will help improve their health. She faces the challenges of the fluctuation in prices of products and the lack of a reliable market. Despite the challenges, she hopes to establish a veterinary shop and acquire two more dairy cows in the future.

She urges Juhudi to keep up the good work lifting up farmers' lives.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Alegres Catarinas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Alegres catarinas porque son personas muy alegres y sonrientes. Está ubicado en el Estado D. México.  El grupo está conformado por  9 integrantes.

 Josefina O. López es la presidenta  del grupo, tiene 29  años, estudió hasta el 6to año D. primaria, es comerciante  y tiene en total 4  hijos  (2 mujeres y 2  varones).  Ella se dedica a la venta D. bolsas D. mano  que inició hace año y medio. Solicita el préstamo para invertir las bolsas. Sus clientes son personas D. la misma comunidad que cuentan con un poquito D. mayor posibilidad económica, ya que algunas bolsas están un poco caras, dependiendo del material que sean, ella también las venD. en abonos. Al momento D. solicitar este préstamo se siente contenta. Quiere este crédito para invertir en más bolsas pues entra una D. sus mejores temporadas.

 Esta foto fue tomada en la casa D. la Sra. Silvina, integrante del grupo Alegres Catarinas. Se ven los catálogos, las bolsas y algunos productos que venden la Sra. Silvina y la Sra. Josefina quienes cuentan con un amplio surtido en la foto.  Al momento D. solicitar este préstamo se sienten ilusionadas.
texts.en:
This group is called the "Alegres Catarinas" (The Joyful Ladybugs) because they are a very happy and cheerful bunch.  The are located in the state of Mexico.  The group is maD. up of 9 members.  

Josefina O. López is the president of the group.  She is 29 years old and finished the 6th graD..  She is a merchant and has 4 children (2 girls and 2 boys).  A year and a half ago she started selling handbags for a living.   Her customers are people who live in the same community that have a little more economic freedom as some of the bags are a bit expensive depending on the matierial they are maD. from.  She also sells them on a payment plan.  At the time of this loan request she feels happy.  She is requesting the loan to buy more bags as she is entering one of her busiest seasons.  

The photo was taken in Señora Slivina's house, another member of "Alegres Catarinas".  They are pictured here with catalogs, bags and other products that Señora Silvina and Señora Josefina sell.  At the time of this photo they are well stocked and hopeful.

loans.use: To purchase more bags to stock her business

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala East region of Uganda.  She is married and has 2 children.  None of her children are currently in school.  Agnes has a business of selling matooke (food), which she has had for 1 year.         

To help expand her business, Agnes has requested a loan of 100,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more matooke (food).  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Agnes hopes to generate greater profits and buy food.  In the future, Agnes hopes to add another business of selling charcoal.  Agnes is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her reach her dreams of being self employed.

loans.use: to buy food

loans.name: Munduli B Group

texts.en:
Mwajuma L. is in her early thirties, married and has four children. Mwajuma has been running a small food stall for one year now, from which she sells fruits and vegetables, as well as casava chips. The business is open between 7 am and 8 pm and earns Mwajuma a small monthly profit.

This will be Mwajuma's first loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. She aims to use this loan to stock up on fruits and vegetables as well as improving the condition of her stall. 

Mwajuma will share this loan with her loan group Munduli, which totals 16 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the picture, Mwajuma is wearing blue and orange, standing in the middle of the back row.

loans.use: Increase stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Lourgen Magsayo's Group

texts.en:
M. Lourgen is from the village of Dimaluna, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. Lourgen is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Lourgen M.’s Group.

To make a living, Lourgen owns and operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Lourgen has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lourgen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lourgen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,995 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lourgen is requesting a new loan of 14,995 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Lourgen from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living condition of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To buy additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Ton

texts.en:
Mrs. Ton S. has spent her life cultivating different types of crops, a skill she had learned from her grandparents when she was young. In addition, she sells a few snack foods to kids in front of her home. Ton S. is married and has five kids. One of her children is married and other four single. Her husband helps to share responsibilities by working in the construction field. 

Ton S. owns a motorcycle that she can use to provide the family transportation or pick up vegetables to sell. Unfortunately, it is now getting old and often breaks down during use. To resolve this problem, Ton S. decided to ask for a loan from Kiva in the amount of $1200 to renovate her old motorbike.

loans.use: To renovate her old motorbike

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is a thirty-three-year-old married woman with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda, with a dream of educating her children. She is a business woman operating a retail shop, which she has done for ten years. Her business dream is to become a wholesale trader. Martha needs the loan to buy soap, sugar and tea leaves to resell.

loans.use: Buying soap, sugar and tea leaves to resell

loans.name: Dionicio

texts.es: Dionisio tiene 28 años, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Toda su vida ha estado ligada a las actividades agrícolas es así que en la actualidad siembra papa, maíz, arveja, habas, mashua entre otros productos. Su esposa es su principal ayuda en estas tareas. Por otro lado, también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, adquiriéndolos a un menor precio, luego de un tiempo los engorda y los comerciales a un precio mayor, así puede generarse ganancias mientras espera la cosecha de sus productos. Todas estas actividades le han servido para sostener a su familia y considera rentable la venta de animales sin embargo seguirá dedicándose a la agricultura porque llega a tener ingresos en mayor cantidad después de esperar por varios meses y eso le favorece para incrementar mas su capital. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, aunque como socio pasivo de su grupo estuvo anteriormente esta muy contento de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero. Agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que  le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes y abono, para poder mejorar la producción de maíz.
texts.en: Dionisio is 28 years old; he lives in his own home with his wife and 2 children. All of his life he has been tied to agricultural work and presently he grows potatoes, corn, peas, broad beans, and mashua (an edible tuber, which is eaten as a root vegetable) among other products. His wife is his main source of help. Dionisio also raises small animals by getting them at a less price and after some time he fattens them up and sells them at a higher price and is able to have greater earnings while he waits for the harvest of his products. All of these activities have helped him support his family and considers that selling animals is more profitable but still works as a farmer because it helps him have more revenue after having to wait for several months. This is first loan with MFP (Kiva’s field partner) even though he has been an inactive member of his group but now is happy to know that he has financial support. Dionisio is grateful to those people who will help him with his loan since it will be very helpful for him to progress in his job. With the loan, he will buy fertilizers and manure to be able to improve his corn production.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and manure.

loans.name: Saben Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Saben” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are petty-businesswomen who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva in order to seek for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Isatu K.. Isatu was born in Makeni, thirty-seven years ago. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a carpenter and two of her children are attending primary school. Isatu has been selling clothes for twenty years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy clothes in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: Buys clothes in large quantity to add to her business

loans.name: Miami

texts.en:
Miami L. is from the town of Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 43 years old. Miami is single. To make a living, Miami owns and operates a  specialized retail store selling rice in the local market. Miami has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7,500 PHP a month.

In 2011, Miami joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Miami from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Gulya's Group

texts.en: Gulya T., 31, is the treasurer of this group. Being a loan specialist in a local bank, she is well acquainted with Kiva and admires how many wonderful opportunities this project can give to thousands of entrepreneurs. Gulya is a beginner in the banking sphere, so her salary is not that much yet, but she truly believes in building a successful career in banking. She applied for a loan in order to purchase a washing machine. She’s well aware of all the requirements and promises to repay the loan on time. ====================================== Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase a washing machine

loans.name: Dinora Elizabeth

texts.es:
Dinora reside en San Rafael Oriente departamento de San Miguel, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, tiene 30 años de edad, vive con su esposo y dos hijos, el negocio es la fuente de ingreso más estable con la que cuenta para comprar todo lo necesario para el hogar.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para comprar cerdos, ya que desea tener varios pequeños, pues cree que los que posee actualmente puede venderlos, y quedarse solamente con los pequeños.
Dinora quiere crecer con su comercio para recibir mejores ingresos y ayudar a sus hijos y su esposo para que tengan una vida confortable e ir adquiriendo más ahorros.
texts.en:
Dinora lives in San Rafael Oriente department of San Miguel, she raises pigs. She is 30 years old and lives with her husband and two children. The business is a steady source of income that they have to buy everything necessary for their home.

Dinora needs the loan to buy pigs since she wants to have several small ones, since she believes that the ones that she currently has she will be able to sell and will only have the small ones to take care of.

Dinora wants to grow her business to have better income and to help her children and husband so that they have a comfortable life and have some savings.

loans.use: To buy pigs.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Phin

texts.en:
Phin S. is 47-year-old married woman and mother. She lives with other family members in her own small family home in Phnom Penh City. She owns a piece of land that she inherited from her grandmother. She grows different kinds of crops on her land, such as rice and morning glories, which she will sell to buyers every two or three months when the plants mature. 

Phin S. has a life partner in her husband who works in the construction field. The couple is married and has four kids; two are married and the other two are single and employed in different occupations.

 Phin S. is concerned that her house is small and narrow, and it is so hard for her and her family to live in. In order to deal with this issue, Phin S. would like to request a loan to add to her savings to build a new wooden house which will be bigger than at the present time.

loans.use: To build a new wooden house.

loans.name: Jesus Esta Aqui 3 Group

texts.en:
Margarita is the coordinator of his group, Jesus está Aquí (Jesus is Here). Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally. Her group is located in the slums that ring the capital city. Here, crime is rampant and running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children.

Margarita is excited to be taking her 4th loan with Esperanza, a Kiva partner, after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling tennis and casual shoes by purchasing 4 crates of tennis shoes to sell in her community. She will use the profits to finish building her home. She started with some of her savings and now she is planning to dedicate her benefits to the house. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy tennis and casual shoes

loans.name: Travis

texts.en:
Travis J. is a partnering owner for 3G Contracting, a residential and commercial construction firm.  3G Contracting does everything from roofing, to paving, to indoor remodeling, just to name of a few of their specialties.  After just two years in business, 3G contracting has already received over 300 commissioned projects.  

The biggest difficulty 3G Contracting faces is maintaining its cash flow.  After being denied a loan at a commercial bank due to insufficient credit history, Travis came to ACCION Texas-Louisiana for financing.  This loan is helping Travis and his partner move two of their part-time employees to full-time, as well as helping them acquire another pickup truck for the business. 3G Contracting has five employees, three of whom will now be working full-time. 

Running the business from a home office, Travis’ wife handles 3G Contracting’s administrative and clerical duties.  With Travis and his wife both working full-time for the company, 3G Contracting supports four families.  3G Contracting’s goal for this year is to increase revenues by 30%.  

Check out the website at www.3gcontracting.com.

loans.use: to hire full-time employees and acquire vehicle for business.

loans.name: Ching's Group

texts.en:
Nine people make up this village bank loan. Mr. Ching, who was born in 1961, is a village bank president. He was selected to be the village bank president by the other members of the group. 

Mr. Ching's wife, Mrs. Yeoun, was born in 1962. She stays at home and cooks the family's meals. This couple has eight children; four are seamstresses in the garment factories and the others attend the local school.

Mr. Ching is a motorbike taxi driver who is able to earn a small income to help support his family. He wants to buy a motorcycle for his children to ride to work, but he doesn’t have enough money to buy it. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan to add to his savings to purchase a new motorcycle for his children's transportation.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle for his children's transportation

loans.name: Zarbibi

texts.en:
M. Zarbibi is 54 years old. She is a purposeful woman who is married and has 10 children. Zarbibi is engaged in trading and she started her business with glass vases and clothes. Today she sells flour in the market of Dehqon. She heard about Imon International from other businessmen. In the future she would like to cooperate with Imon International in order to expand her business and open her own store. Zarbibi would like to get a loan of 8000 Somoni for purchasing flour and expansion of her business. 
   
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy flour.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 34 years old.  She is married to Livingstone, who is a farmer. She has been a maize farmer for the past five years, and has a monthly income of KES 3,000. She was introduced to KADET by a registered client.

Janet has been a good client who repays her loan well. This is her fourth loan with KADET.  She plans to use this loan to purchase maize seeds and fertilizers. She hopes to generate profits from the loan, which will be used to expand her farm from small-scale to large-scale commercial farming.

She hopes that her children will have a good future.

loans.use: purchase maize seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa, a 55-year-old married mother of seven children,  earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, an enterprise she has had for three years. She earns additional income from selling vegetables. Elsa, who is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money to be able to send her children to college, is requesting a loan of PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and additional piglets.

loans.use: to buy feeds and additional piglets.

loans.name: Rafael Arturo

texts.es: El señor Rafael , es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa la mayor afectación que se le presenta son la alza de los productos y la impuntualidad de pagos de sus clientes , los planes hacia un futuro es poder mejorar las condiciones de vida , el financiamiento lo quiere para la compra de pacas de ropa de segunda y así vender , ya que la ropa nueva muy poco la vende . Agradece la confianza que le brinda Afodenic atrávez de los fondo Kiva para mejorar las condiciones de vida y crecer como comerciante .
texts.en:
Rafael lives in the town of Ticuantepe together with his wife.  The biggest problems that he faces in his business are rising product prices and customers who don't pay on time.  His plans for the future are to improve his living conditions.

Rafael would like this loan to buy bundles of second-hand clothes to sell, since he doesn't sell very many new clothes.  He is grateful for the trust that Afodenic are placing in him by providing him with access to Kiva funds in order to improve his living conditions and grow as a salesman.

loans.use: to buy bundles of clothes to sell

loans.name: Baatarjav

texts.en:
Baatarjav lives with his wife and son in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Uvs province of Mongolia. His son, age 23, is a driver who manages his own taxi service business. His son earns 100,000 MNT in a month. 

Baatarjav runs a shoe making business with the help of his wife. They make variety of Mongolian traditional shoes for all ages. With 21 years in operation they have been able to stabilize their business and built a strong customer base. 

They used to live in someone else's backyard. However with their earnings, they managed to buy a plot of land where they are planning to build a house in the future. Also they have managed to buy a car for their family use. 

Their business revenue is vital source of income for their family. He is a hardworking man who is planning to have a workshop in the future. 

He says, "Our car was burnt recently. So we needed to buy a new car. Moreover my wife has been ill for several months and we spent lots of money for her treatment. So I need a loan to increase my working capital now." He is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase materials

loans.name: Julia Felicitas

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “CHOQUEQUIRAO”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Huanchac, Provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Junia; la socia tiene 42 años; la socia es casada y tiene 2 hijos;  La socia es contadora de profesión y  trabaja en una institución privada, la socia desea el crédito para invertir en su salud, ella requiere ir a un centro odontológico para tratarse los dientes, la socia desea el crédito para invertir en la atención de sus dientes. La socia solicita el préstamo  para invertir en su salud. 

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the "Choquequirao" communal bank, located in the district of Huanchac, province and department of Cusco.

The borrower's name is Ms. Julia. She is 42 years old, married, and has two children. She is an accountant by profession and works at a private business. She would like a loan to invest in her health. She needs to go to a dental center to receive treatment for her teeth. She would like a loan to pay for the dental work. She is requesting the loan to invest in her health.

Julia is very satisfied with and grateful for the support that is being offered to her with this loan, and she promises to repay her debts according to the established terms.

loans.use: to pay for necessary dental work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Aivengo

texts.en:
Aivengo lives in the village of Natanebi, West Georgia. He is 65 years old and married. He lives with his wife Liana, 28-year-old son, daughter-in-law, and 4-year-old granddaughter.

Aivengo and Liana lead the agricultural business of the family. They have four milk cows and produce on average 80 kg of cheese per month to sell at a local open market. Along with the dairy, the income source of the family is tangerine and vegetable growing. They sell the harvested tangerines and vegetables locally. Average total income of the family is 900 Georgia Laris (GEL) per month. 

Aivengo requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and to treat his plants for parasites. At the end of the season, the family will get good harvest and sell it for a convenient price. Aivengo and Leila plan to reinvest part of the received profit in the agriculture and use the rest for financing daily family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and to treat his plants for parasites.

loans.name: Hilary

texts.en:
Hilary is 51 years of age, married, and is blessed with nine children. Most of his children are sent to college. His wife is a teacher and works also as a housekeeper.

Managing a large crop of rice is the main source of income for Hilary. Through profits in farming, he helped his wife provide for their children's school fees. He always dreams that his children will finish their education and find work someday.

Sometimes, Hilary encountered financial shortage and could not fully sustain the farm inputs needed in farming like fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides.  That's why he is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides for his farm.  His goal is to harvest a better yield each year. With the help of this loan, he can supply the farm inputs needed for farming.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, insecticide and herbicide

loans.name: Aramayis

texts.ru:
Арамаис родился в 1960 г. в селе Верин Хотанан (Verin Khotanan), имеет техническое образование. Девятнадцать лет он прослужил  в армии и теперь получает служебную пенсию. Жена Арамаис работает в магазине, дочь замужем и живет отдельно от родителей, старший сын работает водителем, а младший учится в Ереванском Архитектурно-строительном университете. Также, вместе с Арамаисом, проживает его мать, которая тяжело больна. 
Сельским хозяйством в селе Верин Хотанан Арамаис занимается с 1996г. На своей ферме он выращивает овощи, разводит крупный рогатый скот, кур, а также занимается пчеловодством. Арамаис продает на Капанском городском рынке овощи, говядину, молоко, яйца и мед со своей фермы своим постоянным покупателям, и таким образом содержит свою семью. Арамаису приходится работать на ферме и ухаживать за своей больной матерью самостоятельно, так как остальные члены семьи либо работают по найму либо учатся. 
Арамаису необходим кредит на сумму 500,000 драм, для приобретения еще одной коровы, а также сена.
texts.en:
Aramayis was born in 1960 in the village of Verin Khotanan. He has a technical degree. He served in the army for 19 years and now receives a military pension. His wife works in a store; his daughter is married and lives separately; the oldest son works as a driver, and the younger is a student at the Erevan University for Architecture and Construction. Aramayis’ mother, who is severely ill, also lives with him.

Since 1996, Aramayis has been working as a farmer in the village of Vernin Khotanan. At his farm he grows vegetables raises cattle and poultry and also keeps bees. Aramayis sells vegetables, beef, milk, eggs and honey from his farm at the market of the town of Kapan, to his loyal customers. This is how he supports his family. Aramayis has to work at his farm and take care of his ailing mother on his own as the other family members are either employed elsewhere or study. Aramayis needs a loan of 500,000 AMD in order to buy an additional cow as well as hay.

loans.use: to buy one more cow and fodder for his farm animals

loans.name: Kiryanjagi Twimukyangane Group

texts.en: Joy is 32 years old and married with four children between 4 and 12 years old living in Kibaale, Uganda. She is a group member of the Kiryanjagi Twimukyangane Group where each member guarantees the other in acquiring a loan. She has been into farming for four years and she is now a commercial farmer. Her challenge is the high costs of fertilizers and her dream is to practice mechanized farming. Joy needs a loan to buy seeds.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam was born in 1983 and she lives with her mother, brother and sister-in-law in Yerevan. Her father works seasonally in the Russian Federation, which helps to cover his family’s needs. 

Mariam has danced for more than 14 years; she graduated from Sofi Devoyan’s Soul and Dance Theatre and she has a dance teacher certificate.  Besides dance, Mariam worked as a floral designer for more than 7 years. She says it is a very interesting and pleasing occupation, but not very profitable – so she decided to start her own business.  She now rents a stall in the Yerevan Jeweler’s market, where she sells gold and silver wares which are produced by her brother in their home. At the same time, she is taking accounting courses in order to develop her knowledge of the economy which will help her in her business. Thanks to the jewelry trade Mariam and her family have solved the problem of meeting all their needs.

She is asking for a $3000 loan to buy gold for producing and selling.

loans.use: To buy gold for producing and selling

loans.name: Socorro

texts.es:
La señora socorro tiene 46 años de edad y está casada con el señor caricio, con el cual tiene 4 hijos, Emanuel, Yesica, miguel Ángel y Moisés, de los cuales solo 2 estudian, están cursando el primer y segundo año de prepa, ya que los otros dos están casados, ella va a iniciar con una frutería.
Dice que decidió invertir en esta actividad, porque quiere ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, ya que ve trabajaba demasiado en el campo y no gana lo suficiente, para tener una buena solvencia económica, también para continuar apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios, para que puedan tener una muy buena carrera profesional, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de jitomates, chiles, cebollas, papas, zanahorias, plátanos, manzanas, duraznos, naranjas, etc. para así iniciar con el negocio.
Una de las metas que tiene para su negocio, es la de hacerla crecer muchísimo, ya que está pensando en mas a delante construir un local, para ampliar su frutería y tener más surtida su tienda, ya que así mejorara e incrementara mucho mas sus ingresos, ya que estos les serán de mucha utilidad, puesto que seguirá apoyando a su esposo e hijos.
Le da las gracias a fundación realidad y a los donadores de kiva, por todo el apoyo y confianza que le están brindando, ya que esto le srvira de mucho, puesto que ahora puede continuar invirtiendo en su negocio y apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
46-year old Señora Socorro is married to Señor Caricio and they have four children, Emanuel, Yesica, Miguel Ángel, and Moisés. Two of the children are at school (one in primary and the other in high school), while the other two children are married. Socorro is planning to open a fruit and vegetable stand.

She decided on this venture to help her husband with household expenses. She sees him working too hard in the countryside and not earning much money. She wants to ensure there is enough money to pay for their children’s education so that they can get good jobs.

Socorro plans to use the loan money to buy tomatoes, chilis, onions, potatoes, carrots, bananas, apples, peaches, oranges etc. for her new business. One of her goals is to see the business grow. In the future she is thinking of building a permanent stand for the fruit and vegetables and keeping it well-stocked. In this way she would earn more money which would be very useful in her goal of helping her husband and children.

She is grateful to Fundación Realidad and to Kiva’s donors for all their support and trust. The loan will help her greatly achieve her goals of expanding her business and supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, chilis, onions, potatoes, carrots, bananas, apples, peaches, oranges etc.

loans.name: Saa'di

texts.en: Saa'di is a 52-year-old man who is married and has five sons and one daughter. All of his sons are workers with decent salaries and his daughter is a university student. Saa'di has worked in agriculture for 10 years. He wants to prepare for the winter season agriculture by purchasing seedlings and necessary fertilizers, but the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay. So he needs to take a loan of $3,000 from FATEN. When Saa'di gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will be able to purchase seedlings and fertilizers. This will enable him to prepare well for the upcoming winter season, to have a successful crop and increase his income to live in better conditions. Saa'di is photographed in his project.

loans.use: To purchase seedlings and fertilizers .

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools to open his auto repair shop.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Nida works hard to support her family.

She buys and sells sea shells in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing.  

Nida is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase more sea shells to sell.

Nida has been sustaining her business and paid back 16 loans from NWTF.  

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sea shells to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more tailoring material (cloths, lappers(traditional cloths) , and a new sewing machine) to expand his business.

loans.name: Hinemoa

texts.en:
Hinemoa is 44 years old and she is a widow with 3 children. She owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale.  She has many years of experience in this business. She needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Hinemoa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Hinemoa's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Omar

texts.fr: Monsieur Omar vit au Sénégal et est âgé d’une quarantaine d’années. Il est marié et père de 4 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 7 mois et 13 ans. Il s’active depuis deux ans dans  la vente de poulets. Il a choisi cette activité a cause de sa rentabilité. Ce qui l’intéresse  le plus ce sont les revenus qui lui sont procurés ainsi que l’expérience qu’il acquiert dans ce domaine. Il est membre de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis avril 2006. Il a déjà remboursé 2 prêts antérieurs. Il sollicite un crédit de 500 000 prévus pour l’achat de poulets destinés à la vente en vue de renforcer son stock. L’accroissement de ses bénéfices lui permet de mieux supporter  les besoins quotidiens de sa famille.
texts.en: Omar, in his forties, lives in Senegal. He is married and has 4 children between the ages of 7 months and 13. He has been selling chickens for 2 years. He chose this activity because it was profitable. What matters most to him is the income and the experience he is getting in this field. He has been a member of a branch of U-IMCEC since April 2006. He has already paid 2 loans back. He is applying for a 500 000 loan so that he can increase his stock of chicken, which he will then resell. An increase in his profits will enable him to better meet the daily needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy chickens he will resell.

loans.name: Winnyrose

texts.en:
Winnyrose is a resident of Litein and has been farming for six years. She currently produces milk and tea for the local markets.

Winnyrose has requested a second loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow to boost her dairy farming business. She says the skills she has acquired in farming will help her in managing her cows in order to reap the best benefits from her business. Her main aim is to pay for the education of her two children and to improve her family's standard of living through the provision of basic needs.

She states the major challenge is the unreliable artificial insemination services for cows, which makes determination of breeds production capacity quite difficult. She is happy though with Juhudi Kilimo loan services.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 44-year-old businessman, married to Lucy, a businesswoman, and blessed with three children. He has been selling cereals for the past ten years with a monthly income of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his first loan which is an asset loan from KADET LTD after being introduced to KADET LTD by a staff member. David will use the loan to buy a water tank to store water for family use. 

His hopes and dreams are to educate his children up to university level and improve the family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Houenoussou 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement HOUENOUSSOU 1 est formé de onze personnes qui habitent toutes dans le même quartier et mènent des activités complémentaires. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Élisabeth, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Élisabeth est âgée de 39 ans et mariée à un certain Thomas. Le couple a six enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux restent à leur charge. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Il y a plusieurs années que Élisabeth mène comme activité la vente des ustensiles de cuisines et des produits divers à son domicile et par le système de distribution. Élisabeth s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la troisième fois que Élisabeth sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe HOUENOUSSOU 1, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Houenoussou 1 Group is made up of eleven people who all live in the same neighbourhood and run complementary businesses.  The representative of the group, Élisabeth, is 39-years-old and married to a man named Thomas.  The couple has six children who are all in school, of whom two remain dependents. The couple work together to provide for the various household expenses.  The children live together with their parents. 

For many years, Élisabeth has been doing business selling kitchen utensils and various other products from her home through a distribution system.  Élisabeth buys her stock at a market in Bénin.  This is the third time that she has asked for a loan along with the other members of the Houenoussou 1 Group via ALIDé.  The previous loans were properly repaid.

loans.use: to purchase kitchen utensils and other products.

loans.name: Boucotte Sindian Group

texts.fr: Ce banc villageois de Boucotte Sindian est inauguré le 29 mars 2002 suite à la bonne entente dans le quartier.Madame Dieynaba à droite de la photo la main levée est la représentante du groupe.Mariée et sans enfant, elle s’active dans ce commerce de vente de légumes depuis plusieurs années au marché et à domicile.Ce crédit lui permet de développer d'avantage son activité et les bénéfices à la prise en charge des frais de nourriture de la famille.
texts.en:
This banc villageois, Boucotte Sindian, was created on March 29, 2002 after harmony came to the area. 

Madame Dieynaba, with her hand raised at the right of the photo, is the group representative. She is married and has no children. She has been selling vegetables for a number of years at the market and out of her home. 

This loan will help her further develop her business, and the and the profits will allow her to take care of expenses for food and for her family.

loans.use: buy vegetables.

loans.name: Jorge Yovani

texts.en:
My name is Jorge F.. I am dedicated to the sale of women\'s shoes. I have had my own business for three years which generates income to support my family. I already have very good clients and my business is located in the center of the city. My goal is to increase my inventory in order to have more variety of shoes and to have profits to support my family and pay for the studies of my son who is old enough to enter school.

Loan use: Purchase of slippers, sandals and shoes

Mi nombre es Jorge F. me dedico a la venta de zapatos para damas, tengo mi negocio hace 3 años y este me genera ingresos para el mantenimiento de mi familia, tengo muy buenos clientes ya que mi lugar de trabajo es en el centro de la ciudad, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para poder tener mas variedad de zapatos y con las ganancias que tenga poder mantener mi familia y el estudio de mi hijo que ya tiene la edad para ingresar a la escuela.

loans.use: compra de chancletas, sandalias, zapatos

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en: P. lives in Dodowa in the Dangme West district of the Greater Accra Region. She sell babies' wear, towels, pomades, rubber bowls, and so on. She sells in the community's market and carrying goods into and out of the market every day is a problem. She wants to open her own shop where she can sell her goods. She is seeking a loan of $775 from Kiva to enable her do so.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Maitida

texts.en: Maitida is 32 years old and is married with two (2) children. She sells rubber plastics to people in her community. She hails from Benin, Edo State, Nigeria. She wishes to borrow $400 for business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more plastics for sales

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
MERCEDES IS 44 YEARS OLD AND SHE LIVES IN UNION LIBRE. SHE HAS 3 SONS. SHE AND HER SPOUSE OPERATE A SMALL RESTAURANT OUT OF AN ADAPTED ROOM IN THEIR HOUSE, SERVING HOME-MADE FOOD TO OTHER RESIDENTS OF THE SECTOR. SHE BELONGS TO GROUP CHIFLON 2, WHICH ALSO HAS ROSARIO NAJERA PEREZ - A CEMENT BLOCK SALESWOMAN. MERCEDES PLANS TO USE THE LOAN TO BETTER EQUIP HER RESTAURANT AND TO PURCHASE ADDITIONAL KITCHENWARE. ROSARIO WISHES TO INVEST HER PART OF THE LOAN TO INCREASE THE NUMBER OF CEMENT BLOCK MOLDERS SO THAT SHE CAN INCREASE HER SALES.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer.

MERCEDES TIENE 44 AÑOS VIVE EN UNION LIBRE Y TIENE 3 HIJOS JUNTO CON SU PAREJA TIENEN EN SU CASA UN LUGAR HABILITADO COMO PEQUEÑO RESTAURANT DONDE VENDEN COMIDAS CASERAS A LAS PERSONAS DEL SECTOR.ELLA PERTENECE AL GRUPO CHIFLON 2 JUNTO CON ROSARIO NAJERA PEREZ ( VENDE BLOCKS DE CEMENTO ). CON EL PRESTAMO MERCEDES QUIERE INSTALAR UN RESTAURANT MEJOR HABILITADO Y COMPRAR IMPLEMENTOS DE COCINA , EN CAMBIO ROSARIO ESPERA CON SU PARTE DEL PRESTAMO COMPRAR MAS MATERIAL PARA AUMENTAR LA CANTIDAD DE MOLDES QUE NECESITA PARA MEJORAR SUS VENTAS.

loans.use: TIENDA DE COMIDA

loans.name: Alim

texts.en:
15 years ago, Alim started this business. He is 56 years old, married, and has 5 children. He lives with his family in Salyan region in Khaladj village.
He is requesting a loan of US$1200 to purchase fertilizer and pesticides for improving his farming.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides so as to increase his yield

loans.name: Pa Chernor

texts.en: Pa Chernor is married with five children.  He owns a small tea and coffee shop in Mabgburaka town.  With his previous loans Pa Chernor was able to purchase more thermos flasks and cups for the business.  He also can now purchase sugar, tea, and coffee on wholesale and this has increased his sales and profit.  He would like to expand his business and rent a decent place for the shop.  Pa Chernor will complete his current loan repayment next month, and is requesting for a larger loan of $175.

loans.use: Increase his stock of tea and coffee to attract additional customers.

loans.name: Dyrlyd

texts.es:
Dyrlyd is 34 years old. She is a single mother and has one young son. She has her store (which she opened five years ago) in the market of San Lorenzo, but she also travels to different cities in order to sell her products. She buys and sells general merchandise such as teddy bears, frames, clothes, handbags, etc

The loan that she is requesting will be used to buy more merchandise for the year end. In the future she would like to expand her business and buy a house.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

La señorita Dyrlyd tiene 34 años, es soltera y madre de un hijo aún menor. Dyrlyd se dedica a la compra y venta de mercería en general como peluches, porta retratos, cuadros, carteras, ropas, etc.

DYRLYD tiene su local en el mercado de San Lorenzo pero también sale a recorres diferentes ciudades llevando sus productos para venderlos. Hace ya cinco años que abrió su propio local.

El crédito solicitado será destinado para la compra de mas mercadería para fin de año. En el futuro ella desea ampliar su negocio y tener su propia casa.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as perfumes, teddy bears, frames, handbags, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Emilce

texts.es:
Mrs. Emilce Z. is 58 years old. She is a single mom of two daughters, one of them is 28 years old and is a teacher, and the other one is 17 and is studying the final year in high school. They both live with her.

Mrs. Emilce is the owner of a grocery store, which she started in 1988 with a small sum she had saved. She now has a well-established clientele because of the personalized attention and the good variety of products she offers to her customers.

Mrs. Emilce is requesting the loan to buy merchandise such as sweet bread, beverages in general, rice, pasta, vegetables, fruit, and fireworks because the end of the year is approaching and in this season there is an increase in the demand of those products.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La Señora Emilce Z. de 58 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijas, una de 28 años de edad que se encuentra ejerciendo la docencia y la otra de 17 años que esta cursando el último año del nivel medio, ambas viven con ella.

La señora es propietaria de una despensa la cual inició en el año 1988 con un pequeño ahorro con el que contaba. Ella ya cuenta con una clientela bien formada gracias a la atención personalizada y la buena variedad de productos que les otorga a sus clientes.

La clienta solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías como pan dulce, bebidas en general, arroz, fideos, verduras, frutas y la compra de juegos artificiales, ya que se acercan las fiestas de fin de año y en esta época aumenta la demanda de dichos productos.

loans.use: buying merchandise such as sweet bread, beverages in general, rice, pasta, vegetables, fruit, and fireworks  (Para la compra de bebidas en general, compra de pan dulce, compra de arroz, compra de fideos, compra de verduras, frutas, compra de juegos artificiales)

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi T., 28 years old, despite being young, is very determined to invest in making votive objects, which not many people would want to do. At first, she confronted lots of pressure from many people, even when she decided to join the Fund. However, they are now sympathetic with her. They say : “She knows what the customers like and she has a good heart for doing this business.” Her business is going very well and she has more and more customers, especially at the end of the year. Her husband currently does not have so many building projects and therefore, he stays at home to help her. When we came to visit, they gladly welcomed us and provided us details about their business. To think about it carefully, her activity is not too bad and worthy since it helps improving her family life. This time, Mrs. T. wants to borrow 950 USD to buy more bamboo and construction paper.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Là thành viên trẻ nhưng chị Nguyễn Thị T., 28 tuổi, đã mạnh dạn vay vốn đầu tư vào mặt hàng mà không nhiều người muốn làm, làm hàng mã. Lúc đầu có rất nhiều sức ép từ những người xung quanh, ngay cả khi chị xin tham gia vào Quỹ, nhưng dần dần mọi người đã hiểu và thông cảm. "rất tâm lý với khách hàng và có cái tâm làm phúc" là ý kiến nhận xét của mọi người khi đến với chị. Công việc của thuận lợi, khách hàng đến với ngày càng đông, nhất là những dịp cuối năm nên chị tất bật suốt ngày. Chồng chị đã vãn công việc xây dựng cuối năm và ở nhà giúp chị trong công việc. Anh chị vui vẻ và niềm nở tiếp chúng tôi và cũng không dấu diếm kể về công việc đặc biệt của mình. Thiết nghĩ: Trong thời buổi kinh tế thị trường, khi đời sống được cải thiện thì công việc của chị cũng là một nghề thu nhập chính đáng. Vòng vốn tới chị T. xin vay 950USD để mua thêm tre, giấy làm hàng.

loans.use: Buy bamboo, paper to make votive objects

loans.name: Pen

texts.en: Mrs. Pen K., 42, is a widow with three children, and owns a plot of farmland where she grows rice. She typically earns $1 a day. One of her daughters is employed by a garment factory, earning a salary of $80 a month, and one other works as a logger, earning $60 a month. She plans to use the loan from Kiva to expand her business by purchasing good rice seed to grow in the next season. In the future, when she has enough capital she will renovate the house.

loans.use: To purchase good rice seed.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana Z. is married with one daughter. She lives in downtown Primorsk and sells women’s clothing and men’s footwear at the central city market. The type of merchandise she sells is designed for middle-aged office workers. Tatyana’s inventory always sells well thanks to its good quality and an assortment of affordable inventory. Currently, her turnover capital is about $3000. Her monthly net profit is about $1000.

Tatyana is an entrepreneur of integrity with long experience working in this sphere of trade. Moreover, she’s very communicative and outgoing. Today, Tatyana is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase additional merchandise and possibly open an additional vending location in the future. We believe Tatyna’s professionalism, which has always been one of the most important keys to successful entrepreneurship, will help her reach her goals and repay this loan on time.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purshase Stock

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel is the mother of 5 young children. She and her husband work diligently for their family’s well-being. They grow guanabana (soursop) fruit for a living, but they would like to improve their annual production so that they can use the profits to increase next year’s crops.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Isabel, es madre de cinco pequeños niños y en compañía de su amado esposo se desempeña con mucha diligencia para otorgarles bienestar, siembran guanábanas y su deseo es mejorar su producción anual para destinar las ganancias al incremento de productos para su próximo siembra.

loans.use: Improve quality and increase quantity of guanabana (soursop) fruit

loans.name: Dilsa

texts.es:
Dilsa Diaz Y. is a member of the "Las Flores" Communal Bank. she lives in the San Martín region, in the Rioja province, district of Rioja. Her business is located at Jiron Atahualpa, block 4, and she sells straw which is used to make hats, purses and other objects.

The idea for this business came from her husband, who realized how much in demand this material was and that she could generate her own income, improving the family´s economy. With much effort she has been able to increase her business and gain the admiration and acceptance of many customers.

With a loan of 500 soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy straw from farms. Later she will process the straw and send it to her customers - both those on the coast as well as in her region of the country - in accordance with what they have ordered.

Dilsa is 29 years old. Every day she works to prove she is an enterprising woman who meets her goals, and that they can be reached with hard work and dedication. In the future, she plans to have a grocery store and to be a wholesaler.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Dilsa Diaz Y., es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Flores” vive en la región San Martín, provincia de Rioja y distrito de Rioja, su negocio está ubicado en el jr Atahualpa cuadra 4, se dedica a la venta de paja para la fabricación de sus derivados como los sombreros, carteras, y demás objetos a base de este material.

La idea del negocio surgió de su esposo por que se dio cuenta que es un material muy requerido, y que generaría sus propios ingresos, mejorando la economía de su hogar , con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado incrementar su negocio, habiendo ganado el aprecio y la acogida de una gran clientela.

Con el préstamo recibido de S/.500.00, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará paja en las chacras para luego procesarlo y enviarlo a sus clientes de acuerdo a los pedidos que hacen al por mayor, tanto a sus clientes de la costa como de la misma región.

La señora Dilsa tiene 29 años, quien trabaja diariamente demostrando que es una mujer emprendedora y que para cumplir sus metas, se puedan alcanzar con esfuerzo y dedicación, en el futuro piensa tener una tienda de abarrotes y ser mayorista.

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of straw.

loans.name: Frida

texts.en:
Frida is a divorced woman with 1 child aged 17. She became a drinks and clothes seller in 2008. Every day, she works from 6am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $30 from her sales.

Frida now hopes for a loan to buy more drinks items and clothes for her business.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Dafne

texts.es:
Dafne dreams of owning her own restaurant and studying for a career in business administration. She is 20 years old, single, and belongs to the community bank, “Las Candelarias II” in Huaraz. Currently she is working in a “cebichería”, a restaurant that serves the popular Peruvian dish of marinated raw fish known as cebiche. In addition to being in charge of the business, she also sells cosmetic products. She tells us that with the sale of these cosmetics, she is able to make 100 soles per week and is saving that amount in order to be able to study, since her parents do not have the necessary resources to pay for her schooling. With the loan of 500 soles which she will repay in 4 installments, she will buy hand cream, perfumes, earrings and make-up to have on hand when customers ask for them.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer.

Dafne, con 20 años de edad pertenece Banco Comunal “Las Candelarias II” de Huaraz, sueña con tener su propio restaurante y estudiar la carrera de Administración de Empresas, ya que es soltera. Por el momento ella trabaja en una cebichería de la ciudad de Huaraz, como encargada del local, pero también vende productos cosméticos. Ella nos dice que con la venta de estos productos cosméticos, obtiene una ganancia semanal de 100 soles, la cual esta ahorrando para poder estudiar ya que sus padres no cuentan con los recursos necesarios para sus estudios. Con el préstamo de S/ 500 soles y que pagará en 4 cuotas, comprara cremas para manos, perfumes, aretes y artículos para maquillaje que lo mantendrá en reserva para cuando sus clientes lo soliciten.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetic products.

loans.name: Zokhra

texts.en: Zokhra Quliyev is a 44 year old loving mother of three children. Zokhra breeds calves for meat production, and she has been in this business from a very young age. As her parents were also farmers, a hard life pushed her to follow the same business. She took this business in hand and it has started to provide her with an income. As it is only one financial source for her family, she tries very hard to keep the calves in good condition. Also, her husband is very polite to his clients who buy meat. Zokhra is planning to expand her business via the purchase of 3 calves for 300 USD each and 100 USD for feed. She believes that you can help her to improve her life.

loans.use: To purchase 3 calves and feed

loans.name: Phem

texts.en: Mrs. Phem N., a 59-year-old widow with four children, one of whom is a bodyguard while the remaining three are attending the local school, lives in Prey Khla Tboung Village in Takeo Province.  Phem owns a plot of land upon which she cultivates rice for a living, but she currently lacks sufficient funds to hire a laborer to plow the rice field. She is therefore requesting a loan for this purpose and to purchase fertilizers and pesticides to support her crop.

loans.use: To hire a laborer to plow her rice field and to purchase fertilizers and pesticides to support her crop.

loans.name: Kponkou Sokémawou

texts.fr: Célibataire sans enfant, Mr K. S. a cinq (05) personnes à charges. Chauffeur de son état, il vit actuellement dans la ville d’Aného. Malgré ses efforts, son métier de chauffeur n’arrive plus à lui procurer de revenus suffisants pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Alors il sollicite ce crédit pour acheter un moulin à piments et tomates pour augmenter son revenu afin de pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Unmarried and without children, Mr. S. K. has five people in his care. A chauffeur, he currently lives in the city of Aného. Despite his efforts, his job driving vehicles is no longer able to bring in enough income to provide for his family. So he is requesting this loan to buy grinder for chili peppers and tomatoes to increase his income. He can then provide for his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a machine for grinding tomatoes and chilis

loans.name: Tania Lissette

texts.es: La Sra. Tania tiene 43 años de edad, habitante del barrio Hialeah en la capital de Managua, casada, tiene dos preciosos hijos el varón de de 11 años de edad y la joven de 15 años de edad. Su trabajo en la actualidad es su pequeño negocio de lácteos, venta de fritos, chicharrón y cosméticos lo posee desde hace doce años, Sus planes es terminar la construcción de su casa para ofrecerle seguridad y protección a su familia. En el ámbito económico captar nuevos clientes y comercializar nuevos productos. Agracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograr comprar materiales de construcción como: cementos, hierro y madera para terminar de hacer su casa
texts.en:
Ms. Tania R. is a married, 43-year-old woman who lives in the Hialeah neighborhood of the capital city of Managua. She has two precious children: an eleven-year-old son and a 15 year-old daughter. She has a small business, which she has been running for two years, in which she sells dairy products, fried snacks, pork rinds and cosmetics. She plans to finish building her house so that she can offer her family more safety. In the financial sphere, she would like to gain new customers and offer new products. With the loans from Afodenic, she would like to buy construction supplies such as cement, iron and lumber in order to finish building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction supplies to finish building her house

loans.name: Sreiny

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreiny V. was born in 1982 and she now lives in Kanthorm village in Kampong Speu province. She is a garment factory worker who earns a small salary to support the family. Her husband, Mr. Muy Reourn, is a construction worker, who also earns a small income to support the family.

Although they try to work hard, they still earn less income than they need to support the family. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Sreiny V. is requesting a loan to buy a cow to start a breeding business.

loans.use: Buy a cow to start breeding business to improve living conditions

loans.name: Noem

texts.en: Mrs. Noem M.,41, lives in Roung village in Takeo province. She cultivates rice on a piece of land she owns. Her husband, Mr. Chhil Sao, is a laborer. Even though they try to work hard, they still earn less income to provide a better life for their family living and they usually pay much money to travel to the local market, work place and so on. In order to reduce Mrs. Noem M.’s expenses, she is requesting a loan to buy a motorbike for her family's use. She has four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, two are attending the local school and one stays at home. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy a motorbike for her family' use

loans.name: Cusco Sur Group

texts.es:
Este banco se denomina "CUSCO SUR", fundado hace 8 años, permitiendo el desarrollo D. miembros antiguos hasta la actualidad y ellos siguen agrupando a nuevos socios, para darles también la oportunidad que ellos tuvieron, este banco está ubicado en las oficinas centrales en la ciudad del Cusco.

Los miembros integrantes D. este banco, son artesanos D. la zona sur D. la ciudad del Cusco, ellos son 18 miembros  05 mujeres y 13 varones; quienes alternan sus actividades con la elaboración D. artesanía y la exposición D. sus trabajos, el dinero que ellos recaudan les permite llevar a sus hogares una mejor alimentación y alcanzar una educación más justa para sus menores hijos; estos socios llevan en su sangre una técnica ancestral heredada desD. sus antepasados, la cuál plasman en sus obras y permite así seguir cultivando la cultura y trasmitirla año a año.

Nuestros socios, son gente trabajadora y cumplida, por lo que se comprometen a devolver el préstamo que se les otorga en el tiempo determinado, a su vez agradecen su apoyo y el hecho D. soñar con la realización D. sus proyectos.
texts.en:
This bank is called "Cusco Sur" (South Cusco), and was founded 8 years ago, enabling the development of its original members up until the current day, and they continue to acquire new members, so that they too can have the opportunities that the others had. This bank is located in the central offices in the city of Cusco. The eighteen members of this bank are artists from the southern part of the city of Cusco. There are five women and thirteen men and they take turns creating their art and showing it for sale. The money they make allows them to bring home better food and to achieve a more just education for their younger children. These members carry in their blood an ancient skill inherited from their ancestors which shapes their works and allows them to continue creating their culture and transmitting it year after year. Our members, as they are hard-working and accomplished, are committed to paying back the loan that is granted to them in the specified period. They appreciate your support of their dreams of accomplishing their projects.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials for their artwork

loans.name: Gloria Amparo

texts.es:
GLORIA AMPARO H. P., pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Fortaleza” su casa se ubica en el Jr. 28 de Julio Mz. 63 Lt. 10 Barrio Nuevo – Tushmo del Distrito de Yarinacocha, tiene 53 años, 05 hijos, su esposo se encuentra actualmente convaleciente, debido a un accidente.

El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, le sirvió para comprar un poco de abarrotes y algunas verduras que los ofreció en su casa y así empezó su negocio que con el tiempo fue incrementándose.

El préstamo de S/.2,100.00 Nuevos Soles,  ha planeado invertir en compra de abarrotes la mitad y la otra mitad en una actividad que realiza todos los fines de semana, venta de pollos a la parrilla en Yarinacocha, una actividad muy rentable, con el que está sosteniendo su casa. 

Comenta que a Manuela Ramos le debe mucho, ya que prácticamente ha salvado la vida de su cónyuge, que cuando tuvo el accidente si no hubiera sido por un préstamo que le dieron no le habría sido posible comprar los medicamentos a tiempo.
texts.en:
GLORIA AMPARO H. P., 53, is a member of the communal bank “La Fortaleza” ("The Fortress"). She lives in the district of Yarinacocha with her husband, who is recovering from an accident. They have five children. The first loan that she received (300 soles) was used to purchase a few basic products and vegetables that she began selling at her home. This was the beginning of a business that has kept on growing. Gloria is requesting a new loan for 2,100 soles. She will use half of the loan to purchase products to stock her store, and the other half to invest in cooking and selling grilled chicken. This weekend activity has proven very profitable, and she is able to support her household. Gloria is very grateful to Kiva partner Manuela Ramos. She says that her husband's life was saved when she received a loan to purchase medicine for her husband after the accident.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock grocery store, purchase chickens to cook and sell.

loans.name: Angel Ricardo

texts.es: El señor Ángel Ricardo O. , tiene la edad de 30 años habita en el barrio San José de los Ríos , junto a su esposa la cual trabaja como domestica para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar ya que ello tienen a su cargo dos hijos un varón de seis años y una niña de diez los pequeños actualmente estudian , los planes hacia su familia es poder construir dos cuartos para que sus hijos puedan vivir mas cómodos , don Ángel desde hace 10 años trabaja como agricultor , la mayor dificultad que se le ha presentado es la falta de financiamiento y los gases del volcán que le afectan la floración , el inicio como agricultor con el apoyo de su papá quien desde pequeños le enseño como trabajar las tierra , el financiamiento lo va a invertir en para la compra de insumos y fertilizantes para obtener una cosecha mejor este año.
texts.en:
Señor Ángel Ricardo O. is 30-years-old and lives in the San José de los Ríos neighborhood. He lives with his wife, who works as a domestic employee to help him pay their home's expenses since they have two children: a 6-year-old boy and a 10-year-old girl. They are currently in school.
