Their plans for their family are to be able to construct two rooms so their children can live more comfortably. Don Ángel has worked in agriculture for 10 years. The most difficult thing he has faced is the lack of financing and the gases from the volcano, which affect the blooming period of his crops. He started as a farmer with the help of his father, who taught him how to work the land starting when he was young. He will invest this loan in the purchase of supplies and fertilizers so he can have a better harvest this year.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies to improve his production

loans.name: Pelenatete

texts.en:
Pelenatete F., 38, is married with three children. She has recently started working in the plantation business. She sells to the general public six days per week.

This is her first loan with SPBD, a Kiva partner. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 600 Tala (about $250). SPBD loans are Pelenatete’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and bush knives

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: La señora  NORMA A. es separada de su esposo actualmente no tiene hijos pero tiene dos sobrinos que los cuidas como si lo fueran. Ella  vive en una casa familiar que esta ubicado en la  calle: 9 de abril # 1302  en la zona Alto Chijini. La señora NORMA se dedica a la venta de Ají-no-moto (Condimento) y Nescafe (cafe instatntaneo) que lo realiza en el alrededor de la calle Beltrán, en la ciudad de El Alto; ella es vendedora ambulante por lo cual se acomoda en cualquier  lugar; la señora es antigua en la institución este es su octavo credito que saca en la institución, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de Aji-no-moto por mayor para la venta por raleo, la señora se dedica varios años a esa actividad, ella actualmente vive con la familia de su hermana  , ellos comparten los gastos de la familia. El mayor deseo de ellos es poder darles a su hijo una buena educación para que en un futuro sean personas de bien y responsables.
texts.en:
Ms. Norma A. is separated from her husband. She does not have any children, but she has two nephews that she takes care of as if they were her own. She lives in a family home in Alto Chijini. Ms. A. sells Aji-no-moto (MSG seasoning) and Nescafé instant coffee on Beltrán Street in the city of El Alto. She is a street vendor, which means that she sets up anywhere. Ms. A. is a senior member in this institute, and this is her eighth loan. The loan will be invested in purchasing Aji-no-moto wholesale to sell it retail. The client has been in business for several years. She currently lives with her sister’s family. They all share the family expenses. Their biggest wish is to be able to give their children a solid education so that they can grow up to be decent and responsible people in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seasoning and instant coffee

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Llamkasum que significa Trabajemos en quechua.
Victoria es separada, tiene 41 años y 4 hijos, Victoria viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende abarrotes en general, frutas, ropa y de las ferias compra cereales y animales menores, los cuales comercializa en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Victoria necesita un préstamo de 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de abarrotes.
Los sueños de Victoria son que sus hijos sean profesionales y aumentar su negocio.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Communal Bank Llamkasum, which means “Lets Work” in Quechua. Victoria is separated, 41 years old, and has 4 children. Victoria travels to the different regional markets where she sells general groceries, fruits, and clothing, and from the markets she purchases grains and small animals that she sells in the markets of the city of Ayacucho. Victoria needs a loan of 2100 PEN, money that will be invested in the purchase of groceries. Victoria dreams that her children become professionals and that she expands her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase groceries.

loans.name: Yolita

texts.es:
La señora Yolita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Señor de Los Milagros” que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Imicati, distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno.Tiene 36 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos, no tiene estudios de educación secundaria completa (1er grado) y vive en el Barrio Miguel Grau.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 3 años, con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00, el cual lo utilizo para su negocio de compra y venta de golosinas. 

Actualmente solicita un préstamo de S/. 3000.00, para poder invertir en su actual negocio la compra y venta de productos de la zona, papa, quinua, ocas, habas, chuño y otros.

Su mayor sueño es poder tener un criadero de ganado para que engorde y así pueda venderlos. A ella le gustan los ahorros y los encuentros de su Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Yolita is a member of the “Señor de Los Milagros” communal bank located in the Imicati community in Yunguyo District, Chucuito Province in the state of Puno. She is 36 years old, married and has 3 children. She attended school until the first year of high school and currently lives in the Miguel Grau neighborhood. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos organization for 3 years, with an initial loan of 300 Nuevos Soles which she used for her snack food business. Currently, she is requesting a loan of 3,000 Nuevos Soles to invest in her current business, which is the buying and selling of the area's products, such as potatoes, quinoa, oca (Andean tuberous root crop), beans, chuño (freeze-dried potatoes), etc. Her biggest dream is to be able to have a busines raising livestock to be able to sell. She likes saving and the meetings at her communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products such as potatoes, quinoa, oca (Andean tuberous root crop), beans, chuño (freeze-dried potatoes), etc.

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr: Cette femme est mariée et mère de 02 enfants, son mari est un plombier, le revenu de ce dernier ne couvre pas toutes les charges du foyer, pour l’aider elle a entamé le commerce de produits de première nécessité, elle veut agrandir ses marchandises pour mieux satisfaire ses clients. Pour cela elle sollicite un crédit pour acheter 5 sacs de maïs et divers produits de première nécessité.
texts.en:
Ms. D. is the married mother of two children. Her husband is a plumber, but his income does not cover all their household expenditures. To help him, she has begun selling basic staple goods. She wants to increase her stock in order to better meet the needs of her clients. To this end, she is requesting a loan to buy five sacks of corn and various basic foodstuffs.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of basic foodstuffs

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: Patricia G., de 37 años  de edad, Originaria del Municipio de Tecpan Guatemala, Casada con Octaviano T., tiene 6 hijos solteros, Ella Juntamente con su esposo, están trabajando para el sustento diario, y la superación de sus hijos se dedican a la venta de trajecitos de bebes, en diferentes tallas, lo distribuyen en diferentes talla, lo distribuyen en diferentes mercados municipales, desde hace 5 años, ha venido trabajando, con un capital, muy pequeño durante este año, a podido incrementar su venta en un 20%, por eso necesita, un refinanciamiento.  El sueño es seguir creciendo su negocio, mantener a su familia contentas, y seguir aprovechando, su buena salud, y cuando sea edad avanzada pueda autosostenerse.
texts.en:
Patricia G. is 37 years old and from the the municipality of Tecpan, Guatemala. She is married to Octaviano T. and has 6 sons who are still unmarried. Patricia, together with her husband, is working for her daily livelihood and support of her family in the sale of baby clothes, in different sizes, distributing them in different municipal markets. For the last 5 years she has been working with little capital, although this year she has increased her sales by 20% and because of this she needs refinancing. Her dream is to continue growing her business, keep her family happy, and continue to take advantage of her good health so that when she is older she will be able to sustain herself.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the sale of baby clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase merchandise wholesale for his shop

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
Lida C. is from the village of Salay, Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 36 years old. Lida is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Lida operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling bananas in the local community. Lida is just starting this business.

In 2009, Lida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lida is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Lida from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: Mohamed is a 49-year-old married man with five children. He has a barber shop in Hebron in Palestine. He is special in his work because his salon is well positioned. His clients are his friends and neighbors. He is requesting a loan of $2000 USD from Ryada to purchase supplies for his barber shop, such us combs, creams, mirrors, and gels, to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy supplies for his barber shop

loans.name: Lindis

texts.es: Lindis es una mujer trabajadora y  dinámica, vive cerca a la ciudad de Campo Verde, tiene 20 años y es madre de un hijo, se dedica a la crianza de aves, también vende yuca, plátanos y verduras, ella trabaja junto a su esposo. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Mujeres Trabajadoras de los pinos” desde hace un año y cuatro meses, el primer préstamo que obtuvo fue de 500 soles que invirtió en la compra de frutas de la región, en la actualidad necesita un crédito de 1200 soles que será utilizado en la compra de alimentos balanceados. La meta de Lindis es tener una tienda de prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Lindis is a dynamic, hardworking woman who lives near the town of Campo Verde. She is 20 years old and the mother of one child. She raises poultry in addition to selling cassava, plantains and vegetables. She and her husband work together.

Lindis has been a member of the Communal Bank “Las Mujeres Trabajadoras de los Pinos” (Working Women of the Pines) for a year and four months. Her first loan of 500 soles was used to buy regional fruits.

She currently needs a loan of 1200 soles to buy feed for her birds. Her goal is to open a clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy poultry feed

loans.name: Vai

texts.en: Mr. Vai D. is 28 years of age and currently lives in the province of Battambang, Cambodia. He is a married man and father of two school-aged kids. While his wife (she appears in photo) stays at home to sell a variety items for income. She sells like vegetables, pork, fruits, chicken, and other cooking ingredient for villagers. Vai D. owns a small pumping machine which he uses to pump sand from River to sell for a profit. Unfortunately, his machine often has broken down during the pumping process. To solve the problem, Vai D. requests a loan of US$1000 which he will use for repairing his broken machine and use the rest of the loan to help increase the capital of his wife’s business.

loans.use: For repairing his broken machine and use the rest of the loan to help increase the capital of his wife’s business

loans.name: Tserendorj

texts.en: Tserendorj B. is 27 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Uvs province in western Mongolia. He lives together with his family in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. His two young daughters, ages 2 and 5, are in kindergarten. B. manages a traditional Mongolian shoe making business in his town. He makes a variety of Mongolian and Buridian shoes that Mongolians wore in ancient times. B. started his business in 2002. He can produce about 40 pairs of shoes per month; he sells these shoes at the local market. His shoes are known for their good quality and comfort; this makes them very popular among his customers. In the future, B. hopes to expand his production capacity so he can keep up with growing demand for his shoes. He is requesting a 650,000 tugrug (~450 USD) loan, with which he will purchase fabric and other materials used in making his traditional shoes.

loans.use: purchasing fabric and other materials used in making his traditional shoes

loans.name: Nhorn

texts.en: Mrs. Nhorn N. lives in Si Sla village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice. She faces an obstacle with her plantation, because her field is infertile. Thus, Mrs. Nhorn N. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides, and she will use the rest of money to hire a laborer to plow the field. She is a widow with two children who are both laborers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticides, and a laborer to plow the field.

loans.name: Alphonse Wambua

texts.en:
Alphonse M. is married to Sera and they have two children, Elizabeth and Geoffrey.

The client was introduced to KADET through existing clients and has no previous credit history. Alphonse will use the loan to increase his stock of second-hand salon car tires. The area of the business is situated within the estates and has many customers. Alphonse will use the profits to expand the business and educate his children.

The client hopes to have a shop of new car tires, as he believes he is focused and determined.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: to increase the spare parts stock

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella M. is from the town of Maddurulug Enrile, Cagayan. She is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Estrella makes and sells food, primarily barbecue pork and chicken. Estrella is just starting this business.

In 2009, Estrella joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and giver her the ability to engage in business activities. Estrella is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Estrella from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 21 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.en:
D. Dilshod is married with five children. This is an average family in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. However, Dilshod is a unique entrepreneur. Together with his son he has been selling clothing in the central city market for about fifteen years. The secret of his success is simple: he tries not only to let his customers know the benefits of his products – he also creates a relationship with them, which brings them back again and again. However, he doesn’t want to stop where he is with his venture. Dilshod is seeking a loan of $2500 to re-stock merchandise in his store for the winter season. We believe that Dilshod’s desire to excel in pleasing his customers will determine his further success and encourage new customers to buy from him.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to re-stock merchandise for the winter season

loans.name: Batchuluun

texts.en:
N. Batchuluun is 51 years old and lives with his wife and two teenage sons in a house in the Arhangai province of central Mongolia. His wife works at a private company and both boys attend a local high school and help Batchuluun with his business.

Since 2000, Batchuluun has operated a household goods retail business and currently his working capital exceeds 2,000,000 tugrugs. In 2005, he began operating in a shipping container in the local market in addition to a small rented stand. Batchuluun has done well with his business because he takes note of what his customers want from him and, if he doesn't have it, he makes sure that he gets the products on his next purchasing trip.

Batchuluun would like to increase his capital in the future and better his family's quality of life. He is requesting a 3,200,000 tugrug loan in order to purchase a large amount of household goods related the the Tsaagansar, or Lunar New Year, celebrations.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of household goods

loans.name: Sherali

texts.ru: Нуров Шерали проживает в районе А. Джоми. Возраст, 42 года. Женат, имеет одного ребенка. Нуров Шерали животноводством занимается более 20 лет. Он откармливает и продает скот. Нуров Шерали разводит живоных в специально построенном месте. Кредит берет для закупа скота.
texts.en:
Sherali N. lives in the A. Jomi region. He is 42 years old; married with one child. Sherali has worked in animal husbandry for over 20 years. He fattens up and sells livestock. Sherali breeds the animals in a space build specifically for this purpose. He is requesting the loan to purchase cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Melyakova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase cattle

loans.name: Milton

texts.es:
Milton C. V. tiene 34 años, es casado, y  tiene dos hijos.  Vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.

El socio es  miembro de la ventanilla rural Calzado Solidario es un recinto que se encuentra a quince minutos del Cantón San Miguel en la vía a la costa.  Son 19 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura y la crianza de animales menores.

Milton trabaja en la agricultura para incrementar la economía de la familia.  Los cultivos que más sobresalen son el maíz, papas y cría de aves.  Vende los productos en la feria de San Miguel y en su casa, también es chofer profesional.

La cultura principal es el carnaval que se celebra todos los años en febrero.  También, a Milton le gusta cuidar a los animales.

Milton solicita el crédito para comprar insumos para el trabajo del campo.  Su meta es tener una buena actividad económica para la familia.  Los desafíos que enfrenta son los problemas climáticos y las enfermedades que afectan a los cultivos.
texts.en:
Milton C. V. is 34 years old, married, and has two children. He lives in the District of San Miguel, which lies in the Province of Bolívar. Milton is a member of the Communal Bank “Calzado Solidario”, which meets in an enclosed area 15 minutes away from the District of San Miguel along the coast. There are a total of 19 members in the group, which is composed mainly of farmers and livestock breeders.

Milton works as a farmer in order to improve his family’s financial situation. He grows corn and potatoes and also raises poultry. His products are sold at the San Miguel Fair and from his home. Milton also works as a professional chauffeur.

The main cultural event is Carnival, which is celebrated every year during the month of February. Milton also enjoys taking care of his animals. He is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies for his farm. His goal is to generate good economic activity that will support his family. The main challenges that he faces are climate problems and diseases that impact his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase farming supplies

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Marcela, de 38 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Omar de 28 años, ambos son agricultores y juntos desean poderle brindar a su querido hijo una mejor vida.

Junto a su esposo siembran semestralmente habas, maíz, choclos y flores (gladiolos), los cuales venden en los mercados de las ciudades de Tarma y La Merced, ya que es ahí donde mejores precios obtienen.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus siembras para que no sean atacadas por las plagas, lleva 18 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es llevar sus cultivos hasta los mercados donde los vende, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados.

Este es el sétimo préstamo de Marcela con MFP y cree que este crédito le será muy beneficioso en su crecimiento como agricultora. En su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa y solidaria. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará 5 sacos de semillas de alverja, en lo cual invertirá todo el dinero, ya que el valor por saco es de seiscientos nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Marcels, 38, is a cheerful, hard-working woman. She lives in her own house with her husband, Omar, 28; both are farmers and together want to provide a better life for their beloved son. Together, she and her husband plant broad beans, corn, and gladioli that they then sell in the markets in Tarma and La Merced, which is where they get the best prices. What she likes best about her work is caring for her crops so that they will be safe from pests; she has been a farmer for 18 years. She considers the most difficult part of the job having to carry her crops to the markets where she sells because the sacks are very heavy. This is Marcela's 7th loan with MFP and she believes that the loan will be very helpful to her in her development as a farmer. She is a very participatory and supportive member of her communal bank. She will use the 3000 new soles requested to buy 5 sacks of pea seed; she will invest the entire loan in this purchase because each sack costs 600 new soles.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pea seeds.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
La Sra. Tomasa es madre soltera tiene 3 hijos menores que aún están cursando el nivel primario educativo ella vive en el barrio boquerón II con sus hijos.
Tomasa tiene una despensa bien surtida y es la única del barrio.
Ella se inicio hace varios años con muy poca mercadería que poco a poco fue aumentando con el pasar de los años hoy día ella tiene una despensa bien surtida y con buenísima clientela ya que es la única despensa que se encuentra en su comunidad.
Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y dedicada a sus hijos. El crédito solicitado fue para la artículos para a venta como azúcar, pastas, aceites y otros.
texts.en:
Tomasa is the single mother of three minor children who are still in the primary educational level at school. She lives in the Boquerón II neighborhood with her children. Tomasa has a well stocked grocery store, and it is the only one in the neighborhood. She started several years ago with very little merchandise. She increased it little by little as the years went by. She now has a well stocked grocery store with good customers. It is the only grocery store to be found in her community. She is a hard-working person, and she is devoted to her children. The loan was for products to sell like sugar, pastas, oils, and others.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various merchandise like sugar, rice, noodles, different soaps, and other items

loans.name: Phal's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Phal P. is 40 years old and the president of a sixteen-member loan group in Toul Krosang village in Kandal province. With the loan, the group members hope to increase their incomes and improve their families' living conditions. Mrs. Phal P. owns a general store where she sells groceries. Her husband is a farmer who rents a small plot of land to cultivate lotus plants. In order to support both businesses, Mrs. Phal P. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for her husband's farming as well as more groceries to sell. The couple has four children; one is a farm laborer while the other three attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer  for farming and groceries

loans.name: Julius Kibiwot

texts.en:
Julius Kibiwot M. is a man of 38. He is married to Anna M. and together, they have three beautiful children. Julius is a cash-crop farmer in Lemoru in Eldoret, where he plants maize for resale. He has been in this business for two years now.

Julius was introduced to Kiva's partner KADET by his friend, who is also a KADET client, and this will be his first loan from KADET. With the loan, Julius will buy farm inputs like fertilizers, maize seedlings, etc.

His dream is to become a prime supplier of maize to different markets within Eldoret and neighboring towns. He also hopes to educate his children to the highest level possible and buy a pick-up truck to make his distribution work easier.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs like fertilizer, maize seedlings, etc.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David K. is 27 years old and married to Mary Muthoni. They have one beautiful child called Favour. David lives in Bahati in Eldoret where owns a shop selling mobile phone accessories. He has been in this business for six years and makes thirty thousand shillings per month. David was introduced to KADET by his friend who is also a client. This will be his fourth loan with KADET and he plans to use it to buy more mobile phone accessories for resale. His dream is to open more shops so that he can make more income and improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more phone accessories for his shop

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet R. is from the village of Yumbing, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 32 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Juliet owns and operates a specialized retail business. She sells coconuts in the local community and, aside from that, she also earns income by processing the coconut shell into charcoal and selling it in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for less than a year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Juliet joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding her business. Juliet is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will again be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: God's Favour Group

texts.en:
Beatrice N., shown holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called "God's Favour". She is 40 years old, single, and has one child who is 23 years old. She was only able to attend school through 11th grade due to financial difficulties.

For 1 year now, she has been selling charcoal at the Red Light market in Paynesville, outside of Monrovia, Liberia. She describes herself as hardworking.

Beatrice plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000 LRD group loan to buy more bags of charcoal. Her dream is to grow her business and to continue to support her family so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Veronica Cecilia

texts.es: Veronica tiene 24 años de edad, vive con su esposo quien se dedidca a piloto de caminiones de carga pesada, tienen 3 hijos de los cuales ninguno va al colegio porque todavía están muy pequeños, ella inició su negocio hace 8 años asociada con su suegrapero lamentablemente la suegra murio y ahora el negocio lo trabaja solo ella, ella vende ponchos, cubrecamas, y vajillas, esta mercadería la compra en tapachula y viaja 2 veces al mes, pero debido a la demanda de sus clientes ella necesita más capital para poder invertir más y tener mas ganancias, el sueño a corto plazo de Veronica es ampliar sus ventas para poder tener un local y surtir más productos, y el sueño a lasrgo plazo es ver a sus hijos convertidos en hombres de bien y mujers de éxito, tanto en lo espiritual como en lo material.
texts.en:
Verónica is 24 years old. She lives with her husband, who is a heavy cargo truck driver. They have three children; none of them go to school because they are still too young. Eight years ago she started her business in association with her mother-in-law. Sadly, her mother-in-law died, and now she works alone. She sells ponchos, bedspreads, and dishes. She buys this merchandise in Tapachula. She goes there two times a month. However, due to her customer demand, she needs more money to be able to invest more and have more income. Veronica’s short term dream is to expand her sales in order to be able to have a place and stock more products. Her long term dream is to see her children become good and successful adults as much in the spiritual way as in the material way.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest more in her business

loans.name: Janeth

texts.es: Janeth tiene 19 años, es soltera y comparte su vida con sus padres, vive en casa de ellos. Hace más de 6 meses se dedica en la venta de prendas de vestir, para ello cuenta con un puesto en la feria comercial de su ciudad. Desde entonces su trabajo lo realiza los domingos, siendo su madre quien la ayuda en la atención. Durante los días de semana solo logra vender su mercadería a sus vecinos y amistades a crédito, por lo que procura que sean clientes responsables con el pago.  Lo que más le agrada de su negocio es que le permite poder estudiar y superarse, a la vez que puede sostenerse económicamente. Por tanto continuara trabajando con la meta que se ha propuesto, que es el tener un puesto estable donde pueda vender más ropa. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero y  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita, puesto que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más mercadería en prendas de vestir para esta temporada de invierno.
texts.en:
Janeth is 19 years old, single, and living with her parents. For more than 6 months, she has been selling clothing from a stand at the market in her city. She works on Sundays, and her mother helps her tend to the business. During the week, she only manages to sell to her friends and neighbors on credit, and she tries to find customers who will be responsible about paying. What she enjoys most about her work is that it allows her to study and get ahead, given that she can support herself financially. Therefore, she plans to continue working on the goal she has set for herself, which is to secure a stable location where she can sell more clothing. This is her first loan with MFP, and she is very happy to know she has financial support. She enjoys being a member of her cooperative because the members are very responsible and there is solidarity among the group. She thanks those who may be granters of this loan, as it will be very helpful to her in growing her business. She plans to use the funds to buy more winter clothing for this season.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more clothing.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther L. is a business lady who has been a fish vendor since 2006. Before this she had a tailoring business but the returns were not enough to enable her to effectively support her husband in taking care of the family. Today, Esther can testify to how lucrative fish selling can be if you commit and dedicate yourself to it. Her aim of diversifying it has been a great challenge since she lacks enough capital. After having been trained by K-MET as a community health worker, she realized how impressive the initiative of a revolving loan fund was, and requested a loan worth Kshs.50000 to help her in improving her business. She goes to Kisumu town every day for additional stocks. She is 28 years of age, married, and the proud mother of two children who stay in Kisumu town.

loans.use: To boost business

loans.name: Jose Ellery

texts.en: Jose Ellery A. is 50 years old and is from the town of Talibon. He owns and operates a fishing business, operating a fishing boat to catch and sell assorted fish to the market. He has been engaged in his business for over twenty-nine years. Jose Ellery joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Jose Ellery is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. This loan will be his second from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income and to improve their house. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets

loans.name: Alphonia

texts.en: Alphonia K. is currently in the business of selling dried fish, green vegetables, tomatoes and onions at her home and is requesting a loan to stock more dried fish to sell. Alphonia is married to a man who works as a driver. She has one child who does not attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a restaurant.

loans.use: Stock more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en: Anecita F. is a 44 year old married woman who supports her family through her bakery specializing in cookies. She lives in Barangay Poblacion, Oslob, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her bakery business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 8,000. Anecita is now borrowing PHP 15,000 so that she can buy the ingredients for her cookie production. This will be her 13th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Anecita aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue in its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
Luz María P. es una mujer de 66 años, muy querida por sus vecinos, tiene el negocio de vender carnes frías y también desarrolla otra actividad comercial que es la de vender   ropa por encargo y refrescos como gaseosas pony malta, Boli  etc;  Luz María es casada y tiene un hijo de 44 años de edad y vive en carrizal, barrio de un gran tamaño  donde tiene su mayor numero de sus clientes. Ella nació en el departamento de Chocó hace 40 años  y llegó  a Barranquilla con su hijo a la casa de un hermano, desde ese mismo momento ideo la forma de obtener un ingreso adicional para apoyar su hogar; primero empezó con ropa y haciendo pasteles los fines de semana luego agregó refrescos y hoy vende carnes frías como salchichas, salchichones mortadela, chorizos que compra en una empresa importante y la distribuye entre su clientela a un crédito que cobra semanalmente.
Últimamente su negocio   ha crecido, sus pedidos han aumentado y necesita tener donde refrigerar los productos especialmente los refrescos, por eso necesita comprar un enfriador apropiado,  de igual manera está preparándose para las fiestas de fin de año y la ropa femenina e infantil  es muy solicitada por sus clientes, por eso ha acudido a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para hacer el sexto crédito y para ese propósito está aplicando a su credikiva  por valor de $1.500.000 COP.
  
Su sueño es mejorar su nivel de vida y las posibilidades de obtener cada día mas ingresos familiares con su negocio, su vida siempre ha estado rodeada de negocios es una persona de muchas ideas y siempre debe ponerlas en marcha, y mas aun si se trata de ideas emprendedoras que le generen ingresos.
texts.en:
Luz María P. is 66 years old and very loved by her neighbors. She has a business selling cold cuts and she also has another business selling clothing and soft drinks, like pony malta, Boli, etc. Luz María is married and she has a 44 year old son. She lives in Carrizal, a large neighborhood where she has the majority of her clients. She was born in the department of Chocó and she came to Barranquilla with her son to live at the house of a brother. From this moment, she decided to obtain an additional income in order to support the household. First, she started with clothing and making sweets during the weekends. Then she added the soft drinks. Now she sells cold cuts like sausages, salami, bologna, chorizo which she buys at an important business and distributes them among her clientele on credit and then charges them weekly. Recently her business has grown, her orders have increased and she needs to somewhere to refrigerate her products, especially the soft drinks. For this reason, she needs to buy an appropriate cooler. Also, she is preparing for end of the year parties and women’s and children’s clothing are very popular. She has come to the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to do her sixth loan and she is requesting a kiva loan for $1.500.000 COP.

Her dream is to improve her quality of life and the possibility to obtain more income for the family with her businesses. Her life has always been surrounded by business. She is a a person with many ideas and she is always putting them in motion, and she still dealing with entrepreneurial ideas that will generate income.

loans.use: To buy a cooler, cold cuts, soft drinks and women's clothing

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine H. has owned a clothes selling business for about 15 years. She sells woman’s, man’s and children’s clothes, which she purchase from Yerevan once a month and resell its in the Kapan trade centre. Karine works without weekends and she says she likes her business very much not only because it helps her to keep her family, but also she enjoys her work. 

Karine is married and has three children: her husband and a son lives in Russia, her older daughter is married and younger one lives with Karine in Kapan city.

Karine is seeking for a 600.000 AMD loan to buy leather outerwear to resell.

loans.use: To buy leather outerwear to resell

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is a member of the Communal Bank "Santiago the Patron Saint", located in the district of Santiago de Pupuja, in the province of Azángaro, and the department of Puno. She is 58 years old, married and has eight children (four of whom are dependent). She has no formal education.
Margarita has worked with Kiva partner, Manuela Ramos, for three years. The first loan she took was for 300 PEN, and she used the money to increase the capital in her business selling pottery. She is now asking for a loan of 400 PEN, which she will use to buy materials for her business.
Margarita's dream is to have a house in the nearby city of Juliaca. Her favorite things about working with the Communal Bank are the meetings and the punctuality.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her business selling pottery

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita G. is 48-years old, married and supports her family by operating a pig-fattening business.  She lives in Punta Balidbid, Brgy. Balidbid, Sta. Fe, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2003 and has improved her living conditions with the help of loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her pig-fattening business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She currently earns an average monthly income of 11000 PHP. Lolita is now borrowing 15000 PHP to use as additional working capital.  This will be her 10th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 20000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Lolita aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Everline is a resident of Nyamira Town in western Kenya. She has been doing mixed farming for three years. Her challenge remains limited animal feeds. She has no other source of income. She has three children and two already attend school.

She has applied for this loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo. This is her second loan; the first one was for 40,000 KES. With the added income, she plans to pay school fees and improve her children's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita A. is a 40-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: food vending and a buy-and-sell dried fish business. She lives in Purok Mahogany, Barangay Vito, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her food vending and dried fish businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of about $184. Nenita is now borrowing 25,000 PHP to use as additional capital for her business. This will be her 11th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 23,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Nenita aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Esmenia

texts.en:
Esmenia M. is from the village of Brgy. Mauan, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 51 years old. Esmenia is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Esmenia raises pigs for breeding. Esmenia has been engaged in her business for more than seven years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month.

In 2010, Esmenia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Esmenia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Esmenia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers, and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase feed and supplies

loans.name: Alfreda

texts.es: La señora Alfreda L. Ríos es originaria de Amilcingo, Temoac, en el estado de Morelos, México, ella tiene 40 años de edad, estudio hasta el 6º. Año de primaria tiene su certificado, ella es casada y tiene 3 hijos que van a la escuela, ella se dedica a elaborar y vender dulces de feria, ella va a comprar con su préstamo alegría, cacahuates, tamarindo, miel, piloncillo, azúcar para elaborar sus dulces, ella ofrece a sus clientes alegría, palanqueta de cacahuate, dulce de tamarindo, ella inicio su negocio hace 15 años sus suegros le enseñaron a elaborar los dulces, ellos la animaron a comenzar con el negocio y gracias a los prestamos adquirió su negocio, en su casa elabora los dulces y sale a vender a los pueblos sus dulces en las ferias, algunos pueblos están retirados llega a su negocio en camioneta de su propiedad su esposo la lleva, ella sale cuando es día de ferias, sus clientes son las personas que viene de fuera, los peregrinos de vaR. lugares como de Tlaxcala. Su negocio es importante y especial porque ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos para los gastos de la escuela, para la alimentación, la parte favorita de su negocio es salir a vender los dulces a las ferias porque es bonito ir a vender, conocer pueblos y conocer gente, la señora Alfreda está orgullosa con su negocio porque tiene ganancia y compra más cosas, su negocio es muy conocido por los dulces que ella elabora con mucho gusto, los desafíos que enfrenta su negocio son que van muchos dulceros a vender a las ferias los mismos productos, las ganancias del negocio las utiliza para comprar más insumos y no falte la materia prima para elaborar los dulces. La señora Alfreda tiene planeado crecer más en el negocio, comprar más mercancía y lo piensa lograr echándole mas ganas a la elaboración de dulces y a las ventas y lo piensa lograr invirtiendo el préstamo para comprar lo necesario para el negocio y trabajándolo. Este préstamo le ha ayudado mucho a su familia para salir adelante en el negocio y seguir trabajando. Amilcingo es bonito ella está contenta viviendo aquí, la mayor parte de los habitantes se dedican a elaborar los dulces. Las mejoras que desea hacer a su vivienda es un corredor y sus sueños y esperanzas es tener otra casa, otro baño mejor al que tiene, hacer más grande su casa, las mejoras que desea para sus hijos son que sigan estudiando para que tengan una carrera y ser mejores personas y que estén bien de salud y lo piensa lograr invirtiendo el préstamo en insumos y trabando elaborando los dulces para venderlos. La señora Alfreda quiere decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por hacerme el favor de prestarme, se los agradezco mucho”.
texts.en:
Alfreda L. Ríos is from Amilcingo, Temoac in the state of Morelos, Mexico.  She is 40 years old. She went to school until the sixth grade, and she has her elementary school certificate.  She is married and has three children who go to school.  

She makes and sells sweets at fairs.  She will use the loan to buy amaranth candy, peanuts, tamarind, honey, brown sugar, and sugar to make her sweets.  She offers her customers amaranth candy, “palanqueta de cacahuate” (similar to peanut brittle), and tamarind candy.

She started her business 15 years ago.  Her mother and father in-law taught her how to make the sweets.  They motivated her to start in the business.  Thanks to the loans she got, she acquired her business.  She makes the sweets at her house, and she leaves to sell them at the village fairs.  Some villages are far away.  She gets to her business in her own van, and her husband takes her.  She goes on the days there are fairs.  Her customers are people who migrate from places like Tlaxcala. 

Her business is important and special because she has been able to get her children ahead, pay the school expenses, and feed her family.  Her favorite part of the business is going to the fairs to sell her candy.  It is lovely to go to sell, to get to know the villages, and to meet people.  Alfreda is proud of her business because she has income and buys more things.  Her business is well-known for the sweets that she makes with great pleasure.

The challenge that her business faces is that there are many candy sellers going to the fairs to sell the same products.  She uses the earnings from her business to buy more ingredients so that she does not run out of supplies to make the sweets.

Alfreda plans to grow more in her business and to buy more merchandise.  She plans to do this by putting more devotion into making and selling the sweets.  She plans to use the loan to buy what she needs for working in her business.

This loan has greatly helped her family in order to get ahead in the business and to keep working.  Amilcingo is a pretty town, and she is happy living here.  Most of the inhabitants make sweets.   

The improvement she wants to make to her house is a hallway.  Her hopes and dreams are to have another house, another bathroom better than the one she has, and to make her house bigger.  What she wishes for her children is that they keep going to school, that they have a career, that they become better people, and that they have good health.  She plans to achieve this by using the loan for supplies and by working and making the sweets to sell.

Alfreda wants to tell Kiva and the Fundación Realidad, “Thanks for doing me the favor of lending to me.  I am very grateful to you.”

loans.use: To buy amaranth candy, peanuts, tamarind, honey, brown sugar, and sugar to make her sweets

loans.name: Henrietta

texts.en:
Henrietta R. is from the village of Dicayas. She is 55 years old, married, and has 4 adult children. Henrietta operates a family member's business, in services sector,primarily sewing dress and pillow case in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Henrietta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.Henrietta is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional materials for her sewing business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Henrietta from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials for her sewing business.

loans.name: Maureen Nashipae

texts.en:
Maureen Nashipae K. is 26 Years old, married, and a mother of three school-aged children. Maureen is a business lady and she has had her salon business in a rented space for the last four years.

She learned about KADET LTD from other women in a group already registered with KADET in the area. This will be her third loan, which she is planning to spend to equip the salon. She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her business by opening more branches.

Maureen's dream is to buy a plot and build rental houses in the future.She is a punctilious lady who is determined to achieve her goals if supported financially.

loans.use: To equip the salon by buying a hair drier and chemicals

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth es una joven madre de 22 años, vive en una casa arrendada en compañía de su pequeño hijo. Tiene su tienda de abarrotes desde hace varios meses, todos los días se dedica en la atención y siempre esta al tanto de abastecerse oportunamente de la mercadería que esta por terminarse, además es de gran ayuda contar con proveedores que llevan los productos que solicitan a su tienda, de esta manera le ahorran tiempo y dinero ya que es ella la única persona que esta en su negocio. El esfuerzo que realiza esta motivada mujer es el de dar a su hijo lo mejor y estar al pendiente de ello ya que otro trabajo no le permite estar con él. En adelante quiere implementar con más variedad de  productos su establecimiento. Es su segundo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería en productos alimenticios envasados.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a young 22 year-old mother who lives with her small son in a rented house.  For several months she has been running a grocery store.  She is very careful about keeping it stocked well and depends on the collaboration of her suppliers who deliver the goods so she can save time and money, since she is the only person running the business.

The effort shown by this motivated woman stems from the fact that she wants to provide the best for her son and be able to stay abreast of his needs.  Another type of job would not allow her to be with him during the day. In the future she wants to expand her range of products.  

This is her second loan through MFP and she is very happy with the financial support given her.  She has always been responsible making her payments on time.  She enjoys being part of the communal bank because all the members are responsible and supportive.  She expresses her gratitude to the lenders who are helping her get ahead.  She plans to use the loan to buy more packaged food items.

loans.use: To buy more products for her general store

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth I. is 37 years old and is married to Gilbert. They have three children and live in Mbale town.

Ruth has a business of selling second-hand clothes and has been in this business for the past ten years. She earns a monthly income of Kshs 13,200. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a friend who is a client here. Ruth wants to buy more clothes to add to her stock, which is running low. She hopes to use the profits made from the business to pay school fees for her children and to cover her family's needs.

Her dream is to see her business grow to great heights.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to add to her stock

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “RICHARY RUNA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Cesar; el tiene 34 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; el socio trabaja en empresas privadas como seguridad actualmente está trabajando en una empresa de lunes a sábado, el socio siempre trabajo en este rubro y se siente feliz ya que mediante este trabajo el saca a su familia adelante, el socio necesita un arma de fuego para su trabajo sin eso no puede cumplir bien su función.

El socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de una arma de fuego para su trabajo.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos
texts.en:
The associate belongs to the ” RICHARY RUNA” communal bank.  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province of Cusco and department of Cusco. 

The associate is Señor Cesar.  He is 34 years of age and lives with his partner and their son.  The associate works in private businesses as a security guard.  Currently he works in a business from Monday to Saturday.  The associate has always worked in this area and he feels happy since by means of this work he moves his family ahead.  The associate needs a firearm for his work since, without that, he cannot perform his function well.  

The associate requests the loan for the purchase of a firearm for his work.  

The associate is happy for the loan and he promises to comply with the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy a firearm for his security work.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio Cesar C. P. tiene 30 años, es soltero vive con los hijos (3), en  el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  LA SOLEDAD se encuentra ubicada en el recinto EL TAMBO  pertenece al Cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla de 12 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas de cultivos de cacao, arroz, maíz, yuca y además cría aves como gallina y patos.

Julio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao, arroz, maíz,  los productos las compras en Chillanes y en El Tambo y los vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos para los cultivos además de fertilizantes y abonos con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar carro.

Le gusta jugar con los hijos y salir los fines de semana.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar C. P. is 30 years old, single, and lives with his three children in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.

La Soledad community bank is located in El Tambo, in Chillanes canton.  The 12 members of this group work in agriculture, growing crops such as cacao, rice, corn and cassava.  They also raise birds such as hens and ducks.  Julio is a farmer who grows cacao, rice and corn.  He buys his products in Chillanes and El Tambo and sells his products in the Sunday market in Chillanes.

Julio is requesting this loan to buy supplies for his crops as well as fertilizers and manure.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs.  He faces challenges in his work such as pest infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  His dream is to buy a car.

Julio enjoys playing with his children and going out on weekends.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his crops as well as fertilizers and manure

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Mère de 05 enfants, Mme Awa est revendeuse de céréales (mil, mais, sorgho…). Son mari est chauffeur. Il ya 11ans qu’elle a démarré l’activité. Elle achète des céréales au marché de Kégué et revend au même lieu. Ce prêt lui servira à acheter des céréales pour revendre afin d’assurer  l’avenir de  ses enfants et aider en partie son mari.
texts.en: The mother of 5 children, Mrs. Awa is a retailer of cereals (millet, corn, sorghum...). Her husband is a driver. She has been involved in this business for 11 years. She buys cereals at the Kégué market and re-sells at the same place. This loan will allow her to buy cereals for resale so that she can provide for her children's future and be of some help to her husband.

loans.use: to buy cereals (corn, beans and millet)

loans.name: Lubrino

texts.en:
A. is from the village of Palayan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 23 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, A. runs a fish food stall in the market. 

A. has been engaged in her business for 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month. She joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 8000 PHP to purchase more and different kinds of fish for her stall. This will be the third loan taken out by A. from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Hassoun

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 47 years old, married and has three children. He lives with 11 family members. Three of the family members work.

Hassoun has had a coffee shop since 2003. He has a lot of experience, a good reputation and is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $3000 loan to renovate his coffee shop. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To renovate his coffee shop.

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus, a 37-year-old, is married and has two children aged 5 and 8.  He runs a retail shop so as to earn a living for his family.  He also earns additional income because he is employed in a salon.  

Titus has been operating his business for ten years.  He was able to expand his business with his first loan from Faulu Kenya.  Besides, he has gained business management skills from the training sessions conducted by Faulu Kenya.  His dream is to build his own house and own a car.  He has requested 50,000 Kes to buy sugar, maize flour, soap and toothpaste for his general store.

loans.use: To buy sugar, maize flour, soap and toothpaste.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a widow with two adult-age children. She is 61 years old and is from the village of Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

To make a living, Fe owns and operates a business planting rice and producing palay (unmilled rice) to sell as an additional source of income. She has been doing this type of work for 10 years with a quarterly income of PHP 60,000. Fe requested a loan of PHP 35,000 from GDMPC to pay for labor costs for soil preparation for the coming planting season.

Fe has been a member of GDMPC for more than four years. In the future, Fe wants to become a member in good standing in GDMPC and continue her business.

loans.use: To pay labor costs for soil preparation

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge de 50 años de edad, casado con María de 50 años con quien tiene una hija de 22 años y es estudiante. Ellos viven en su casa propia en el centro poblado de Canayre del distrito de LLochegua. Jorge  emprendió en un nuevo negocio, que es la venta de ropa para  todas la edades según a los gustos y preferencias de sus clientes. Nunca imagino que le resultaría rentable, por lo que aún continúa ofreciendo su mercadería de puerta en puerta. También. Asimismo comentan que él y su esposa poseen Bar, permitiéndole ofrecer otros ingresos para su familia. Para ella es muy importante los dos negocios que posee, pero considera que la venta de ropa le genera más rentabilidad por ello se abastecerá de más ropa. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Jorge es un hombre que impone el orden en su banco comunal. Con los 1.000 nuevos soles, comprará más prendas para implementar su tienda.
texts.en: Jorge is 50 years old and he is married with Maria, 50 years old, with whom he has a 22-year old daughter, a student. They live in a house of their own in the community of Canayre in the district of Llochegua. Jorge took up a new business, being the sale of clothing for all ages and suiting the tastes and preferences of his clients. He never imagined that it would be profitable but he still continues to offer his merchandise from door to door. Also they mention that they have a bar to earn an extra income for the family. The two businesses that they have are very important to him but he feels that the clothing sales business generates more income, and for this reason he will supply himself with more clothing. Jorge is a man who brings order to his communal bank. With the 1000 neuvos soles he will purchase more articles of clothing to supply his business.

loans.use: to purchase articles of clothing for resale.

loans.name: Hermes Francisco

texts.es:
Hermes  es un hombre emprendedor vecino de la zona de Pital, de San Carlos, esto en la provincia de Alajuela.  Por esa área se da mucho el turismo por motivo del Volcán Arenal ubicado en sus cercanías, con el bosque nubloso de Monteverde y las tierras bajas del norte del país.
El está solicitando un préstamo por el monto de  ₡500.000 (quinientos mil colones), esto con el fin de sacar a su familia adelante y darle una mejor calidad de vida, por medio de la siembra de piña esto por ser una zona donde se presenta mayormente la actividad agrícola, la cual da bienestar y solidez a las familias de la zona.  Es por esto mismo que Hermes espera que todo le salga bien y para poder ahorrar dinero de todo lo que produzca y coseche con esta siembra para darle el mejor producto a sus clientes, y un techo digno y una mejor calidad de vida a su esposa.
Hermes pertenece a la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de La trinchera, una de las 110 empresas existentes en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Hermes is an enterprising man who lives near the Pital zone of San Carlos in the Alajuela province.  There is a lot of tourism here since the Arenal volcano is nearby, as well as the cloud forest of Monteverde and the lowlands of the north of the country.

He is requesting a loan of ₡500,000  (five hundred thousand colons) with the goal of pushing his family ahead and giving them a better quality of life.  Since this is an area where there is a lot of agriculture, he will grow pineapple, and thus help the welfare and stability of his family.  That is why Hermes hopes that all comes out well, and that he can save money from what he produces and harvests by giving higher quality products to his customers.  This will help him give a good home and a better standard of living to his wife.

Hermes belongs to the Empresa  communal bank called La Trinchera, one of 100 such businesses in Costa Rica.

loans.use: To grow pineapple

loans.name: Phiona

texts.en:
Phiona lives in Uganda.  She is married and has five children, four of whom are in school. Phiona has a business selling second-hand clothes.  She has been in this business for three years, and she works six days out of every week. 

Phiona sells her products at the market, retail. She has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second-hand clothes.  She also generates additional income through a small retail shop.

The main business challenges for Phiona include lack of enough capital to buy many bales and the ever increasing price of used clothes and also building rental rooms.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start importing used clothes.  

Phiona lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Florinda

texts.pt:
Nasceu na provincia de Tete ao norte de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 4 filhos dos quais 3 vão a escola. Fez a 3ª classe e parou por falta de condiçoes financeiras. vive na casa propria com a  sua familia e sustenta o seu neto que vive com eles.
Saiu de Tete para Maputo a procura de emprego, é pensionista e pratica agricultura para consumo familiar a 20 anos e tem um rendimento de 5.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria com ajuda da sua pensao.
Nunca fez emprestimo noutros bancos. Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que também é cliente e este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 21.500.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construcao DE CASA PARA HABITACAO (areia, cimento, blocos, ferro, pedra, e outros). O primeiro emprestimo foi de: 17.000.00mt aplicado tambem apara obra.   
Sonha em concluir a sua obra e abrir uma mini-mercearia, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Florinda was born in Tete Province in northern Mozambique. She is married and has four children; three of them go to school. Florinda finished third grade and quit school because of financial problems. She lives in her own house with her family and supports her grandson, who lives with them.

She left Tete to move to Maputo in search of a job. Florinda receives a pension and has farmed for her family's consumption for 20 years. She has an income of 5,000 meticais per month, which she uses for household expenses. She also saves some money in her bank account with the help of her pension.

Florinda has never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a customer, and this is Florinda's second Hluvuku loan. She is asking for 21,500 meticais to buy home construction materials (sand, cement, blocks, iron, stone and other items). The first loan was for 17,000 meticais and was also used for her house.

She dreams of finishing her house and opening a small grocery store. To do this, she intends to ask Hluvuku for more loans.

loans.use: to buy home construction materials (sand, cement, blocks, iron, stone, etc.).

loans.name: Elida

texts.es: Elida tiene 33 años, vive en compañía de su esposo y su hijo en su casa. con mucha constancia y perseverancia supo sacar adelante a su familia, con el emprendimiento de su pequeño negocio que lo tiene desde hace 5 años. En la actualidad su negocio tiene tendencia creciente que es una pequeña bodega en las cuales es la  proveedora de productos de primera necesidad de su zona, el buen trato amable las ofertas que promueve en su tienda es uno de los factores que hacen que su tienda sea una de las más concurridas y de mayor venta en su zona. Fruto de ese esfuerzo su tienda tiene  mercadería en constante renovación y siempre necesita para su negocio un crecimiento de capital de manera constante. Es su crédito número 11 en la cual esta trabajando con MFP  de manera grupal, en cada crédito que ha recibido siempre lo ha invertido en la mejora de su negocio  y hoy ve con orgullo un negocio consolidado. Por lo que seguirá invirtiendo el dinero en la compra de más productos de primera necesidad para abastecer su tienda.
texts.en: Elida is 33. She lives with her husband and child in their home. With great constancy and perseverance she was able to get her family ahead through her small business, which she has had for 5 years. Currently, her business is growing. It is a small grocery store which is the provider of basic staples to the people in the area. Her good, kind service is one of the factors that makes her store one of the most popular in the area, with some of the highest sales. The fruit of her constant hard work is that her stock is constantly turning over and she always needs an increase of capital to remain constant. This is her eleventh group loan with MFP. She has always invested every loan in improving her business, and today she looks upon her consolidated business with pride. She will keep investing this money in the purchase of more basic staples to stock her store.

loans.use: to purchase basic staples to stock her store.

loans.name: Samah

texts.en:
Samah is a 29 year old single female, owner of a Music CDs and DVD shop, in addition to computer accessories selling.
She opened this business in 2004 and is working hard to improve it with new technologies and variety of products. Through this variety, Samah attracts different customers with different music tastes, in addition to computer accessories and technologies.
Samah is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, it is her fifth cycle as Al Majmoua borrower,in order to increase her Music Discs and tapes with new and oldies releases, in addition to new computer technologies achieved. All her previous loans helped a lot in improving her business, and they reflected positively in improving her social situation. She is a good standing borrower, ambitious and a hard worker, who tries her best to prove for others that women are capable of doing anything and struggle to succeed it.
Samah intends to expand her working place, to a wider one, and she might need to move to another place for this reason, but it may take a little time to achieve it.

loans.use: To increase her stocks of CDs and DVDs

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with five children. 
Mercy buys and peddles fish such as sardines and mackerel. She has run this business for ten years. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy fish to sell.
Mercy has been a member of Kiva partner, HSPFI, since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Nazemse Group

texts.fr:
Mme FATIMATA est la représentante du groupe NAZEMSE. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 04ans et le moins âgé a 03 mois. Un (01) va à l’école. Elle a 03 personnes en charge.

Elle vend de la farine de maïs depuis 07ans.Sur la photo,elle tient un sachet de farine. Elle s’approvisionnement au marché de Bisghin. Ses clients sont les femmes.

Elle veut s’acheter 03 sacs de maïs pour transformer en farine.

Avec ses économies, elle contribue à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille. Elle ambitionne ouvrir un grand magasin pour stocker le maïs et revendre.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatimata is the representative of the Nazemse group.  She is married and the mother of three children, the oldest of whom is four and the youngest three months.  One attends school.  She has three people under her care.

She has been selling corn flour for seven years.  In the photo, she is holding a sack of flour.  She buys her materials in the Bisghin market, and her customers are women.  She would like to buy three sacks of corn to make into flour.  With her savings, she contributes toward improving her family's standard of living.  She hopes to open a large store for storing and reselling corn.

loans.use: to buy three bags of corn to make into flour.

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es:
El señor Juan tiene 35 años de edad, vive con su compañera de vida y tres hijos.

Él trabaja la carpintería desde que tenia siente años de edad, su papá fue quien le enseño, ya que toda su familia se desempeña este oficio.
