Anteriormente don Juan trabajaba en la agricultura y viajaba a Estados Unidos, fue de esa manera que pudo comprar las herramientas para la carpintería. La madera para elaborar los muebles, los compra en otras comunidades y también en el mismo lugar donde vive.

En este momento Juan solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar madera, la cual es su principal materia prima y la otra parte la utilizara para completar el dinero que le falta, para comprar una cepilladora que sirve para desbastar la madera.

De esta manera él podrá elaborar los muebles más rápido con su nueva herramienta, ya que su taller tiene bastante demanda y eso le facilitara la entrega de los muebles a sus clientes y podrá elaborarlos en mayor cantidad. Lo que le generara mayores ingresos para su familia. Él ahorrara para darles a sus hijos el estudio y para construir una galera en donde guardara todas sus herramientas, para que no se mojen y así estén más seguras y él podra trabajar bajo el sol y la lluvia sin problemas.
texts.en:
Juan, 35, lives with his companion and their three children.  He’s worked in carpentry since he was seven years old.  His father taught him since the entire family was in this occupation.  Juan used to work in farming and would go to the United States and this is how he was able to buy his carpentry tools.  He buys the wood he uses to make furniture in other communities but also in the place where he lives.

At present, Juan is asking Fundación Campo for a loan to buy wood which is his prime raw material and the other part of it to make up the rest of the money he needs to buy a sander which will be very useful for smoothing the wood.  In this way he’ll be able to make the furniture faster with his new tools since his shop has quite a bit of demand and this will make it easier for him to deliver the furniture to his customers and to make them in larger quantities which will generate higher income for his family.  He will save up to provide his children with an education and to build a covered storage area to keep his tools so that they won’t get wet and will be more secure and allow him to work either in sunshine or during the rain problem free.

loans.use: to buy lumber to make furniture and to buy a sander.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is 28 years old. She is married to Muthama. Together, they have three children, aged 6, 2 and 1 year old. She own a retail shop besides owning a posho mill (to grind corn into flour). She has been in the business for the past five years. She gets a monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from the business.

This is her second loan from KADET. She repaid her previous loan successfully. She will use the loan amount to purchase maize to use in the posho mill and also to sell in the retail shop.

She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children. She wants to expand her business and own another posho mill.

loans.use: to purchase maize.

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
La señora Martha reside en el departamento de Masaya, tiene la edad de 51 años, su negocio tiene aproximadamente 13 años de mantenerlo, consiste en la compra y venta de ropa de niños, damas y caballeros. Sus compras las realiza en el mercado en Managua, es madre soltera el cual con su esfuerzo ha sacado adelante a sus hijos.

Se ha presentado a Ceprodel para solicitar un prestamos, e invertirle a su negocio de venta de ropa. Los productos que comprará son pantalones jeans, pantalones de vestir, camisetas, pantalones de mujer, blusas de mujer y pantalones para niños ya que actualmente no posee estos productos y los requiere con mucha necesidad  debido a que por la temporada de fin de año ella tiene mas demanda.
Ella considera que los préstamos que ella ha trabajado con Ceprodel le han servido de mucha ayuda, para la comodidad de su familia y este otro sin duda espera le sea de mucha utilidad en su desarrollo económico.
texts.en:
Martha lives in Masaya Department.  She’s 51 years old and has been in business for about 13 years.  She is women’s, men’s and children’s clothes merchant.  She makes her purchases in a market in Managua.  She’s a single mother and has raised her children with much effort.  

She comes by our offices once again to request a loan to invest in her business of selling clothes. She will buy jeans, dress pants, shirts, women's pants, blouses, and pants for kids because she doesn't currently have any of these items available. It is very important to stock up now because the end of year season is when demand is highest.  She believes that the loans she’s had with Ceprodel have been very useful for her family’s comfort.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
From Kampong Chhnang province, Mrs. Chan, 36, the mother of 4 single children, has been raising pigs for some time. Since she started this business she’s had good results and the income she generated has helped her support her family.

At present, Mrs. Chan wants to request a $500 loan to purchase piglets and feeds that she needs for her pig raising project. She hopes that with this her micro business will grow and generate more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feeds.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 45-year-old married man and father of four beautiful children. He has owned a shoe sales shop since 1996. Hassan's business is going well, since most of his prices are affordable to most of his customers. Almost 90% of his customers are his villagers, but sometimes their friends and relatives are his customers too.

Hassan is a hardworking man. He is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to increase his merchandise for the coming Winter & Christmas Season. Hassan is optimistic that this Christmas season will generate considerable income and that he will be able to expand his business more and more in the future, either by opening another branch or by starting wholesale trade.

loans.use: To increase his merchandise for the coming Winter & Christmas Season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her stock of medical drugs.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong and her family live in Ho Chi Minh City. She is 47 and has two children. Her husband is a carpenter.

She has been earning a living by operating a coffee shop from their house for the past seven years. She sells coffee and a variety of soft drinks and fruit juices. 

Phuong would like to borrow money to buy furniture to expand her current cafe and attract more customers. She hopes that this will enable her to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her cafe.

loans.name: Oumy Ndaw

texts.fr: Madame Oumy est âgée  de 47 ans. Elle habite au Sénégal. elle est célibataire et s’active dans la vente de tissus, greffages, parfums, encens et divers autres produits. Elle a une expérience de 10 ans dans son activité. Elle est membre du guichet de l’U-IMCEC de la localité ou elle habite depuis septembre 2004. Elle a déjà remboursé deux prêts  antérieurs au sein de l’institution. Elle sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour le paiement d’une commande de greffages qu’elle avait réceptionné et a l’achat de produits divers destinés a la vente. Son objectif est d’augmenter ses bénéfices pour mieux prendre en charge ses besoins sociaux.
texts.en: Oumy is 47. She lives in Senegal. She is single and sells fabrics, hair weaves, perfume, incense, and various products. She has been working in this field for 10 years. She has been a member of her local U-IMCEC branch since September 2004. She has already paid 2 loans back to this institution. She is applying for a 300 000 frs loan which she intends to use to pay for an order of hair weaves she has received, and to buy other products she will resell. Her goal is to increase her profits so she can attend to her social needs.

loans.use: to pay for an order of hair weaves and buy other products she will resell.

loans.name: Hazem

texts.en:
Hazem is a 20-year-old student who lives with his family in Irbid. He is in his third year majoring in Anthropology. Hazem is hoping to get his bachelor degree and continue in higher education. He also wants to find a job in the field of anthropology so he can apply what he has studied.
Hazem is now applying for a loan to pay his semester fees for registration in the university.

loans.use: to pay his semester fees.

loans.name: Candelyn

texts.en:
Candelyn is 39 years old and lives in Sta. Cruz, Jimenez. She is married and has two children.
 
Candelyn has a general store that sells a variety of products. She has had this business for 20 years. 

Candelyn requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

Candelyn has been a member of PMPC for a month. In the future, Candelyn hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Agricultores La Capellania #5 Group

texts.es:
El señor Martin esta casado, tiene 48 años de edad, cursó los 3 años de educación primaria, tiene 5 hijos 4 de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la agricultura específicamente a la siembre de papas, m inicio este negocio con sus padres y hasta el momento lleva 20 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupos para poder solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de insumos como semillas y fertilizantes, para cultivo de papas, ya que el en futuro quiere ver producto más grande, y transportar su producto. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la siembra de papas tipo ICTA FRIT.

loans.use: Comprar  insumos para siembra de papas

loans.name: Donozio

texts.en:
Donozio is a married man, who owns a retail shop that he has run for four years, having earned his start-up capital by maize produce selling. He still supplements his income from the shop by selling produce. Inadequate capital to meet the high demand is affecting the business. He would like to expand his business to the wholesale level and buy a motorcycle for himself, in the future. The motorcycle would ease his movements to different markets to buy produce from farmers. 

Donozio is requesting a loan to buy sugar, soap and cooking oil, to resell in his store.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap and cooking oil, to resell in his store.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine lives in the Kitale area of Kenya, which lies in the northern part of the Rift Valley. She has 4 children and has been doing this work for 6 years. Her primary income sources are milk, crops, and personal business.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'it's the source of income for the family.' Her biggest challenge is 'Drought.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Maua.'

Christine was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'Listens to clients.' This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'They go out to reach of the clients.'

Her highest monthly expenses are family expenses. When asked: 'How will this loan benefit her family', Christine replied: 'Help in paying school fees.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Christine owns the following: 'cow and poultry,' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, or automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household: 'mosquito net and running water,' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, sewing machine, TV, or DVD'.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La socia Hilda pertenece al banco comunal JUNTOS PODEMOS, la socia tiene 43 años de edad es casada y tiene 02 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de libreria,la socia vende cuadernos,lapiceros,folders,hojas entre otros, para todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de plumones, laminas entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Hilda is a member of the "Juntos Podemos" communal bank. She is 43 years old, married and has two children. Hilda looks after her home and has a stationery shop where she sells notebooks, pens, folders, paper and more. Hilda has had the business for some time now and it is going well thanks to her determination. Hilda wants to continue with her business in order to keep on supporting her family.

Hilda is applying for this loan in order to buy marker pens and other items.

Hilda is very grateful for this loan and promises to make her repayments.

loans.use: to buy marker pens and other items.

loans.name: Ashura

texts.en:
Ashura is married with three children. She lives in Tandika area of Dar es Salaam. She owns a stall at Tandika market selling used clothes. She purchases these clothes from wholesalers and resells them in retail.

Through her savings, she has managed to start keeping layers as a supplementary business. She came to notice that the second business needs more capital than she had originally anticipated. To smoothly run her businesses she needs USD 550. The money will be used to buy layers of feed and some medications. Ashura has attended Business and Entrepreneurship Training offered by Youth Self Employment Foundation.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Ayaz

texts.en:
Ayaz was born in Gubadli region of Azerbaijan. He is Internally Displaced Person (IDP). He settled with his family and 3 children in Sumgait. He is 45. Difficulties of life forced them to start the business. He is the only breadwinner in the family. In the beginning he used to sell vegetables. By borrowing the loan amount of $300 he has increased the range of foods: has bought 12 bags onions, 8 bags potatoes.

Ayaz applies for $1200 loan. He plans to be busy with the sale agricultural products.

loans.use: He plans to be busy with sale agricultural products

loans.name: Yim

texts.en:
Yim S. is 37 years old and is a mototaxi driver.  He lives with his wife 
(pictured here) in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  He can typically earn about $5/day.  His wife works at the local garment factory and can earn around $2/day.  With the loan, S. hopes to use it to repair his house and to purchase a simple motorbike for his family business.  In the future, he expects to buy a grocery store at the market and if possible, build up their home in order to protect it from the rainy season.

loans.use: Purchase motorbike and repair home

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio is married and has two small children. His desire to improve his family’s living standards is what motivated him to start his business six years ago. He sells sunglasses and accessories, which is how he earns the income necessary to provide for his family and give an education to his children. Fortunately, his products have been well received by his customers and he has been able to locate himself in several markets where he has been able to successfully sell his merchandise.

Antonio needs to continue growing his business, and in order to cover the increased demand he has had lately, due to the beginning of the hot season, he is requesting a loan of $475.00. He will use it to buy merchandise, and he promises to return the loan in 6 months. Please be an important part of this business and the life of Antonio and his family. They are very thankful for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Antonio es casado y tiene dos pequeños hijos, los deseos de mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia motivaron a Antonio a iniciar su propio negocio desde hace seis años, donde vende accesorios y lentes, de esta manera es como obtiene los ingresos necesarios para sostener a su familia y darle educación a sus hijos. Afortunadamente las ventas de sus productos han tenido buena aceptación de sus clientes y ha logrado ubicarse en varios mercados donde comercializa con éxito sus productos.

Ahora Antonio quiere continuar creciendo con su negocio y para cubrir la alta demanda que ha tenido por la entrada de la temporada de calor solicita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía, él se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte importante en este negocio y en la vida de Antonio y su familia, ellos agradecen mucho tu ayuda.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Sefer

texts.en: Sefer E. is a taxi driver, as well as a seasonal fruit and vegetable seller, in the northeastern Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. Sefer is married with three children and has been driving his taxi for the last two years. Sefer is looking for funding so that he can make some much-needed repairs to his taxi. This is Sefer’s second loan with Normicro, which means that there were no problems with his first loan of US$225.

loans.use: To make repairs on his taxi

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda is a 63 year old women and even at her age still has the strength and will necessary to continue working in order to meet her personal expenses and to help her children and contribute to the growth and development of her grandchildren.

Thanks to her sales of fish and meet she has been able to meet some of her grandchildren’s needs with the daily earnings from her house’s facilities, and they have become her best company. In a short period they have returned happiness to her life and she now doesn’t feel so alone because every afternoon they wait for her with many stories and gossip relating to their days in the house or at school.

However, recently she has had some aches and pains as a result of her age, which haven’t stopped worrying her and she needs to buy some medicines in order to reduce her discomfort and physical pain.

Thanks to this, she needs to continue working in order to purchase the medicines and continue her treatment. As a result, she is asking for a loan of $375 dollars in order to be able to distribute her products in Huasahuasi and the surrounding area where she will obtain better profits. Help so that a grandmother who hasn’t lost heart or faded as a result of her illness and allow her to continue providing for much longer valuable lessons on life and work to members of her family.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva volunteer

Hilda es una dama D. 63 años y a su edad mantiene las fuerzas y ganas necesarias para seguir trabajando para solventar sus gastos personales y para servir D. apoyo a sus hijos y contribuir con el crecimiento y desarrollo D. sus nietos.

Gracias a la venta D. pescado y carne ha solventado algunas carencias D. sus nietos con los que comprate día a día las instalaciones D. su casa y se han convertido en su mejor compañía. Ellos en poco tiempo le han devuelto la alegría a su vida y ya no se siente tan sola porque tarD. a tarD. la esperan con muchos ánimos y comentarios respecto al día que tuvieron en casa o en la escuela.

Sin embargo últimamente ha tenido algunos achaques propios D. su edad, que no dejan D. preocuparla y necesita comprarse algunas medicinas para apaciguar sus malestares y dolores físicos.

Debido a ello, necesita seguir trabajando para adquirir sus medicamentos y continuar con su tratamiento, solicita la suma D. 375 dólares para poder distribuir sus productos a la localidad D. Huasahuasi lugar donD. obtiene mayores ganancias.Colabore a que una abuelita no se desvanezca ni se desaliente a consecuencia D. sus malestares y siga otorgando por mucho tiempo más lecciones D. vida y trabajo a los miembros D. su familia.

loans.use: Increase capital in order to consolidate her business

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia, 51, balances taking care of her yam stall at the market and taking care of her ten children. All ten of her children are in school right now. The oldest one is in high school and the youngest is in elementary school. Her primary goal is to earn enough profit so that she can take care of them and provide them the opportunity to go to university.

Yams are a staple of Ghanaian dishes. They are used in fou-fou, yam balls, palava dishes, and just plain yams. There is a constant demand for yams from her customers, but it is more expensive for her to purchase during this time of the year. This is why she is requesting a loan to help buy enough to supply her customers.

Cecilia is a member of the lending group, Eye Nyame. This group guarantees a loan through a group repayment pledge. Peer pressure and support provide the incentive to repay; if one person in the group defaults, the group members make up the payment amount. The members of Eye Nyame have developed close relationships. They take care of each other’s businesses while they are away.

loans.use: To purchase yams as they are becoming more expensive this time of the year.

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
I am Shamim A. and I live in a mid-size city, Faisalabad in Pakistan. I am the mother of nine: six daughters and three sons. My husband has been a barber for the past ten years. Now, he wishes to start his own barber shop for which he requires buying chairs, tables, mirrors, hair dryers, scissors etc. We lack financial means for this purpose and therefore require a loan.

There are four more women who are in my loan group and need loans to improve their businesses. My group members are:

Rubina B. (who needs loan for her husband’s fruit business);

Zahida B. (her husband needs to buy a donkey cart);

Riffat B. (she requires loan to invest in her husband’s restaurant); and Majeedan B. needs a loan for her husband’s fruit business.

All of my group members are very good and cooperative. They always listen to me as their leader and are very honest in their dealings.

loans.use: Start barber shop for my husband and help my group members with their businesses

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Natividad López is an energetic woman with a great spirit of self-growth. She started her tortilla business in the el Bisne market of the beautiful city of Chinandega 8 years ago.

It is important to highlight that she started out with $2,000.00 Nicaraguan Córdoba, investing the capital in the business space and in the purchase of the ingredients needed to make tortillas.

Because of life’s misfortunes, Mrs. Natividad has endured difficult times during which she did not have enough money to sustain neither her humble household nor her business. For this reason, she trustingly turns to Ceprodel, which has greatly benefited her for 2 years. She has received a total of 20 loans that have been of great use to her, since they have allowed her to buy greater quantities of the ingredients necessary for making her delicious tortillas.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Natividad López es una dama muy esforzada y con un gran espíritu de superación personal. Desde hace 8 años inició su negocio de elaboración y venta de tortillas en el mercado el Bisne de la bella ciudad de Chinandega.

Es necesario destacar que ella inició con un monto de C$ 2000 invertidos en la infraestructura de su local y a la vez en la adquisición de la materia prima.

Por infortunios de la vida, la señora Natividad ha pasado situaciones difíciles en las que no ha tenido dinero para mantener su humilde hogar ni su negocio. Por este motivo es que muy confiadamente se acerca a Ceprodel siendo beneficiada desde hace 2 años con un total de 20 créditos y según cuenta, le han sido de mucho beneficio por el hecho de que ha adquirido mayores cantidades de materia prima para la elaboración de las deliciosas tortillas.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients needed to make tortillas

loans.name: Tabrey

texts.en:
Born in 1958, Tabrey F. is married and a father of 10 children. Due to lack of funding, and business and management skills to be self-employed, he became a member of GHAPE in 1998. Since then he has successfully taken and repaid loans up to $1340. He started his business with a loan of $30 and so far his family has benefitted from the profit he made from his business.

With the training he obtained from GHAPE in business skills, and given the fact that the medicine store is the only one in his locality, he believes he will be able to repay this loan in the required time. With the profit, he intends to educate his children, save some money, and provide food for his family.

He plans to repay the loan in 24months.

loans.use: Purchase of drugs and pig farming

loans.name: Akoko Abla

texts.fr:
Mrs. Akoko Abla A. was born October 23rd, 1972 in Tekponou village, in the Vo prefecture of Togo. She has three children and is married to Mr. Kpowenou ASSAGBA who is a taxi driver in Lomé. Mrs. Akoko Abla A. is a retailer of beauty and consumer goods in the Kodjoviakopé neighborhood of Lomé. She is seeking her first loan of 300,000 francs CFA to buy two dozen boxes of lotion to increase her stock and better serve her customers.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Akoko Abla est née le 23 octobre 1972 à TEKPONOU dans la préfecture de Vo au Togo. Elle a trois enfants et s’est mariée à Monsieur ASSAGBA Kpowenou qui est un chauffeur de taxis à Lomé. Madame A. Akoko Abla est revendeuse des produits de beauté et des produits de consommation courante dans le quartier de Kodjoviakopé à Lomé. Elle sollicite un premier crédit de 300.000 FCFA pour acheter deux (2) douzaines de cartons de crème pour pouvoir augmenter son stock et de mieux servir ses clients

loans.use: Increase her cosmetics stock

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is 30 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages 13 and 7. Salma has been a charcoal and clothes seller since 2000. Everyday, she works from 6am to 6pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $150 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal and clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and clothes for her business.

loans.name: Comité Group

texts.en:
The Committee of Entrepreneuring women is a program carried out by Fundación Paraguaya that targets groups of enterprising women who create a village bank through which they receive assistance in terms of loans. The main goal is to give them the opportunity to carry out economic activities that enable them to live with dignity and contribute to a better quality of life in their homes. Lending to poor women creates a cascading effect that brings social and economic benefits to a whole family, and thus to the entire community. What is more, the sense of belonging to a group gives these poor women committee members the energy and motivation to reach success.

The committee “Rincon Poty” (Flowers’ corner) is proud to be in its fourth cycle. They have been working with Fundacion Paraguaya for one year.

In 2007, there was an epidemic that affected many people in the whole country. A very affected area was the neighborhood where these ladies live. As a result, four members of the committee got dengue and yellow fever. Since they were not able to work, the generation of income in their families slowed down. The whole group organized different events in the neighborhood in order to raise funds to help the ladies.

The businesses these ladies run are: grocery stores, mini-restaurants, sewing shops, and sales of cosmetics, clothing, remedies, jewelry, and chicken. The money provided by the credit will be invested in: sugar, flour, pasta, winter clothing, fabric, remedies etc.

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, flour, pasta, winter clothing, fabrics, remedies etc.

loans.name: Voth

texts.en:
Mrs. Voth D. lives in Prey Leak Neng Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is currently a housewife who always cooks delicious meals for her family. Her husband, Mr. Thon Prak, is a woodsman and farmer.

Mr. Thon Prak’s farm is facing a small problem because he lacks draft animals, so Mrs. Voth D. is asking for a loan to buy a cow to work with their current cow as draft animals on the farm.

Mrs. Voth D. is 47 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom works in a garment factory, while another looks after the cow. The remaining two attend school. Mrs. Voth D. used a previous loan to buy fertilizer to support their rice field.

Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow to use as a draft animal

loans.name: Victoria Francisca

texts.es:
“Bodeguita Santa Celodonia” is Francisca’s general store. More than six years ago, she decided to set up a space in her home to sell groceries, thus meeting the demands of her customers, who are always satisfied with the cordiality and good service that they receive daily. Francisca started selling few goods in the inconvenient space, but with the passing of time and with her family’s support, they were able to refurbish their home and increase product variety. She is fortunate to currently have numerous customers. Francisca and her family plan on expanding their general store and increasing its stock. She is sure that with your support, her plans will crystallize.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Bodeguita “Santa Celodonia” es la tienda de Francisca, quien desde hace más de 6 años decidió adecuar un espacio de su casa para la venta de abarrotes, complaciendo así la solicitud de sus clientes quienes quedan satisfechos por la cordialidad y buena atención que diariamente reciben. Francisca inició vendiendo poca mercadería bajo la incomodidad del espacio, pero con el transcurso del tiempo y el apoyo incondicional de su esposo e hijos lograron refaccionar su vivienda y aumentaron la variedad de sus productos, actualmente tiene la dicha de contar con innumerables clientes. Francisca y su familia tienen en mente ampliar y aumentar el stock de su mercadería, está segura que con su apoyo se cristalizará ese proyecto.

loans.use: Expand and restock general store

loans.name: Kalane Ka Kuru Group

texts.en:
This group is called Kalane Ka Kuru. They are business people at the Magburaka town. This is the 3rd loan from Kiva through SMT. Previous loans have created a tremendous impact in the lives of these people and their families. Having repaid their previous loans successfully, they are now requesting a new loan to further enhance their businesses.

These entrepreneurs are: Kadiatu K., Aminata K., Warrah Kabia and Adama F.. They are requesting a loan of Le 3,200,000.00. Kadiatu K. is the leader of this group. She is single with one child. Kadiatu sells market food and has been in this business for the past 10 years.

loans.use: Buy more produce to add to their businesses

loans.name: Waline

texts.fr: Waline D., 40 ans, mariée avec 05enfants et 03 autres personnes en charge est membre du banc villageois de Bayouf Pout à Thiès depuis 3 ans et demi. Elle veut  renforcer son commerce de fruits locaux (mangues et pastèques). Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. <b>Waline sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Waline D., age 40, is married and has five children and three other people in her care. She has been a member of the village bank of Bayouf Pout in Thiès for three and a half years. She wants to bolster her commerce in local fruit (mangoes and watermelons). The income derived from her commerce will enable her to improve her family's living conditions. Waline is requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell local fruit

loans.name: Yeang

texts.en: Mrs. Yeang N., a 26-year-old farmer and mother of two children who attend the local school in Preal Village in Takeo Province, is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers for her currently infertile field. Her husband, Mr. Sieng Ny, is a construction worker who makes a small income that helps support his household.  He is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers to support her field.

loans.name: Kokoè

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de sept (07) enfants, Madame Kokoè A. vit avec son mari et leurs enfants. Elle fait le commerce de tissus qu’elle achète et revend. Ce qui lui permet de dégager un peu de revenu  pour contribuer aux charges du ménage. Mais le manque de fonds propre reste son principal problème pour progresser dans cette activité. Elle sollicite donc ce crédit afin de disposer d’un fonds de roulement permanent capable de lui permettre d’exercer convenablement son commerce et de dégager un revenu considérable pour venir plus en aide à son mari.
texts.en:
Marriend and the mother of seven children, Ms. Kokoè A. lives with her husband and their children. She does commerce in fabrics, which she buys and resells. This enables her to earn a little income to help cover household expenses. But the lack of working capital remains her principal problem for making progress. She is therefore requesting this loan in order to have continuous operating funds to enable her to do business appropriately and to earn a considerable income for assisting her husband more.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in fabrics

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Doña Gregoria es una D. las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal “Espíritu Santo” del Centro Poblado D. Chimbo, distrito y provincia D. Yunguyo, departamento D. Puno. Tiene 64 años D. edad, es madre D. 4 hijos y es casada. Asistió al Programa D. Alfabetización durante 3 meses. 

Con el primer préstamo que recibió D. S/.200 aumentó su capital y compró una vaca para engorD.. Hoy en día se dedica a la crianza D. ganado vacuno.

Con este préstamo D. S/.1,500, el cual será cancelado en 5 cuotas, y también con parte D. sus ahorros, comprará un ganado vacuno (toro).

Gregoria desea continuar con su negocio y al mismo tiempo trabajar en  labores agrícolas.
texts.en:
Gregoria is a founding member of the cooperative bank “Espíritu Santo” (“Holy Spirit”) located in the Chimbo center of the Yunguyo province, in Puno. She is 64 years old, the mother of four children, and married. She attended the Program of Letters for three months. With the first loan of 200.00 soles that she received, she increased her working capital and bought a cow to fatten. Currently, she dedicates herself to raising cattle. With this loan of 1,500.00 soles, to be repaid in five installments, and using some of her savings, she will purchase a bull. Gregoria wishes to continue with her business, and concurrently work in farming.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a bull.

loans.name: Im

texts.en:
Im S. is 28 years old and a resident of Kompong Tom province, Cambodia.  He sells wood carvings that he carves from the forest and transports to sell to villagers in his community.  He currently earns the money around of $4 per day.

He is married to Chok Phoeun, who is a good housewife and the mother of five children; two of them are single and three are married.  Two of her children are employed: one is a wood carving seller and another one is a rice harvesting worker as well as a rice mill worker.  

S. and his family are facing difficulty with their old house because it is not so good and is small for them.  Thus, they decided to ask for a loan to purchase equipment to repair their old house.  The loan will make the family's living conditions comfortable.

loans.use: To purchase equipment to repair their old house

loans.name: Nuon

texts.en:
S. is a 37-year-old resident of Kandal Province, Cambodia. He currently catches fish to sell retail in the market and makes an average of $3 each day. In the business, he is relying on fishing around Tunle Sap Lake and the other ponds in the area of his community. He is married to Thon, 41, who makes a living braiding mats from home to sell for a profit. The couple are the parents of three children; all of them are still attending school.

Fishing is S.'s main source of stable income for the family's living expenses. In order to make the business more successful, he is asking for a loan to buy more fishing implements to supply his business.

loans.use: To buy more fishing implements for  his business

loans.name: Las Triunfadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo de 3 mujeres llamado las Triunfadoras se ha formado en la colonia 28 de marzo, sus integrantes son Santos Isabel O. de 45 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos, una de sus hijas murio ahogada hace 8 años en una piscina, le a costado reponerse por este acontesimiento, el varon tiene 22 años ya se graduo y tiene un negocio de reparacion de celulares y una niña que esta en la escuela, a todos ellos ha logrado mantener por medio de la venta de cosmeticos, ella necesita el credito para comprar lociones, cremas, shampoos.
Yesenia S. de 20 años de edad, madre soltera y tiene un bebe de 3 meses, el padre no se hizo responsable y le ha tocado cubrir con todos los gastos de su hijo, con la ayuda de la mama que se lo cuida mientras ella trabaja, ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos y ropa usada enviada de estados unidos, gracias a este negocio esta saliendo adelante pero necesita comprar mas fardos ya que su hijo necesita comida, ropa, pañales, medicamentos y todo esto lo tiene que cubrir ella.
Leonor C. de 39 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos pero uno ya se graduo, esta trabajando y le ayuda a ella en algunos gastos del hogar, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas de lunes a domingo, a la vez tiene la venta de ropa en su casa, ella tiene muchos clientes ya que los clientes que le comprar las tortillas le comprar ropa, ella se separo de su esposo y tiene que pagar todos los gastos de su hogar ya que el no le ayuda en nada.
texts.en:
The three-woman group Triunfadoras has been formed in the 28 of March village. Its members are Santos Isabel O., who is 45 years old and has three children. One of her daughters drowned eight years ago in a pool, which was very difficult and has made it hard for her to get her life back in order. Her son is 22 years old, already graduated and has a cellphone repair shop. Her daughter is still in school. Santos Isabel has been able to provide for them thanks to her cosmetics sales, and she needs a loan to buy lotions, creams, and shampoos. Yesenia S. is 20 years old, a single mother of a 3 month old baby whose father doesn't support them, so she has had to pay for all the costs of child care by herself, with the help of her mother who takes care of the baby while Yesenia works. Yesenia sells shoes and used clothing sent from the United States. Thanks to this business she is putting one foot in front of the other and succeeding, but she needs to buy more merchandise to sell because her baby needs food, clothing, diapers, medicine, and she has to pay for it all herself. Leonor C. is 39 years old, a single mother, and has two children, one of whom has already graduated who is working and helps Leonor with some of the household expenses. She sells tortillas every day, and at the same time also sells clothing in her home. She has many customers who buy both tortillas and clothes from her. Leonor separated from her husband and she has to pay all the household expenses since he does not help her at all.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying bundles of used clothing, makeup, firewood, cornmeal, salt, water, lime, and matches.

loans.name: Razia M. Ilyas Group

texts.en:
Razia baji is a 39 year old married lady and citizen of Lahore, Pakistan for the past 40 years. Razia baji married a M. I., who drives an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) and has 5 years of experience. Razia baji has six children: three sons and three daughters. Her elder son has a utensils selling business. The others are getting their education from a school near their house. Razia baji’s first two daughters have a sewing clothes business. Razia baji taught them how to sew clothes, and now her daughters can independently sew clothes. Razia baji saves her daughters' income and plans to marry them off when she collects enough. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy an electric sewing machine to help them sew clothes. 

Razia baji is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Another Razia baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes. Nazia baji and Maqsoodan baji each want a loan to buy clothes for clothes selling businesses. Bilquis baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit selling business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an electric sewing machine.

loans.name: Litia

texts.en: Litia F., 46, is married with three children.  She has many years of experience in men and women's outfit design business. She sells to the villagers and public seven days per week. She has three previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala. SPBD loans are Litia’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. All her loan will be used to fund things needed for the business.

loans.use: To purchase fabric, materials and a new sewing machine

loans.name: Johna

texts.en: Mrs. Johna D. is a 32-year-old from Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is married to a farmer and blessed with five children. She started a business with a minimal amount only. Being a member of Paglaum MPC she is able to acquire additional capital for her business. She sells snacks to neighbors, friends and relatives. She is coping well with the challenges of her business. Determination in life is what she has. Her heart’s desire is to have a small stall for a sari-sari (variety) store and to send their children to school and witness them be successful in the future.

loans.use: Additional capital for snacks vending

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Mrs. Rebecca D. started her business with her own capital. She's now on her fourth loan cycle intending to buy fertilizer. Rebecca is 32 years old, married and blessed with three children. They are bona fide residents of Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidental. Previously, their production was really affected by bad weather, but now they're thankful the operation is back to normal and it is quite good compared to before. Her plans for the business are to buy additional land to increase production. For her family, she dreams that her children finish school until college and someday find decent and stable jobs.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en:
Gifty is thirty years old and married with two children. She is currently living with her husband and the children in a rented two bedroom house at Kasoa where they live. Her husband is a commercial driver.

Gifty realizes the need to support her family with additional income so she decided to start a trade. She has been selling Frytol cooking oil and fresh and tinned tomatoes for the past five years at Kasoa’s new market. She buys her supply of Frytol vegetable cooking oil and tomatoes from wholesalers and retails them to her customers who are mostly households, food vendors, etc.

With the loan, Gifty wants to buy vegetable oil and tomatoes in bulk to cater for the demands of her customers. She wants to use the proceeds from her operation to support the children in school.

Gifty is a member of the group called Kronkron which means Holy. Members agree to guarantee and support one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy vegetable oil and tomatoes in bulk

loans.name: Victoria Bonifacia's Group

texts.es:
La señora Bonifacia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “San Juan de Dios”, del distrito de Lampa Provincia de San Román, Departamento de Puno. Tiene 47 años, es madre soltera y tiene 01 hijo, posee estudios de secundaria completa. Vive en el Barrio Unión Barrio Abajo en Jr. Espinar Nº 123 Lampa.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi 1 año, inició su trabajo con un préstamo de S/. 500.00 el cuál le permitió comprar gaseosas para su tienda.

Actualmente solicita un préstamo de S/. 800.00, el cuál le permitirá incrementar su negocio comprando una gran cantidad de gaseosas de diversas marcas para luego venderlas al por mayor. 

Su mayor sueño es seguir trabajando para agrandar su negocio y convertirse en una distribuidora.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y la forma de pago de su Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Bonifacio is a member of the San Juan de Dios Community Bank in the Lampa district, San Román province, Puno department. She is a 47 year old single mother with one son. She has a high school education. She lives in the Barrio Unión Barrio Abajo on Jr. Espinar Nº 123 Lampa. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for almost one year. She started her work with a loan for 500 PEN, which allowed her to buy soft drinks for her store. She currently needs a loan for 800 PEN, which will allow her to expand her business by purchasing a large quantity of various brands of soft drinks. Later, she will sell them wholesale. Her biggest dream is to keep working to expand her business and convert it into a distributorship. She likes the savings and the form of payment of her Community Bank.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy different brands of soft drinks

loans.name: Magreth

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 24 year old Magreth M. from Mwanza. She is single. Magreth has been running a clothes business since 2008. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Magreth currently earns about 250USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to add more clothes to her business. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Magreth thanks you for her support!

ABOUT SELFINA!
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To add more clothes to her business.

loans.name: Petra

texts.es:
La señora Petra M. tiene ya mas de tres años dedicándose a la venta de abarrotes, esté negocio es la fuente de ingresos de su familia.
Ella desea invertirle al negocio mercancía de papelería y mercería, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión que planea, es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo y así su negocio crecerá más y tendrá mas ingreso, y con el cual pagara el crédito.
texts.en:
Petra M. has been selling groceries for more than three years now. This business is her family’s source of income.
She wants to buy stationery and haberdashery merchandise for her business, but she does not have the necessary money for this planned investment. This is why she is requesting a loan. This way her business will grow and she will make more income, which she will use to repay the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock up on merchandise

loans.name: Jhonatan

texts.es: Jhonatan a su corta edad (18), es un joven experto en las técnicas agrícolas. En su familia son 6 hermanos, de los cuales, 2 de ellos viven con sus padres. Desde que obtuvo la mayoría de edad se ha propuesto incrementar sus siembras, pues conoce sus cultivos y planea asegurar sus cosechas con la ayuda de fertilizantes químicos. De lograr cosechar buenos frutos espera comercializarlos en el mercado mayoristas de la ciudad de Tarma y así ir ganando experiencia también como comerciante. Cultivar y cuidar de sus siembras le satisface de sobremanera, puesto que es la única actividad que realiza de muy pequeño y con esta actividad  sus padres le brindaron techo y alimentación. Por ello que hace planes de sembrar numerosas hectáreas de papas y arvejas para obtener las ganancias necesarias para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Jhonatan solicitó que le permitan ingresar a un banco comunal y cuando los miembros del grupo y MFP lo aprobaron, agradeció muy emocionado, recalcando no defraudar a la confianza depositada. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos para su siembra de papas y arvejas.
texts.en:
At such a young age, Jhonatan (who is 18) is an expert in farming techniques. He has six brothers, two of whom live with his parents. Since becoming an adult, he has proposed to increase his crop plantings because he is knowledgeable and wants to guarantee his harvest with the help of chemical fertilizers. In order to generate good earnings, he plans to sell his crops in the wholesale markets in Tarma where he has gained experience as a trader. Cultivating and caring for his crops gives him great satisfaction because this same line of work enabled his parents to provide him with food and shelter. Therefore, Jhonatan plans to plant several acres of potatoes and peas to generate profits that will improve the quality of life for his family.

Jhonatan has requested to join a communal bank, and was approved by MFP and his fellow group members. They are excited to have him and have emphasized the importance of not violating one another’s trust. Jhonatan will use his loan to purchase chemical fertilizers for his crop of potatoes and peas.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Покупка запчастей

loans.name: Ramadhan

texts.en: Ramadhani A., a married Tanzanian entrepreneur, runs a food shop at Yombo Vituka ward in Dar es Salaam. He sells a variety of products including wheat flour, maize flower, beans, sugar and cooking oil. He purchases the goods from the wholesale shops and then retails them to his customers at the shop. He has been running the business for six years and manages to meet his daily family and business requirements from his income. He is requesting a loan of Tshs 800,000 to buy more goods to sell.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Olga Mary

texts.es:
La señora OLGA MARY V. M. tiene 45 años de edad vive en el distrito de MACHE , provincia de OTUZCO, departamento de La Libertad, Perú. es casada y tiene 3 hijos y todos dependen de ella ya que son pequeños y se encuentran en le colegio.
Presenta estudios hasta 3ero de secundaria ya que al quedad embarazada a los 16 años ya no pudo volver a estudiar y se dedicó a su esposo y a la crianza de sus hijos.
OLGA se dedica a la venta de productos en la tienda de comestibles que tiene en su casa , pero también se dedica a la  crianza de cuyes, pollos, gallinas y pavos.
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles empezó a comprar sus primeros 
Productos alimenticios al por mayor en especial el arroz, azúcar y aceite.
Con el crédito de 1,000 lo invertirá en la compra también de productos alimenticios la por mayor y en la compra de cuyes y pavos.
OLGA sueña con aumentar la crianza de sus animales y con ampliar su tienda de comestibles para obtener dinero y poder darle estudios y lo que sus hijos necesiten.
texts.en:
Olga Mary V. M. is 45 years old and lives in the district of Mache in the Otuzco province in the department of La Libertad in Peru. She is married and has 3 children who are dependent on her since they are young and are in school. She went to school until the third year of high school since she became pregnant at the age of 16 and could not return to her studies. Instead, she dedicated herself to her husband and to raising her children. Olga sells products at a grocery store that she has in her house, but she also breeds guinea pigs, chickens, hens, and turkeys. With her first loan of 300 soles she began to buy her first wholesale food products such as rice, sugar, and oil. With this loan of 1,000 [soles], she will invest in purchasing wholesale food products as well as guinea pigs and turkeys. Olga dreams of increasing the breeding of her animals and expanding her grocery store in order to make more money so that she can provide for her children and send them to school.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wholesale food products and to buy guinea pigs and turkeys

loans.name: Janneth Susana

texts.es: La señora Janneth Susana, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Rosales”, Distrito de San José de Sisa, Provincia del Dorado, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 27 años y es madre de 01 hijo, todos ellos ya independientes.Lleva 05 años dedicándose a la venta de Medicinas. Se inicio con un capital de S/. 800.00 y poco a poco, fue implementando su Botica, que hoy en día le esta dando muy buenos resultados. Ella y su esposo, están muy contentos, por el logro que obtuvieron, gracias al Movimiento Manuela Ramos.Ya es muy conocida por sus clientes en el barrio donde vive y sus ventas diarias son muy buenas. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio ubicada al costado de su casa, en un local muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes.Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará más medicinas, como: Aspirinas, tetraciclina, panadol antigripal, reoxican, apronax, febrax, de esta manera satisfacer a sus clientes. Janeth Susana, es una mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante para el bienestar de su familia y de ella misma. Manifiesta su mas gentil agradecimiento al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer y apoyar a otras mujeres que también quieren salir adelante.
texts.en:
Janneth Susana is a member of the Community Bank "Los Rosales", in the San Jose de Sisa district in Dorado, San Martin. She is married, she is 27 years old and she is the mother of one. She has been selling medicines for the past 5 years. She started out with a capital fund of S/.800 and slowly she set up her store, the same store that today is flourishing. She and her husband are very happy with the results of their efforts, and it is all thanks to the Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) movement. She is now well known by her clients in the district where they live and her daily sales are very good. Currently she is still running the same business located alongside her home, a store that is well equipped to attend the clientele.

With this loan of S/.1000 she will purchase more medicines, such as: aspirines, tetracycline, flu medication, reoxican, apronax, and febrax to better supply her clients. Janneth Susana is a woman with a strong desire to succeed, for the good of her family and for herself. She conveys her most sincere thanks to the Manuela Ramos movement for allowing her to develop as a small-business woman and to support other women that also want to find success.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase medicines.

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Hazel T. is from the village of Poblacion. She is 37 years old. Hazel is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Hazel owns and operates a venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Hazel has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2000, Hazel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hazel has successfully repaid previous loans from PMPC. Hazel is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 15th loan taken out by Hazel from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Mrs. Sol Phat Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan consists of thirteen people and is located in Khnar Thum village in Takeo province. All of the members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Sol P. is the village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice. Aside from this plantation, she is also a weaver. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy raw materials to support her business. Mrs. Sol P. is a 55 year old widow with four children, two of whom are laborers while the others attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy raw materials to support her business.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en: Omar is 45 years old and married with ten children. He has been working as a fisherman since 1989. Over the years, he has been able to meet his children's needs thanks to his business income. Today, Omar is requesting to borrow $1,000 to buy special tools for his job.

loans.use: to buy special tools

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng S., 24, is a widow and lives with her two young children. She sells dessert and makes about US$5 of profit every day.

Heng S. is asking for a loan of US$1,000 to reinvest in her dessert business as well as to purchase a motorbike and a trailer to transport her equipment.

loans.use: To invest in her business and to purchase a motorbike and a trailer to transport her equipment

loans.name: Parviz

texts.en:
Y. Parviz is 24 years old. He sells DVD disks. He tries to have all the new movies, as well as concerts of the popular actors, singers and others. He also provides computer services such as audio editing of videotapes and discs with records of family events of his clients. Parviz tries to use modern, up-to-date technologies in his work so he can satisfy the demands and requirements of the customers. The business is successful in generating a good income for his family.

Today Parviz requests 5000 Somoni. He is planning to purchase a lot of DVD disks to increase the range of goods he has to sell. Parviz thanks all lenders who are supporting him and promises to be accurate in loan payment.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase DVDs to sell

loans.name: Ulziinasan

texts.en:
C. Ulziinasan is a 32-year-old widow who lives with her 5-year-old son in the Chingeltei district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Ulziinasan operates a food retail business in two rented stands in Dalaihuu market. Her business has been in operation since 2000 and her working capital is currently around 2,000,000 tugrugs. Her daily sales are between 120,000 and 160,000 tugrugs and her monthly profits are between 290,000 and 300,000 tugrugs.

Because of her monthly profits, good business experience, and loyal customers, Ulziinasan has been able to provide for her son after her husband's sudden death last spring. The mother and son live in their own 'ger', or Mongolian nomadic tent, in their own yard on the outskirts of the city. Ulziinasan hopes to keep growing her business in the future and therefore she is requesting an 800,000 tugrugs loan (approx. $550 USD) loan in order to purchase a large amount of food to sell.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of food

loans.name: Jalolidin

texts.ru: Меликов Джалолидин проживает в районе А. Джоми. Возраст, 46 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Меликов Джалолидин имеет среднее образование. Животноводством занимается более 15 лет. Он откармливает и продает скот. Кредит берет для закупа скота.
texts.en:
Jalolidin M. lives in the A. Jomi region. He is 46 years old; married with 4 children. Jalolidin has a high-school education. He has worked in animal husbandry for over 15 years. He fattens up and sells livestock. He is requesting the loan to purchase cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Melyakova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase cattle

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo M. G. tiene 62 años, es casado, y  tiene cinco hijos.  Vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.

El socio es  miembro de la ventanilla rural Calzado Solidario es un recinto que se encuentra a quince minutos del Cantón San Miguel en la vía a la costa.  Son 19 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura y la crianza de animales menores.

Eduardo trabaja en la agricultura y a la carpintería para incrementar la economía de la familia.  Los cultivos que más sobresalen son el maíz y papas.  El maíz vende en la casa y las papas en el mercado del Cantón San Miguel.

La cultura principal es el carnaval que se celebra todos los años en febrero.  También, a Eduardo le gusta estudiar la Biblia.

Eduardo solicita el crédito para comprar insumos para el trabajo del campo y para compra de materiales para el taller de carpintería.  Su meta es tener una buena actividad económica para la familia.  Los desafíos que enfrenta son los problemas climáticos  que afectan a los cultivos y el precio de la madera.
texts.en:
Eduardo M. G. is 62 years old, married, and has five children. He lives in the San Miguel region of the province of Bolívar. The associate is a member of the Calzado Solidario rural district, which is a precinct that is located fifteen minutes from San Miguel on the way to the coast. There are 19 associates in all, the majority of whom are dedicated to agriculture and the breeding of smaller animals. Eduardo works in agriculture and carpentry to increase the family income. The crops that do best are corn and potatoes. The corn he sells from the house and the potatoes in the market of San Miguel. The main cultural event is the carnival that is celebrated every year in February. Also, Eduardo likes to study the Bible. Eduardo requests the loan to buy supplies for his work in the fields and to purchase materials for his carpentry workshop. His goal is to have a good income for his family. The challenges that he faces are the climatic problems that affect the crops and the price of wood.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials for working his fields and supplies for his carpentry shop.

loans.name: Safya Hama Group

texts.en:
Homa is the group leader of the Safya Hama group. She is 52 years old, and she lives in the 1st district of Kabul Province in Afghanistan. She is married with five children. She has three daughters and two sons who are in school.

Homa wants a loan for her husband's business. He has a general store in which he sells different kinds of things. He wants to expand his business by buying more materials, especially the things that are more in demand, such as canned meat and drinks. He wants to attract more clients. He hopes to have a bigger shop and a higher monthly income in order to send their children to good schools.

The group has requested a loan of 30,000 AFN. Homa's husband is happy that there is a nice process that can solve the entrepreneurs' problems.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell, such as canned meat and drinks

loans.name: Uurtsaih

texts.en: Uurtsaih is 30 years old and lives with her daughter in Tuv province, Mongolia. She and her daughter live together in a ger, the traditional Mongolian housing tent. Currently, she operates a secondhand product trading business at Tsaiz market, one of the most crowded markets in Mongolia. Uurtsaih sells secondhand products such as clothing and blankets at her counter, which is in a good location. She started her business in November 2009 with a working capital of 500,000 tugrugs (~ 352 USD), and she has steadily expanded her business. Presently, Uurtsaih's working capital exceeds 1,400,000 tugrugs (~ 985 USD). Originally, before she started her own business, she worked as a salesperson in a grocery store that belongs to a person named Munhjargal. Uurtsaih has gained much experience in previous years and she is a very hard working person. Uurtsaih says, “I would like to expand the production line and expand my business.” She is requesting a 2,000,000-tugrug loan to purchase a large amount of secondhand products at wholesale to resell them for a profit.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of secondhand products

loans.name: Sulaiman

texts.en: Mr. S. Sulaiman is forty-nine years old. He has a charcoal store. He is using the loan to expand his business by purchasing bags of charcoal from villages to resell at his store. He has been operating the business for eight years. He expects to own a large wholesale charcoal store to attract as many customers as he can.

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 45 años, es un hombre muy trabajador, el comparte su vida con su pareja y su hijo. Todos ellos viven juntos en su casa propia. Desde hace 16 años él se dedica a brindar servicio de albañil en la zona en la que vive, actividad que le ha resultado muy rentable para mantener a su familia. Los largos años de experiencia se encargaron de darle a Juan un buen prestigio y por ende buenos contratos, sus clientes siempre terminan contentos con el buen acabado que deja en sus obras y eso le da mucha satisfacción. Ahora quiere mejorar su negocio comprando mejores herramientas, pues las que actualmente posee están desgastadas por el constante uso que les da. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete en ser muy puntual con todos los pagos.
Con el crédito que solicita, espera comprar mejores herramientas que le faciliten el trabajo y así poder cumplir con los contratos que tiene pendiente.
texts.en:
Juan is a hard-working man who is 45 years old. He shares his life with his partner and son. They all live together in their own home. For the last 16 years, he has made his living has a builder in the area where he lives. This work has been very profitable and helped him support his family. His many years of experience have given Juan a lot of prestige and consequently good contracts. His customers are always happy with the finished product, which gives him a lot of satisfaction. He now wants to improve his business by purchasing better tools. The ones he currently owns are worn out from their constant use. This is his first loan with MFP, and he promises to be on time with all payments. With the requested loan, he hopes to purchase better tools, which will make work easier for him, and thereby enable him to fulfill his pending contracts.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase new tools.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida G., age 44, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She is married to Rico, a driver, and their marriage is blessed with 4 children. She helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has primarily been managing her rug-making business.

Aida has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow from CCT’s Cooperative 11 times.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her businesses.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 17,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business. She will use the loan funds to buy more products that are needed to replenish and maintain the operations of her businesses.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide a happy and comfortable life for her family.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for rug-making

loans.name: Nourn

texts.en: Nourn V., 47, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia – an area known for clay and ceramic products. She sells vegetables and produces clay pigs for an income of about $4 US per day. Her husband is employed at an anti-landmine non-governmental organization, earning $5 US per day to help cover the family's expenses. V. is requesting a loan of $1000 US to purchase vegetable seeds and a water pump. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her third loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner in Cambodia. V. appears in the photograph with her husband.

loans.use: To buy vegetable seeds and a water pump

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent M. is 27 years old and married, and has a two-month old child. He slaughters goats and sells skewers of the grilled meat. He also sells a few foods, such as green bananas. In addition, he buys and sells cattle to merchants who sell them in the city. He has been in this business for 7 years. His wife is a tailor but she does not work at a moment due to a lack of capital. She is currently helping her husband with his different businesses. He would like to have a loan to increase the number of animals he butchers and sells, in addition to growing more bananas. With the profits, he hopes to renovate his house.

About the Bank:
Urwego Opportunity Bank (UOB) is a public limited company established to provide financial services as a ladder of opportunity to the poor and small entrepreneurs for whom access to formal financial capital is currently limited. UOB's vision is to be a sustainable financial institution achieving significant economic, social and spiritual transformational impact on the underprivileged of Rwanda through a variety of products and related training in a way that reflects the love of Jesus Christ.

loans.use: Buying goats and enriching his garden

loans.name: Reyna Elizabeth

texts.es:
Doña Reyna C. tiene 40 años de edad, vive en el Barrio las Arenas de la Ciudad de Choluteca, Reyna se dedica a la fabricacion y venta de tortillas, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion. 
Reyna es madre de 3 hijos, los cuales 2 los tiene estudiando en un colegio publico de su comunidad.
Reyna se levanta a las 4 de la mañana todos los dias para empezar su produccion, hace unas ricas tortillas.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas materia prima para la fabricacion de las tortillas ya que en estos momentos sus ventas han mejorado pero la produccion que tiene es muy poca y se queda sin vender tortillas, esto le esta ocasionando perdidas.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir con los gastos del hogar y para salir adelante con su familia, darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
su sueño es ver graduados a sus hijos y que sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Reyna C., age 40, lives in the Arenas neighborhood in the city of Choluteca. Reyna makes and sells tortillas. Her business is located in her house. Reyna has three children. Two of them are in the community’s public school. Reyna gets up at four every morning to start her production of making delicious tortillas. She will use the loan to buy raw material to make tortillas. At this time her sales have been improving. But, her production is very small, and she is left without tortillas to sell. This is causing losses. She needs the income to cover the household expenses and for her family to get ahead. She also needs it to give her children a better quality of life. Her dream is to see her children graduated and to see them become good professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy firewood, lime powder, corn flour, and water

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie L. is from Gango, Ozamiz City. She is 39 years old. Rosalie is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Rosalie owns & operates a specialized retail store selling nipa in the local community. Rosalie has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rosalie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rosalie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Carla Roxana

texts.es: La Sra. Carla Roxana vive en la zona sur Urb. El Palmar , tiene una venta de abarrotes la cual atiende en el dia y por las noches estudia en la universidad, tambien tiene un punto internet en la cual es ayudada por su hermana y cuenta con el apoyo de sus padres.El prestamo es para aumentar su venta, surtirla con mas productos, como ser fideo, arroz, aceite, refrescos, dulces, etc.Ella es una persona trabajadora, se esfuerza por salir adelante con la venta de abarrotes y sus estudios su deseo es de llegar a ser profecional y asi poder mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Carla Roxana lives in the southern part of the El Palmar neighborhood. She has a grocery business which she attends to during the day and she studies at the university in the evenings. She also has an internet cafe, her sister and parents help her with this. The loan is to make her able to increase her sales by increasing her assortment of products, such as noodles, rice, oil, refreshments, sweets, etc.. She is a hard working person, she puts much effort in getting ahead with the sales of groceries and her studies. Her desire is to become a professional and this way be able to improve the quality of life of her whole family. She is very thankful to Emprender and Kiva for their trust in awarding this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, noodles, oil.

loans.name: Sâr

texts.en: Sâr N. is a tailor who works from her home. Sewing clothes is a daily routine that she has been engaged in for a long time. She provides her services to her neighbors, sewing both traditional and modern clothes. She runs her business very well and a lot of customers recognize the good service she provides. Sâr N. was married, but divorced her husband some years ago. She has three children; two daughters are employed in a garment factory. She will use her loan to buy more tailoring tools to perform her service.

loans.use: to buy more tailoring tools

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana Maria tiene 29 años, su actividad es venta de ropa variada, productos de medicina natural entre otras cosas. Ella es una persona que busca la forma de trabajar y proporcionarle a su familia lo necesario. Tiene 3 hijos menores de edad a su cargo, cuando inicio este negocio fue por su Mama que le enseño a trabajar de la manera más humilde y sincera. Ella tiene muchos clientes de los cuales siempre le solicitan diferentes productos. Este financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima e invertir de todo un poco. Ella sueña con mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
29-year old Ana Maria earns her living by selling clothing, natural medicines, and other items. She is the kind of person who seeks out work so she can provide the necessities for her family. She has three young children to support. When she started out, it was her mother who taught her how to work in a straightforward and sincere way. She has many customers who are always asking her for different products. Ana Maria will use the loan to buy other merchandise so she has a little of everything. Her dream is to make improvements to her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Maria Salvadora

texts.es:
María tiene 26 años D. edad, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos D. 4 y 2 años D. edad, residen en el barrio el calvario D. Guatajiagua en Morazán, ella se dedica a la elaboración D.
