Comales D. barro, oficio que aprendió por su abuela quien le enseño desD. muy pequeña, su trabajo lo inicia desD. las siete D. la mañana hasta las seis D. la tarD..
María está solicitando un crédito que utilizara para la compra D. barro que es la materia prima para su negocio, al igual que comprar comales en otros pequeños negocios para después comercializarlos y ver la posibilidad D. tener una ganancia.
Este crédito le beneficiará para el crecimiento D. su negocio e incrementar sus ingresos que ayuden a solventar sus necesidades y las D. su familia.
Sus aspiraciones son poseer un negocio estable, mayores ingresos para poder iniciar la construcción D. una casa más segura y mejorar las condiciones D. vida D. la familia.
texts.en:
María, 26, lives with her husband and two children who are 4 and 2 years of age in El Calvario D. Guatajiagua, Morazán. She makes clay comales (a smooth, flat griddle typically used in Latin America to cook tortillas, toast spices, sear meat, and generally prepare food), a skill she learned from her grandmother who taught her how to make them when she was still a little girl. She starts her work day at 7am and goes until 7pm. María is asking for a loan to buy the clay that’s her main raw ingredient for her business as well as to buy some comales in other small businesses to later resell and see if she might earn additional profits. The loan will be of use for her business’ growth and increase her income that will help her meet household and family needs. Her goals are to have a stable business, increased income in order to start to build a safer home and improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clay to make earthenware Comales (a smooth, flat griddle typically used in Latin America to cook tortillas, toast spices, sear meat, and generally prepare food).

loans.name: Elidia

texts.es:
Elidia es una madre D. familia D. 38 años D. edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos en el caserío La Pilca, una zona rural que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito D. Olmos, un distrito agrícola que produce principalmente frutos como el limón, el mango y la maracuyá. Se encuentra ubicado en la provincia D. Lambayeque. La zona esta situada aproximadamente a dos horas y media D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta D. artículos D. primera necesidad y abarrotes en una pequeña bodega – tienda instalada en un ambien D. su domicilio. En ese establecimiento ella ofrece a sus clientes diversos productos D. consumo diario a los cuales no tienen acceso rápido debido a que se encuentran ubicados a veinte minutos del pueblo D. Olmos. Por este motivo ella siempre se esfuerza por mantener surtido su negocio y ofrecer a sus clientes una variedad D. productos que satisfagan sus necesidades.

Elidia desea ampliar su negocio con la compra D. más productos D. modo que pueda ampliar su negocio y percibir mayores ingresos. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1500 nuevos soles que contribuyan al logro D. su objetivo.

Elidia es una mujer responsable y bastante entregada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida. Anteriormente ya ha tenido créditos con Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento D. asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Elidia is a 38 year-old mother who lives with her husband and their 3 children in the rural settlement called  La Pilca, located in a rural area in the Olmos district, an agricultural district that produces mainly fruit such as lemons, mangoes and  passion fruit.  It is located in the Lambayeque province, in an area that is approximately 2 and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo.

Elidia sells staple consumer goods and groceries in a small store that she has set up in an area of her house.  In this establishment she offers her customers a variety of everyday consumer products which are not widely available in the area, since it is located 20 minutes from the town of Olmos.  For this reason, she always strives to keep her store well-stocked and to offer her customers a variety of products that suit their needs.

Elidia wants to expand her business by buying more products; this will allow her to have a bigger business and increase her earnings.  To do this, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,500 Peruvian soles, that will help her to achieve this objective.

Elidia is a responsible woman who is very dedicated to her family.  Her main desire is to continue to grow as a businesswoman so that she can proviD. her family with a better quality of life.  She has taken loans previously from Edpyme Alternativa, and has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility in making her payments.

loans.use: to buy consumer staple goods and groceries to expand the store that she has set up in her house

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim  is a 20-year-old single man who supports his eight siblings and two parents. He borrowed $2000 to improve his existing grocery store, which was established in 2008.

The grocery store is Ibrahim’s only source of income; accordingly he struggles to improve it to increase his monthly income to support his family.

loans.use: To improve his grocery store

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina pertenece al Banco Comunal Yana Ñahui,tiene 60 años, es casada y tiene 11 hijos.
Cristina tiene actualmente un restaurante,antes se dedicaba a la venta carne, pero no le fue bien, fió a sus caseros y no le pagaron. Despues alquilo un local del gremio de Carniceros en San Juan Bautista, ahí ha instalado su restaurante y le va bien.
Cristina solicita uncrédito de S/.2,500.00 que lo va a invertir en mercaderías para abastecer su restaurante.
A Cristina le gusta Finca, porque puede acceder a los créditos y a la vez puede ahorrar, estando en Finca educó a sus hijos aprendió a ser puntual, cumplida y responsable. 
Su sueño es tener su propio negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Cristina belongs to the Yana Ñahui community bank.  She is 60 years old, married and has 11 children.  Cristina currently has a restaurant.  Before this she used to sell meat but it didn't go so well.  She trusted her customers and they didn't pay her.  She then rented premises from the Butchers' Guild in San Juan Bautista.  She set up her restaurant there and it is successful.

Cristina is requesting a loan for 2,500 soles which she will use to purchase merchandise to supply her restaurant.

Cristina likes Finca because she has access to loans and at the same time she can save.  Through being in Finca she has educated her children and learned to be punctual and responsible.

Her dream is to have her own business and for her children to become professionals.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Angelica Faustina

texts.es:
Angélica es una madre de familia de  38 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el sector La Clake, una zona rural que tiene como principales actividades a la agricultura y la crianza de animales, pertenece al distrito de Reque, una zona situada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo. 

Angélica tiene una pequeña bodega en donde vende todo tipo de abarrotes y gaseosas, sus ventas los realiza a diario y sus principales clientes son los pobladores de la zona, tiene varios años de experiencia en este rubro, y debido a la calidad de productos que ofrece y al buen trato que brinda cuenta con una clientela fiel. Además se dedica a la crianza de cuyes los cuales los vende tanto vivos como sacrificados.  

Angélica desea ampliar su bodega y aumentar sus ventas para percibir mayores ganancias, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer bastante responsable y entregada a su familia. Las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien responsable y de confianza.
texts.en:
Angelica is a 38-year-old mother  who lives with her husband and children in La Clake, a rural area whose main business activities are farming and rearing animals. La Clake is in the district of Reque, which is twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo. 

Angelica has a small store where she sells all kinds of groceries and sodas. She sells her products every day and her main customers are local residents. She has several years' experience in this field, and due to the quality of her products and the way she treats her customers, she has a loyal clientele. She also works at breeding guinea pigs, which she sells either alive or slaughtered. 

Angelica wants to expand her store and increase sales to realize greater profits. Therefore, she has seen fit to request a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles from Kiva Field Partner, Edpyme Alternativa. 

She is a responsible woman who is devoted to her family. People who know her regard her as both responsible and trustworthy.

loans.use: To buy basic items and groceries to expand her business

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a resident of Nyamira Town in western Kenya and has been doing mixed farming for 13 years. He sells the milk, tea, beans, maize and nappier grass that he produces to the government and locally.

He has requested a loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He hopes the loan will provide income enough to build a new home for his family. He also plans to expand his land with funds from his poshomill (cereal-grinding machine) business.

He says funds are the limitation and wishes he could get more.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia B. is a widow who lives in Sitio Batang, Brgy. Talaban, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: fishing and food vending businesses. Letecia joined Kiva partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, in 1994 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 23 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Letecia has been gradually lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 24,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 12,000 PHP, thus raising the family's standard of living.
This time, for her 24th loan, she is borrowing 25,000 PHP, which she intends to use to repair and maintain her fishing boat so that she could continue to save up for the future expansion of her business and education of her children. Letecia B. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them 'Dungganon' – a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org.

loans.use: To repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Raul's Group

texts.en:
Raul S. is from the village of Cabisera 2. He is 50 years old. Raul is the group leader of a 10-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Raul S..

Raul is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Raul owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Raul has been engaged in his business for over 30 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Raul joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Raul is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Raul from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KANTU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ana Maria; ella tiene 37 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa, ella vende ropa para mujer en el centro comercial El Altiplano, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de ropa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa como pantalones, chompas, polos y blusas.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Ana María is a member of the “KANTU” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Ana María is 37 years old, single, and has 4 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling clothes.  Ana María sells women's clothes in the "El Altiplano" shopping center.  She works from 8.00am to 8.00pm.  She would like to expand her business and is requesting this loan to buy clothes such as pants, sweaters, polo shirts and blouses.

Ana María is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy clothes such as pants, sweaters, polo shirts and blouses

loans.name: Kadie

texts.en: This is 57-year-old Kadie T..  She is a widow who entered her current line of work, selling African cloth, when her mother died and passed the family business on to her in 1984. She works six days a week, 10 hours a day, and is applying for this loan for Le 4,500,000, to buy more cloth to sell to her customers. She extends sincerest thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy more African cloth to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna is currently in a business of selling charcoal. She is 45 years old and a widow with eight children, all of whom go to school. She took out a loan to stock more charcoal to sell. In the future, Anna hopes to construct a house with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: To stock more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Evelyne

texts.en: Evelyne, a hard-working mother of three schoolchildren ranging in age from 4 - 12 years, sells agricultural medicine, i.e., medicine for both animals and plants. Evelyne is requesting a loan to buy more medicine, and plans to combine the additional profits with her savings to begin building a house.

loans.use: To buy additional inventory of animal and plant medicines

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to construct a new pub

loans.name: Morena Idalia

texts.es: Morena Idalia A.  D. O., D. 57 años D. edad. Habita en su casa con su esposo e hija que ya es mayor D. edad. Como toda mujer trabajadora y luchadora Doña Morena ha logrado a través D. muchos esfuerzos establecer una tiendita en Ciudad Delgado del Departamento D. San Salvador. Ella trabaja D. lleno en su tienda para poder atender a sus clientes cuando necesiten D. sus productos los cuales son: golosinas, pan dulce, azúcar, macarrones, juguetes, productos D. belleza etc. DepenD. mucho D. su negocio y tiene muchas aspiraciones con las ventas que realiza. Por lo que ha decidido solicitar este crédito para invertirlo en su tienda y poder comprar mayor variedad D. productos e innovar su negocio ya que es una mujer emprendedora sabe que debe estar al día con las demandas del mercado para así poder seguir manteniéndolo activo. Con esto espera poder obtener los recursos necesarios para vivir en mejores condiciones junto con su familia.
texts.en:
57-year old Morena Idalia A. D. O. lives with her husband and adult daughter. Like all hardworking strong women, Doña Morena has managed to overcome problems and open her own store in Ciudad Delgado in the department of San Salvador. She works tirelessly in the store to serve her customers with all their needs such as candy, pan dulce (traditional bread), sugar, macaroni, toys, beauty products etc.

She depends greatly on income from the store and has many plans for the money she earns. For that reason, Morena decided to seek a loan to buy a greater variety of products and breathe new life into the store. As she is an enterprising woman she knows that she has to keep on top of what her customers are looking for. Morena hopes that her revitalized store will enable her to afford a better standard of living for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy candy, pan dulce, sugar, macaroni, toys, beauty products etc

location.town: Ciudad Delgado en el departamento de San  Salvador

loans.name: Paola Fernanda

texts.es:
La Señorita. Paola V. es socias del banco comunal Fe y Alegría, vive por el sector del Tiempo en la ciudad de Cuenca que  es de clima frió pero su gente es muy calida, es la tercera ciudad con más importante del país  y  fue nombrada como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad por su gran belleza arquitectónica.

La Señorita Paola tiene 20 años de edad, es soltera y vive con sus padres quienes tienen casa propia, su papá es chofer de profesión y su mamá comerciante.
 
Nuestra socia es de profesión Cosmetóloga y hace 3 meses empezó a trabajar ejerciendo su profesión. Ella tiene un local propio en el cual realiza tratamientos de belleza, labora de lunes a sábados sin un horario fijo.
 
Es socia del  banco comunal hace año y medio, el dinero de su crédito lo invertirá en la compra de cremas fáciles, mascarillas y más productos para su local.

Su meta es tener su propio Spa.
texts.en:
Ms. Paola V. is a member of the Fe y Alegría (Faith and Joy) community bank. She lives in the Tiempo sector of the city of Cuenca, where the climate is cold but the people are very warm. This city is the third most important in the country, and has been named a cultural heritage site for its architectural beauty.

Ms. Paola is a 20-year-old single woman who lives with her parents, who are homeowners. Her father works as a driver while her mother is a merchant.

Our client is a cosmetologist who got started 3 months ago. She has a business space in which she gives beauty treatments, working from Monday through Saturday without a fixed schedule.

She has been a member of the community bank for a year and a half, and will use the money to purchase face cream, facial masks, and other products for her business.

Her goal is to open up her own spa.

loans.use: to purchase face cream, facial masks, and other beauty products.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 47 years old and lives in the Sinkor area. She’s married with 3 children between the ages of 21 and 30. Her husband is a local contractor who works as a welder. Two of her children are presently working, while the other one is still in school.

Lucy operates a small food stall and sells pepper, oil, bitter ball, gari and charcoal. She’s requesting a loan to purchase more pepper, bitter ball, gari and other food items for her business. She wants to improve her house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper, bitter ball, gari and other food items for her business

loans.name: Ramon

texts.en:
Ramon is a farmer who lives in Surallah, South Cotabato with his family. He is married and has kids. Farming is the main source of livlihood of Ramon's family. Ramon works hard to earn a living from his farm. He makes sure his rice crops are growing healthily. Ramon also put up a sari-sari (variety) store that his wife manages. The store helps in their daily needs.

Ramon's loan will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. He hopes to expand his rice farm in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Khadra

texts.en: Khadra is a 58-year-old hardworking widow. She has five children and they live in a tent somewhere in Madaba. Khadra is known for her special kind of homemade bread called “shrak”. She has been baking and selling shrak for more than 20 years now. She also makes yogurt and a special Jordanian dried yogurt called “Jameed” using the the milk from her sheep. Now Khadra has applied for a loan to buy some machines, such as a mixer and other equipment, to facilitate the production of her bread and yogurt. She depends on these projects as a source of income to support her children.

loans.use: to buy new equipment, such as a mixer, for making bread and yogurt.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en: Angela, a 38-year-old, is married and has a 19-year-old child in college.  She has been operating a charcoal selling business.  Previously, she was operating a green grocery. Besides selling charcoal, she owns rental houses that generate additional income.  Angela testifies that since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has grown her business. Angela needs 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy charcoal. She hopes that someday she will expand her business into wholesale.

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Sendmaa

texts.en:
Sendmaa is 36 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a house in Tuv province of Mongolia. Her two children, age 6 and 15, both attend local secondary school. She manages a furniture-making business with the help of her husband in her town.

They started their business in 1997 and gained much experience. Now they make all kinds of furniture such as tables, chairs and hangers. Their business is operating so successfully that they have been able to employ one more worker. Now they have many regular customers who are happy with the quality of their products.

With profits from the business they have been able to buy a workshop for the business and afford repairs to their house. Sendmaa is a kind and polite woman who says, "I am planning to expand my business and hope to have a factory someday." She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase wood for her business.

loans.use: to purchase wood for a carpentry business

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: el señor Miguel es casado y tiene 2 hijos que estan en edad escolar,viven en casa propia, miguel se dedica a la actividad de construccion civil, viene realizando esta labor desde hace 5 años con mucho esfuerso y dedicacion llego a ser maestro de contruccion, su esposa se dedica a las labores de hogar, ademas de vender ropa en su casa  y con ello le ayuda a sus esposo con los gastos familiares, el dinero del prestamo sera invertido en comprar tablas y algunas herramientas esenciales para su trabajo, miguel como mucho hombres tiene muchos sueños uno de ellos es ponerle una tienda de ropa a su esposa para que esi le genere mejores ingresos y con ello mejorar su calidad de vida, miguel esta muy contento con el apoyo que se le esta brindando.
texts.en:
Miguel is married and has two school age children.  They live in their own house.  Miguel works in civil construction.  He has been doing this work for five years.  With a lot of effort and dedication he came to be a master builder.  His wife devotes herself to the household chores.  She also sells clothes at their house.  Through this business she helps her husband with the family expenses.

The money from the loan will be used to buy boards and some tools that are essential to his work.  Miguel, like many men, has a lot of dreams.  One of them is to establish a clothing store for his wife.  This will generate improved earnings, which will improve their quality of life.  Miguel is very happy with the help that is being provided.

loans.use: to buy boards and other tools that are essential for his work.

loans.name: Bartolome

texts.es:
Bartolomé tiene 33 años de edad, el es casado y tiene 2  hijos. El reside en una zona rural del distrito de Lambayeque, para lo cual cuenta con casa propia, la misma que solo cuenta con energía eléctrica. El lugar es pequeño  y  consta de 20 familias aproximadamente 

Bartolomé desde hace varios años se dedica a la crianza y  comercialización de animales menores  y aves de corral como pavos y patos, los cuales cría en corrales amplios ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio, aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. Bartolomé es conocido en su sector y actualmente cuenta con clientela fija para su negocio

Bartolomé desea invertir  hací comprando aves menores para su engorde y posterior comercializacióncomo también su respectivo alimento balanceado, por ello a creído por conveniente solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2500 nuevos soles para que pueda realizar sus propósitos.

Bartolomé cuenta con buen carácter y muy buena disposición para el surgimiento de su negocio, además las personas que lo conocen lo consideran una persona tranquila  y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Bartolomé is 33 years old, married, and has two children.  He lives in a rural area of Lambayeque district.  He owns his own home which only has electricity.  The place in which he lives is small and is home to approximately 20 families.

Bartolomé has been raising and selling farmyard animals and birds such as turkeys and ducks for some years.  He raises the animals in large pens which are located behind his home.  He learned this business from his parents and so he knows it like the back of his hand.  Bartolomé  is well known in his area and currently has regular customers for his business.

Bartolomé would like to invest by purchasing birds to fatten and then sell.  He will also buy balanced feed for the animals.  For this reason, he has requested a loan for 2,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa in order to achieve his goals.

Bartolomé is a man of good character and he is very willing and able to move ahead in his business.  People who know him consider him to be calm and hard working.

loans.use: to buy farmyard birds to raise and then sell, and to buy feed

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is 33 years old and is married to Jane. They are blessed with three children. He is a rice farmer. He has been in the business for seven years with a monthly income of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES), which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his fourth loan with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. He will use the loan to buy farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers and to employ laborers. 

With the anticipated profits from the business he will start a greenhouse project. His hopes are to educate his children and buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers, and to employ laborers

loans.name: Josphina

texts.en:
Josphina is 51 years old and married to Mboya.  She has been running her boutique business for eight years, making a monthly profit of KES.20,000.  This is her second loan. She has been loaned KES.40,000, with which she plans to buy girls' dresses, ladies' wear, t-shirts, sweaters, etc.

With the anticipated profit she plans to support her family. In the near future she hopes to have established herself and her family free from poverty.

loans.use: To buy girls' dresses, ladies' wear, t-shirts, sweaters, etc.

loans.name: Davit

texts.ru:
Давит родился в 1966 г. в городе Каджаран. Жена Давита домохозяйка, сын учится в Капанском политехническом институте, а дочка в Каджаранской средней школе. Сам Давит работает на Зангезурском медно-молибденовом комбинате водителем. 
Параллельно с работой на комбинате, Давит занимается сельским хозяйством в селе Тандзавер. На своей ферме Давит разводит крупный рогатый скот, пчел, а также выращивает овощи и фрукты. Полученную сельхозпродукцию: овощи, фрукты, говядину,  молоко и мед Давит реализует в городах Капан и Каджаран. Давиту очень нравится работать на своей ферме и он получает большое удовольствие от того, что его семья получает натуральные продукты прямо со своей фермы. 
Кредит на сумму 1.000.000 драм необходим Давиту для покупки пяти быков, новых ульев, рамок для меда и сена на зиму, что позволит ему получать больше сельскохозяйственной продукции в будущем.
texts.en: Davit was born in 1966 in the city of Kadjaran.  His wife is a homemaker, son attends the Kapan polytechnical institute, and daughter goes to the Kadjaran secondary school.  Davit works as a driver at the Zangezursk copper-molybdenum factory.  Parallel to his factory work, Davit is involved in agriculture at the Tandzaver village.  Davit breeds cattle, bees, and also grows vegetables and fruits on his farm.  He sells his agricultural products, such as vegetables, fruits, beef, milk and honey, in the cities of Kapan and Kadjaran.  Davit likes to work on his farm very much and receives an enormous satisfaction from the fact that his family gets natural products straight from his farm.  Davit needs a loan in the sum of 1,000,000 dram in order to purchase five bulls, new beehives, frames for honey and hay for the winter, so that he would be able to gather more agricultural products in the future.

loans.use: to purchase five bulls, new beehives, frames for honey and hay for the winter

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Ludelen

texts.en:
Ludelen is married with four children. She is 45 years old and lives in Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. 
Ludelen has a general store business to earn a living and has run this business for three years. Each month she earns 4,000 PHP doing this business. She has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to purchase stock for her general store. She has been a member of Kiva partner, PMPC, for three years. 
Ludelen hopes that her children have a good future someday.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her general store.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, she has operated a food vending business where she sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Fatuma dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the 10,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar and beans. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar and beans.

loans.name: Renee

texts.es: Renee, de 56 años es una mujer alegre y luchadora. Vive en compañía de Tomas, su esposo desde hace 34 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos a los que cuidan en su casa propia, ubicada en el asentamiento humano San Pedro. A pesar de su avanzada edad, esta mujer trabaja con dedicación para mantener la economía de su casa. Desde muy joven comenzó trabajando en sus terrenos agrícolas, se dedica a la siembra de papa y maíz en grandes cantidades y ahora tiene una menor producción, que le sirve para cubrir algunos gastos, pues comenta que ya no tiene la pujanza de antaño. Pues su principal actividad es la venta de productos de primera necesidad en una pequeña bodega que se encuentra en su casa. Además su esposo es albañil, trabaja en la refacción de casas, “antes era cerrajero, tiene problemas en la vista por eso dejo el oficio”, comenta. Con sus ganancias y las de ella, pueden solventar los gastos del hogar. Ahora desea expandir su negocio y así poder descansar, pues los años pasan y ella quiere tener tranquilidad. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “San martín de Porres” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde está muy contenta, pues tiene el apoyo para salir adelante. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Renee de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en:
Renee, 56, is a cheerful, tenacious woman. She lives with Tomas, her husband of 34 years.  They have three children that they care for in their own house located in San Pedro.  Despite her advanced age this woman works with dedication to maintain her household’s economy.  She started working in the fields when she was very young; she grew potatoes and corn in large amounts but now has a smaller production to cover some expenses because she says she no longer has the strength she once had.

Her main activity now is selling basic needs items in a small store she has at home.  In addition, her husband’s a bricklayer and works repairing houses.  “He used to be a cashier but due to problems with his eyesight he left that occupation,” she comments.  They are able to cover household expenses with her income.  She’d like to expand the business so that she can rest because the years pass and she wants to have some peace and quiet.

She’s a member of the “San Martín de Porres” communal bank and this is the 4th loan with MFP where she’s very happy because she has support to continue forward.  She promises to be punctual with her payments.  If Renee were to get your support, she’ll use the requested funds to buy basic need items to stock her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To construct a dairy unit

loans.name: María De Jesús

texts.es:
En municipio de Managua, la señora María  De Jesús es una persona trabajadora de bueno valores morales  se dedica a laborar como conserje, desde hace seis años. Es soltera tiene dos persona a su cargo.

Actualmente ha acudido a ceprodel con el fin de solicitar un crédito  para comprar materiales de construcción tales como cemento,  remodelación de su vivienda, en hacer un anexo de un cuarto  para darle más seguridad  a su familia y agradece a ceprodel la oportunidad con este desembolso compra materiales de construcción tales como bloque, hierro, cemento, arena.
texts.en:
In the city of Managua, María  De Jesús is a hardworking person with good values who has worked as a cleaner for six years. She is single and has two dependents. 

She has now approached Ceprodel to ask for a loan to buy construction materials like cement to remodel her home and build an annex onto a room to give her family more security. She thanks Ceprodel for this opportunity to purchase construction materials like blocks, iron, cement, and sand.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for her home.

loans.name: Linh

texts.en:
Linh, 30 years old, lives with her husband and daughter in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a driver.

Linh earns a living running a general store at her house, which she has done for three years. Linh would like to take a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods, to stock her general store. She hopes that this investment will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that the loan will help her generate a higher income to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money for her daughter's education.

loans.use: To purchase products and foods to stock her general store.

loans.name: Cipriano

texts.es:
El Sr. Cipriano tiene 49 años, está casado con la Sra. Mari, tienen 6 hijos, el mayor tiene 33 años y el menor de todos 11 años.
Cipriano es gomero, nos comenta que empieza sus actividades diarias a muy tempranas horas de la mañana y regresa muy tarde a su casa por la noche, cuenta que se dedica a esto hace mas de 27 años, tiene su casa en una de las compañías de la ciudad de Paraguarí, 5 de sus hijos ya trabajan por cuenta propia y el menor de todos se encuentra cursando la primaria. Gracias a su esfuerzo todos sus hijos terminaron sus estudios.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de cubiertas, el cual es el principal insumo de su negocio. Agradece a la fundacion por la oportunidad que esta le da, pues el crédito le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Cipriano is 49 years old and married to Mari.  They have six children; the oldest is 33 and the youngest is 11.

Cipriano fixes tires.  He tells us that he begins his daily activities very early in the morning and returns home very late at night.  He says he has been doing this for more than 27 years.  He has his house in one of the neighborhoods in the city of Paraguarí.  Five of his children are already working on their own, and the youngest of all is in elementary school.  Thanks to his dedication all of his children finished school.

He is requesting the loan to buy tires, the main supply of his business.

He is grateful to the foundation for the opportunity this gives him because the loan will be a big help to him.

loans.use: to buy tires to sell.

loans.name: Lara

texts.en:
Lara is a 26-year-old woman and a mother of two children.

Lara sells clothes from her home and she is requesting a loan of 1500 JD to purchase more clothes to sell.

Lara is looking to opening a shop to sell clothes from and improving her family life conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La  señora Lucia es una señora trabajadora , ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras  y a la siembra de limones desde hace un año.
Ella nos cuenta que l que más le gusta  mucho cortas limones y cortar platanales.
Ella pidió el préstamo para comparar más frutas y verduras para la venta.
Le da gracias a fundación por el apoyo que le ha dado para salir ad
texts.en:
Lucia is a hard-working woman. She has been selling fruits and vegetables and growing lemons for a year.

She tells us that what she likes the best is picking lemons and bananas.

She asked for the loan in order to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell. She thanks the Foundation for the support they have given her for moving forward.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence, 33 years old, is married and has two children aged 8 and 13. She has operated a grocery store business for 10 years and employs 3 people. Florence describes her business environment as busy because her customers visit her daily. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income. Florence hopes to open a big hotel and be financially stable in the future. She has applied for a loan of KES 80,000 to buy vegetables, onions and a fridge to store fresh fruits.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, onions and a fridge to store fresh fruits

loans.name: Victoriana

texts.en:
Victoriana is 58 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin. She is married with 6 children. 

Victoriana has a general store that sells different spices. She has had this business for 20 years. Victoriana has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase additional spices to sell.

Victoriana has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, she hopes to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional spices to sell.

loans.name: Olga Lucero

texts.es:
Olga es una joven de 19 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Chiclayo, en el distrito de Guadalupe, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Olga se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Enfermería, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Olga trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de productos de belleza, adicionalmente también trabaja vendiendo calzado por catálogos, ella trabaja todos los días y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 6 horas, Olga se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Olga se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería, tales como cremas, cosméticos, perfumes y otros, de esta manera Olga tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido y podrá atender a mas clientes, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para salir adelante y lograr su gran sueño de convertirse en una buena profesional y tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Olga is a 19-year-old young woman. She is single. She lives in the city of Chiclayo in the Guadalupe District. She is a very kind, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to improve herself. Thanks to her effort and her parent's support, Olga is studying the professional career of Nursing. In her spare time, she enjoys watching television, and on some occasions, cooking a rich Arroz con Pollo to enjoy with her family. 

On her own initiative, with a lot of resolve and dedication, Olga works in her small business of selling beauty products. In addition, she also sells footwear by catalog sales. She works every day and can do so for approximately 6 hours. Olga feels comfortable doing her job and believes that it is going well due to her good prices and the polite service that she provides to her customers.

Olga is very grateful for the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the provided support, she will be able to buy merchandise such as creams, cosmetics, perfumes, and other things. In this way, Olga will have her business better stocked and will be able to attend to more customers. Therefore, she will continue working and making an effort to get ahead and to achieve her greatest dream of becoming a skilled professional and having her own home.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as creams, cosmetics, and perfumes.

loans.name: Maksura

texts.ru: Максура, 66 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитали 6 детей. У Максуры - среднее образование, сразу после замужества семья Максуры стала заниматься животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Максуры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: корова и лошадь, также обрабатывает 4,0 ГА земли, где ежегодно сажает фасоль, клевер и кукурузу для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 14,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Максура обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Максура планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.

loans.use: to buy some sheep in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Raul

texts.en:
Mr. Raul H. and his family have a grocery store. He also works at night in a Maquiladora Plant here in Nuevo Laredo because he wants to obtain a better income for him and his family. He would like to have a better stock in his grocery store to give different kind of products to his customers and keep growing the business. For that reason he is asking for a loan of $500. He wants to repay in a term of 12 months.

Español

El Sr. Raúl Hernández y su familia tienen una tienda de abarrotes, el también trabaja en una planta Maquiladora aquí en Nuevo Laredo, porque quiere obtener un mejor ingreso para el y su familia. A el le gustaría tener un mejor stock en su tienda de Abarrotes para ofrecer a sus clientes, mejores productos y si seguir creciendo el negocio, por esa razón esta solicitando un préstamo de $500.00, el cual planea pagar en un periodo de 12 meses.

loans.use: buy more products for his store

loans.name: Róger

texts.en:
Mister A. holds a position as a director for a school center and is also owner of a small store in the local market, which he wants to expand with the help of a PRISMA loan. With the loan he would like to increase his earnings by 30%, which will allow him to better the economic and social situation of his family, principally that of his children.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor

El señor A. desempeña sus funciones como director de un centro escolar, a su vez es dueño de una pequeña tienda en un mercado local, la cual quiere hecer crecer a través del préstamo que PRISMA le brinde. Con el préstamo piensa incrementar sus ingresos en un 30%, lo cual le permitirá mejorar las condiciones económicas y sociales de su familia y principalmente de sus hijos.

loans.use: The money will be used to stock the owner's store with new products(such as clothes, cosmetics, shoes, etc.)

loans.name: Morrish

texts.en:
Morrish M. is 20 years old and currently working with the Life in Africa We center in Gulu, Uganda. He is also a volunteer with Charity for Peace, a non-profit organization in Northern Uganda working with the Night Commuter children. He stays in the Kolo quarter, living alone. He is not yet married and has no children, but he would like to start a family. However, he is wise enough to know that before starting a family he needs to establish himself in a business that will sustain them.

He lost his father in 1994 and was reared by his mother, Jostina Kawa, in Fort Portal. But he dreamed of returning home, and so in 2003, when he was in grade senior four (4), he decided to return to the Kolo quarter, where his father died.

Because of his own experience as an orphan, he was drawn to the children affected by the war in the North. Helping them has helped him to cope with his own situation, and he has learned the joy of sharing and exchanging ideas with many people around the world. His love of God and his determination to help others makes him a valuable asset to his community.

Morrish developed an interest in business while working with Life in Africa's bead project. After careful thought, he has decided to start a business selling goats. He will employ someone to help him when he is working at the bead project, and he plans to pay this person with a share of the profits. This should be a profitable business because goat meat is very popular with the people of this region, and goats are used in traditional ceremonies as well. His business plan shows that he can make a 40% profit each week on his investment. This money combined with what he earns in the bead project will enable him to have a better life, repay the loan, and perhaps start his own family.

Acording to his business plan he will need a loan in the amount of 250,000=/ (Ugandan shillings) to start his business. He is very confident that he will be able to repay this loan in 3 months.

M. has savings of 300,000= (three hundred thousand shillings only) which will go toward renting a place from which to sell his goats and paying the salary of the person who will help him run the business while he is at work.

Business plan.

Transport............................................15,000=

License...............................................5,000=

Buying 15 goats.....................................220,000=

05ropes..............................................5,000=

contigency............................................5,000=

Grand total.........................................250,000=

loans.use: Buying Goats

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.en:
Maria Elena is married and has two children. One goes to primary school and the oldest one studies business at the University. Her husband works in a fruit store, but the little bit of salary that he gets is insufficient for all the household expenses. To enable her children to continue studying and to proviD. them with opportunity of a better future, Maria Elena started selling cookware 4 years ago. The quality of the products that she sells have allowed Maria to increase her sales quickly.

At this moment, she is requesting a loan of $250 that she will use to buy merchandise to satisfy customer demand. She commits to repay this amount in 3 months. Maria's greatest wish is that her children can finish their studies. For this, she is willing to work hard. You can become an important part of the life of this family, please help them out. Thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Elena es casada y tiene dos hijos, uno estudia la primaria y el mayor se estudia administración en la universidad. Su esposo trabaja en una frutería, pero el poco salario que recibe es insuficiente para todos los gastos del hogar, para poder ayudar a que sus hijos continúen estudiando y tengan acceso a un mejor futuro, Maria Elena inició con la venta D. artículos para la cocina desD. hace cuatro años, la calidad D. los productos que comercializa y las facilidades que les otorga para cubrir su costo han ayudado a Maria a incrementar sus ventas rápidamente.

Ahora necesita D. un préstamo D. $ 250 dólares que empleará en la compra D. mercancía para poder cubrir la demanda D. sus clientes, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 3 meses. El máximo anhelo D. Maria es que sus hijos puedan terminar su carrera, para lo que está dispuesta a esforzarse mucho, tú puedes ser parte importante en la vida D. esta familia, decídete a apoyarlos, gracias.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Kyelem

texts.en:
Since 1998, Kyelem A. has been a butcher at the market of Port-Bouët, in the south of Abidjan District. He is 24 years old and has 2 children. A. is a dynamic and ambitious young man--very professional and focused on his business. He lives with his family in the very populated suburb of Port-Bouët.

A. will use the small loan he is presently requesting to pay school fees for his first son who will start primary school this month and to purchase 2 cows. A. took out his first loan from AE&I in November 2005 and has performed very well so far.

loans.use: to purchase 2 cows and pay school fees for his son in primary school

loans.name: Angelita Virginia

texts.es:
Mrs. Angelita is 57 years old. She only studied up to 5th grade. She lives in Salpo district of the providence of Otuzco in the community of La Libertad. She has 5 children, but she only supports 2 of them. Before receiving her first loan from the bank she had a small business. She sold some vegetables and fruits. Now she has a stand that sells a variety of items in the providence of Salpo. Thanks to The Manuela Ramos Movement she was able to get money that helped her business out and to help pay for a good education for her children. With her first loan of about $96 she was able to buy a sack of rice, sugar, oil and vegetables and she was able to buy stands to exhibit the items she sells. With the recent loan from Manuela Ramos of about $767 that will be paid of in 6 monthly payments. With the money she plans to supply her business and pay for her children’s university education. She dreams to expand her business that way she can convert it to a mini market and have her kids become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Edith of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

La señora Angelita tiene 57 años de edad y estudió sólo hasta 5to. de primaria. Vive en Salpo distrito de la Provincia de Otuzco del Departamento de La Libertad; tiene 5 hijos, pero solo 2 dependen de ella. Antes de recibir su primer crédito del Banco Comunal tenía un negocio muy pequeñito (vendía unas cuantas verduras y frutas) actualmente tiene una bodega surtida en el distrito de Salpo. Por medio de una vecina que le comentó que asistía a las charlas del Movimiento Manuela Ramos pudo integrarse al Banco Comunal “Virgen de las Mercedes”. Gracias al Movimiento Manuela Ramos pudo tener un capital propio que le ayudó a ampliar su negocio y sacar adelante a sus hijos dándoles una buna educación. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/.300.00 (aproximadamente $96) compró un saco de arroz, azúcar, aceite, verduras con los siguientes fue comprando otros productos y estantes para exhibirlos. El reciente préstamo otorgado por Manuela Ramos de S/.2,300.00 ($ 767) y que será cancelado en 6 cuotas mensuales, podrá surtir su bodega y matricular a sus hijos en la universidad. Sueña con ampliar mucho mas su negocio para convertirlo en un minimarket y que sus hijos lleguen a ser profesionales.

loans.use: Buy items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria Eugenia sells food such as fried chicken, sodas and rice with beans (some of the national products). It has been 20 years since she began this business. Thanks to the $500 she received from her first loan, she was able to successfully invest in her business. After seeing the great demand for her food, she decided to have this business. Before, she used to deliver her food, but then her clients at the market La Terminal in Leon asked her to station herself in order to offer a greater variety of food. Before she had this business, she sold traveling with fried pork and yuca (Chancho con Yuca). As a single mother, she has been able to move forward, and maintain her business and her children in primary school, thanks to the idea of having a business and the help that she has received from previous loans. With the loans, she buys products to serve her plates of food, such as wood, rice and beans.

Translated from Spanish by Gabrielle Sham, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Maria Eugenia se dedica a la venta de comidas como Pollo Frito, Gaseosas, arroz con Frijoles...etc, realizando compra de los productos Nacionales. Lleva 20 años trabajando con este negocio, nos dice que su inversion inicial fue de $500 gracias a un primer prestamo. La idea de tener este negocio se dió al ver la buena demanda que tenia su comida, pues antes vendia a domicilio la gente del mercado La Terminal en Leon le pidio que se estableciera para que ella ofreciera mas variedad. Antes de tener este negocio ella vendia ambulante el cerdito frito con yuca cocida (Chancho conYuca), pero gracia a la idea de poner el negocio y con el apoyo que ha recibido a travez de estos créditos, que son para la compra de productos tales como platos para servir la comida, leña, arroz, Arina y otros, ha logrado salir adelante, manteniendo su negocio y a sus 2 hijos en edad escolar pues es madre soltera.

loans.use: Purchase products to make her food to sell to her clients.

loans.name: Doris  Elizabeth

texts.es:
Doris decided to invest her life savings in the purchase of potatoes, squash, yucca, (casava), cabbage, peppers and tamarindo, as she could not find employment to support her young children. Her only option in the beginning was to start this business selling in the market.

Over time, and with the financial support of CEPRODEL she now has a small location, which, though it lacks proper infrastructure, at least has a roof the cover her from the weather.

One of her goals is to develop her business and to improve her family's quality of life. She has said that CEPRODEL has been her right hand in helping her in various circumstances.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Doris decide invertir los ahorros de toda su vida en la compra Papas, Ayote, Yuca, Repollo, Chiltoma y Tamarindo, en vista de no encontrar empleo y para sustentar a sus pequeños hijos no tiene mas alternativa que dedicarse a este negocio en el que en un inicio los comercializa ambulante en el mercado.

En el trascurso del tiempo y con el aporte financiero de CEPRODEL hoy en día tiene un pequeño local no en buenas condiciones de infraestructuras pero por lo menos tiene un techo donde soportar las inclemencias del tiempo.

Una de sus metas es lograr el desarrollo de su negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia y para ello comenta que CEPRODEL ha sido su mano amiga quien le ayuda en toda circunstancias.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Maria Consuelo

texts.es:
The sale of plastic bags is the business in which Señora Maria Consuelo C. has been working very diligently for two years in the central market of the beautiful city of Chinandega.

Señora C.’s plastic bag sales business is often visited by people that are looking for plastic bags for different uses. It is for this reason that she is looking for a way to increase her business to satisfy the needs of her customers. In need because she does not have sufficient money to expand her business, she has requested loans from Ceprodel to purchase bags from her suppliers. These loans have been used directly for her business and as a result, she has managed to improve in part her situation, purchasing larger quantities of bags in order to later resell them. At present she has a credit record of 7 loans with Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La venta de bolsas plásticas es el negocio al que muy esforzadamente se dedica la dama Maria Consuelo C. desde hace dos años en el mercado central de la bella ciudad de Chinandega.

El negocio de la venta de bolsas plasticas de la señora C. se caracteriza por ser muy visitado por personas que buscan bolsas plásticas para diferentes usos y es por esta razón que ha buscado la manera de incrementar su negocio para satisfacer sus necesidades. Una necesidad que atraviesa es que a pesar de que no cuenta con suficiente dinero para ampliar su negocio, solicita créditos en Ceprodel para la compra de las bolsas a sus proveedores. Estos créditos le han sido otorgados directamente para su negocio y según comenta ha logrado mejorar en parte su situación vendiendo más cantidades de bolsas para luego comercializarlas. Actualmente tiene un record crediticio de 7 créditos con Ceprodel.

loans.use: To purchase plastic bags for resale.

loans.name: Daung

texts.en: Mrs. Daung Y., 42, is a widow with five children, and owns a plot of farmland where she grows rice. She makes on average less than $1 a day of profit. Three of their daughters work as garment workers in Phnom Penh city, earning a salary of $100 each per month. To improve the family's living conditions, she is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase grocery products and resell them for a profit, as well as to renovate the house.

loans.use: To purchase grocery products and renovate the house.

loans.name: Aracely Elena

texts.es:
Aracely works selling name-brand shoes to the people of her town. She began selling shoes to supplement the income of the household to support her three children, as the earnings of her husband are not sufficient. Little by little she has been able to increase the number of her customers, and she wants to continue growing. But recently, her sales have decreased somewhat because she cannot fulfill the requests of her clients due to the lack of money necessary to acquire the merchandise.

She needs a loan of $250 which she will pay back in three months. She'll use this loan to buy merchandise so she can continue with her business. Let's contribute to the well-being of Aracely and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Aracely se dedica a la venta de zapatos de marca entre los conocidos de su pueblo actividad que empezó para solventar los gastos de sus 3 hijos ya que con ingresos de su marido no completaba, poco a poco logro incrementar su cartera de clientes, actualmente sus ventas han bajado un poco pero ella quiere seguir creciendo ya que tiene clientes a los que no puede surtirles por falta de capital para adquirir la mercancía.

Ella necesita un crédito por US $250 que liquidara en 3 meses para comprara mercancía y continuar con su negocio. Contribuyamos al bienestar de Aracely y su familia.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Carmela's Group

texts.es:
Carmela, Yrma and Sonia have been members of Banco Comunal Kuskanchik for 1, 1 and 4 years respectively.

Carmela is 68 years old, is widowed and has 5 children. She works as a street-trader, selling roast pork in a street in the city centre. She also has a grocery store at home.

Yrma is 22 years old and is single. She has a glassworks in rented premises. Together with her sister, she also has a restaurant which is located in a main avenue in the city of Ayacucho.

Sonia is 24 years old, lives with her partner and has one child. She sells meat at the market in Nazarenas.

Carmela, Yrma and Sonia need a group loan of $1,100 to invest in the purchase of sheep, pigs, sugar, rice, tuna and glass.

Carmela, Yrma and Sonia have three dreams: to have their own home, to get married and to expand their business.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

Carmela, Yrma y Sonia pertenecen al Banco Comunal Kuskanchik hace 1, 1, 4 años respectivamente.

Carmela es viuda, tiene 68 años y 5 hijos, Carmela venD. carne asada D. cerdo D. manera ambulatoria por una calle céntrica D. la ciudad. Además Carmela tiene una tienda D. abarrotes en su casa.

Por otro lado Yrma es soltera y tiene 22 años, Yrma tiene una Vidriería en un local alquilado. Además Yrma junto a su hermana tiene un restaurante que esta ubicado en una avenida principal D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Mientras que Sonia es conviviente, tiene 24 años y 1 hijo, Sonia venD. carne en un puesto del mercado Nazarenas.

Carmela, Yrma y Sonia necesitan préstamos D. 1500 soles, 900 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. ganado ovino y porcino, azúcar, arroz, atún y vidrios.

Los sueños D. Carmela, Yrma y Sonia son tener una casa propia, casarse, ampliar su negocio.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of sheep, pigs, sugar, rice, tuna and glass.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco started out as an assistant in a repair and body shop. That's how he acquired his knowledge in the field. A few years later he decided to open his own garage with the help of his brother.

Francisco is 35 years of age and has been married for eight years to Cristina del Rocio Figueredo who is 29 years old. The couple has a 4-year old daughter. Cristina has always dreamed of being a teacher. So when they got married Francisco paid for Cristina's university studies to help her realize her dream. Today is a teacher in a school, and she also supports the family with another source of income.

The two are hard working people and they are building their own house. The funds of the credit requested will be invested in building materials and to pay for labour in the completion of their house.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Francisco empezó a trabajar como asistente en un taller de chapería y pintura. Es ahí donde adquirió conocimientos en el rubro. Unos años después decidió abrir su propio taller con la ayuda de su hermano.

Francisco tiene 35 años de edad está casado hace 8 años con la Sra. Cristina del Rocío Figueredo de 29 años de edad, la pareja tiene una hija de 4 años. Cristina siempre soñó con ser docente, entonces cuando la pareja se caso, Francisco pago los estudios universitarios de Cristina para ayudarla a realizar su sueno. Actualmente ella es profesora en una escuela, y así también es otra fuente de ingresos para la familia.

Los dos son personas muy trabajadoras que están construyendo su casa propia. Es por eso que el dinero del crédito solicitado será invertido en la materiales y mano de obra para la finalización de su casa.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials such as bricks, cements, sand, and paint.

loans.name: Ghazi

texts.en: Ghazi, 47, is married and the father of 4 children. He lives in the Southern Suburbs of Beirut. Ghazi is the owner of a billiard amusement shop and needs a loan in the amount of US$ 1,200 to purchase more tabletop games, so that he can expand his business. This is the first time Ghazi has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: to purchase more tabletop games

loans.name: Milena

texts.es:
Milena makes her living by selling cold beverages and providing good customer service to her clients. Her business is located in a commercial area close to her home. She feels happy to be in that place, since there is a lot of people passing by all day long, which is good for her business. Milena is 52 years olds and she has 6 children, 4 of them independent and with their own family, the other two are studying. Her husband William, sales different types of merchandise and it was him who encouraged Milena to start the business. The most important thing is to continue to grow the business, and in the near future they would like to renovate and expand the premises in order to offer a better atmosphere to clients. This is why Milena is requesting a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer

La venta de bebidas heladas y una buena atención es el diario vivir de Milena, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en un lugar comercial dentro de su zona. Ella se siente feliz de estar en ese lugar, ya que concurre mucha gente de varios lugares. Milena a sus 52 años tiene 6 hijos, 4 de ellos independientes y con familia propia, los 2 últimos están estudiando, su esposo William, se dedica a la venta de diferentes mercaderías y fue quién incentivó a Milena en su negocio. Lo más importante es seguir creciendo y más adelante hacer algunas modificaciones y ampliar su local para tener mayor acogida, sin embargo, para ello requiere del dinero que aquí pide en calidad de préstamo para realizar su deseo.

loans.use: To improve and expand their business

loans.name: Julian

texts.es:
Julian N. is 57 years old, has 3 grown children, 2 of whom are working in Spain.

Since he was a small boy Julian has worked as a baggage handler at the airport. Today and after several years of continuing to work as a baggage handler, as his family was one of humble means, he didn’t have the opportunity to receive an education. In addition to this job he works selling gold and silver jewelry.

The loan he seeks is to buy jewelry to resell and also begin construction on a room to sell his jewelry. The next loan will be to finish his own room to sell jewelry, and that room will be located in his home.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. Julian N. tiene 57 años con tres hijos, todos mayores de edad, dos de los mismos se encuentran trabajando en España

Desde muy pequeño Don Julian trabajó como maletero del aeropuerto. Hoy día y luego de varios años el sigue trabajando en el Aeropuerto como maletero, como era de una familia muy humilda el no tubo oportunidades de estudio. Además de esto el se dedica a la venta de joyas de oro y plata.

El crédito que el solicita será para la compra de joya para así después comercializarlas y también para empezar a construir un salón de ventas.

El próximo crédito que solicitaría seria para la culminación de su propio salón de ventas de joyas que se encuentra en su domicilio.

loans.use: Buy gold and silver jewelry

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama P. is a 37-year-old mother of two children who are in school. She is very hard working and resourceful. For two years she has been selling charcoal in her neighborhood. Charcoal is a very popular source of energy for cooking in almost all traditional Ghanaian homes. Ama obtains charcoal from the villages surrounding of Obuasi, where she lives, and she retails the charcoal to her customers. She wants to use the loan to buy a bulk supply of charcoal to increase her inventory. She hopes the loan will enable her to increase her savings so she can pay her children's educational fees. She belongs to the community group called Ntoboase Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee the repayment of loans for one another.

loans.use: To buy bulk supply of charcoal.

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en: Augustina is 43-years-old and married with five kids. She is resourceful and supportive to her family. Currently, Augustina supports all her kids in school. She operates a local restaurant and has been selling local foods like banku and fufu for the past year. She says that prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she is no longer able to afford her production expenditure. This has affected production quality adversely. She needs the loan to enable her to inject additional capital into the business to scale up production and maintain quality as well. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of rice, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. Augustina is a member of a group called Adekyensroma Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and provide support to one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of rice, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Waaminifu Group

texts.en:
Zainab A., age 32, is single with three children, ages 15,13 and 9. She has a food vending business, which she started three years ago. She works from 11 a.m. to 4 p.m. daily and is able to make about $100.

In the past, Zainab has taken four loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to improve the quality and quantity of her food. She has also managed to secure a place where she can sell her food from inside a small room. She hopes for a new loan to buy big quantities of food, such as a 50 kg sack of rice and wheat flour, instead of buying 2 kg every day. Zainab will share this loan with her subgroup members, who sell food and fish and have shops. Her subgroup is part of a loan group called Waaminifu. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.
	
In the picture, Zainab is on the left in a black T-shirt.

loans.use: To buy food in bulk

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina is a member of the Manantial (“Spring”) Village Bank. She is 48 years old and is married with four children. Faustina has a car parts store, which she runs from a rented location. Her store is near several mechanics' shops. Her husband is a mechanic and has his own shop. Faustina needs a loan of 900 soles to buy pinions and other car parts. Faustina’s dreams are to offer a wider variety of merchandise in her store and for her children to finish school.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

Faustina es socia del Banco Comunal Manantial. Faustina es casada, tiene 48 años y 4 hijos, Faustina tiene una tienda en un local alquilado en donde vende repuestos para carros, el local esta ubicado cerca de diferentes talleres mecánicos, además que su esposo es mecánico y también tiene su taller. Faustina necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de piñones y trenes fijos. Los sueños de Faustina son de surtir con mas productos su tienda y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.

loans.use: Buy pinions and other car parts

loans.name: Mrs. Khema Nhoem Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Khema N. is the president of a village bank of eleven people. All of the village bank members live in Chumrov village in Takeo province. Each member plans to use their part of the loan for a different purpose. 

Mrs. Khema N. is requesting a loan to buy more silk for her silk-weaving business. Her business is doing well, and she hopes to increase her income and to provide better livings conditions for her family. 

She is a 42-year-old widow with three children. One of her children helps her in her current business. The others attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy more silk to weave for her customers.

loans.name: Brak

texts.en:
Brak N., 34, is married and lives with her husband in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. Since 1998, she and her husband have had a business grinding rice to earn a living and are able to make $4 of profit each day. The couple has three children, two who are in school and one is too young to attend school yet.

Mrs. Brak N. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase rice to remove the husks, with the intention of reselling the rice and turning over a profit. She is confident that this will be a good business venture and sees it as a tool to increase her income and raise her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase rice and grind it to remove its husks

loans.name: Sabenty Group

texts.en:
This is Abdul K., Kadiatu K., and Kadiatu F.. They named their group Sabenty. They are local entrepreneurs in the town of Makeni. This is their sixth loan from SMT. Their most recent loan provided each of them 1,000,000 SLL. That loan created meaningful impacts in the lives of these people. They were able to use the proceeds to pay for their children’s school fees. They also are able to feed and clothe themselves and their children with the income generated from the loans. They are requesting a loan of $1000 (3,000,000 SLL) to buy more goods to add to their businesses.

Abdul (right) is the leader of the group. He is 38 years of age. He was born in Makump village, five miles from Makeni, in northern Sierra Leone. He is married and has four children. One of his children is in primary school, two are in secondary school, and the youngest is not school-aged. His wife is also a businesswoman. Abdul sells groceries, including palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), rice, potatoes, cassavas, oranges, and cigarettes.

With this new loan, Abdul will expand his business. He will be able to buy at least one carton of cigarettes, four bags of rice, and ten barter (five gallons make a barter) of palm oil. Abdul sometimes buys his goods from Makeni or the villages surrounding Makump. He then takes them to Freetown, where he sells them.

So far, Abdul faces no major challenges in his business. Business is going well for him and he enjoys doing it. Through the loans from SMT and Kiva, he has been able to build himself a house worth $1666 (5,000,000 SLL). With this loan, and the income it will generate for him, Abdul plans to build himself another house.

loans.use: Purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Grupo Solidario La Honestidad Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario la Honestidad esta conformado por Doña Jahirinza Auxiliadora Bermúdez y Ana Maria L. ambas poseen diferentes actividades económica como Doña Jahirinza tiene 31 años de edad y tiene 3 hijos que dependen de ella, su actividad económica es la comprar y venta de cosméticos hace mas de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio por lo que necesita invertir el financiamiento en capital de trabajo. Doña Ana se dedica a la venta y compra de prendas de plata hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio por lo que Doña Ana dio inicio a este negocio con fondos propios pero con lo poco que obtenía no compraba lo suficiente es por eso que logra unirse con su amiga y solicitan el financiamiento para mantener activos sus negocios. la cantidad que solicita Doña Ana Maria es de C$4.300 cordobas y la cantidad que solicita Doña Jahirinza es deC$ 5.500 córdobas.
texts.en:
The "Solidario la Honestidad" Group is composed of Jahirinza Auxiliadora Bermúdez and Ana Maria L., each of whom have different economic activities. Jahirinza is 31 years of age and has 3 children who she supports. For more than 3 years her economic activity has been the purchase and sale of cosmetics which is why she needs to invest the loan in working capital. For more than 5 years Ana has worked buying and selling articles of silver. She started this business with her own funds but little by little she could not get enough, which is why she joined with a friend to apply for a loan to keep their businesses active. The amount that Ana Maria is requesting is C$4.300 cordobas and the amount that Jahirinza is requesting is C$ 5.500 córdobas.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Ismoil

texts.ru: Исмоил и его жена проживают в сельской местности. Основной работой является работа в колхозе. Исмоилу 56 лет, у него 6 детей. В летний период Исмоил кроме работы по вечерам занимается заготовкой сена для своего домашнего скота. Его жена дома смотрит за скотиной и это занятие приносит дополнительный доход в семью. Исмоил активный клиент МикроИнвест уже год. Займы использует для покупки молодых бычков и в течении 2-3 месяцев продает. Новый займ собирается также употребить на покупку 1 бычка.
texts.en:
Ismoil and his wife live in a rural area. His primary work is on a collective farm. Ismoil is 56 years old and has 6 children. During the summer in addition to his usual work he spends evenings gathering hay to store for his livestock. The livestock are cared for by his wife, and they provide additional income for the family. Ismoil has been an active client of Microinvest for a year. He has used loans to buy young bull calves, which he sells after 2-3 months. He plans to use a new loan for the same use, purchase of a calf.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of a bull calf

loans.name: Abdel Rahman

texts.en: Abdel Rahman is 60-year-old man married with one son living in Ouzai in Mount Lebanon. He has been a fisherman for 25 years. Today he is requesting to borrow $1,000 in order to repair his boat.

loans.use: repair his boat

loans.name: Sanilyn

texts.en:
Sanilyn E. is a farmer. Her main crop is rice. She is 36 years old and has 7 children. She has been tilling the land that she inherited from her parents. Her husband is the one managing their small rice field. She hopes that someday she will be able to buy another farm to give more support to her children.

She is asking a loan of Php 14,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase herbicides and fertilizers. The loan will truly help her improve her harvest and income as well.

CEVI gives their clients not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase herbicides and fertilizers

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a food vendor who sells waakye. Waakye is a cooked rice and beans dish enjoyed with stew, macaroni and fish. It is sold in the mornings as breakfast. It is very tasty and satisfying and almost all tribes in Ghana enjoy waakye. Margaret is 34 years old and married with five children who are currently in school. She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of rice, vegetable oil, beans, and macaroni to prepare good waakye for her customers. She believes this will provide her with increased income to send her first son to medical school this year. She belongs to the Sharp Trust Group. In this community group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans and there is peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, vegetable oil, beans and macaroni

loans.name: Brunilda

texts.es:
La señora Brunilda pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen de Urkupiña” que esta ubicado en el distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Chuchito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 37 años de edad, es viuda y es madre de 03 hijos y posee estudios superiores incompleta (contabilidad), vive en el Barrio Pacifico.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 03 años, con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles para la compra de colchones. 

Actualmente solicita un préstamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de colchones, camas, muebles de comedor y otros.

Su mayor sueño es poder abrir una mueblería y surtirla mejor..

A ella le gustan los ahorros y la confianza que dan a las socias en el Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
