Brunilda is a member of the Virgen de Urkupiña Community Bank, which is located in the Yunguyo district, Chuchito province, Puno department. She is 37. She is a widow and has three children. She has some upper level education in accounting, but she has not finished. She lives in the Pacifico neighborhood. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for three years. She used her initial loan of 300 PEN to buy mattresses. She is currently asking for a loan for 3,000 PEN to buy mattresses, beds, dining room furniture and others. Her biggest dream is to be able to open a well stocked furniture store. She likes the savings and the confidence they give to the members of the Community Bank.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy mattresses, beds and dining room furniture

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina is married and the mother of two children. She is a 32-year-old trader and her husband is a trader, too. Georgina’s children are all currently in school.

Georgina trades in lace materials, textiles and clothing materials. She obtains her stock of goods from importers in Kumasi central market and sells through hawking (going door to door). Lace material is very useful in room and office decorations.

For lack of adequate working capital, Georgina buys few stocks of lace materials. She believes the loan will enable her to grow her business to the expected level. With the loan, she wants to purchase lace materials and textiles in bulk. She hopes to use part of her profit to rent a store to trade in.

loans.use: To purchase lace materials, clothing materials and textiles in bulk

loans.name: Rose Marie

texts.en: Rose Marie P. is from the village of Anito, Mambajao, Camiguin. She is 45 years old, is married, and has three adult children. Rose Marie owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. On December 24th, 2008, Rose Marie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used by Rose Marie in starting her variety store. Rose Marie is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
La señora Virginia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Cruz de Bellavista”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Puno, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 21 años de edad, estado civil conviviente, es madre de 02 hijos y tiene estudios de secundaria completa, vive en Barrio Tupac Amaru Av. Simón Bolívar.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 02 años, su préstamo inicial de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó para la compra de golosinas y tunas. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1100.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de chocolates, caramelos, jugos, galletas, yogures, gaseosas, etc., y además comprará tunas, negocio que tiene mayor demanda.

Su deseo es poner una tienda tipo mini market.

A ella le gustan la ganancia de sus ahorros y las facilidades en los préstamos.
texts.en:
Virginia belongs to the Community Bank "Santa Cruz de Bellavista," which is located in the Puno District, Puno Province, Puno Department. She is 21 years old, lives with her spouse, is the mother of two children, and has completed high school. She lives in the Tupac Amaru Neighborhood, Simon Bolivar Avenue. She works with the Manuela Ramos movement for two years. Her first loan was for 500 nuevos soles, money which she used to buy soft drinks and tunas. Now she requires a loan of 1100 nuevos soles, to buy chocolates, caramels, juices, cookies, yogurts, sodas, etc. and also to buy tunas, a business which has a lot of demand. Her hope is to open a mini market type store. She likes the earnings of her savings and the help from the loans.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying chocolates, carmels, sodas, cookies, and tunas.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 37; she is married to Harley and they are blessed with four children: Richard - 19 years old; Rommel - 17 years old, who is a college student and their twins, Harley G. Jr. and Harold - 12 years old, who are high school students. They live in the village of Cutog Grande, Reina Mercedes, Isabela. Regina manages a tricycle transport business which her husband drives. Sometimes she uses the tricycle for selling vegetables. She has a weekly income of PHP1, 000 from her business. To become more productive and successful, Regina wants to borrow PHP12, 000 additional capital from Kiva lenders. 	

Their family is patiently battling against the difficulties of life by helping each other, in their own little ways, to attain their goals and success in life.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Eva Raquel

texts.es: La señora Eva Raquel, pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto “Las Triunfadoras”, Distrito de Bagua Grande, Provincia Utcubamba, Departamento de Amazonas. Es casada, tiene 34 años, tiene 02 hijos  a su cargo y en etapa de estudios.Eva Raquel, es una mujer luchadora y con una gran habilidad para desenvolverse en cualquier ambiente laboral, la situación difícil por la que atravesaba su hogar le motivaron a buscar alternativas de trabajo para mejorar su calidad de vida y gracias al apoyo de su esposo y su  facilidad de desempeñarse en este tipo de trabajo, le ayudo a iniciarse en la venta de repuestos, ella empezó con poco y con el pequeño capital que consiguió, instalo su tienda de repuestos, la cual cada día esta mas surtida y mas grande y poco a poco ha ido ganando clientes. En la actualidad tiene una gran cantidad de clientes, que le compran de manera constante en vista de que encuentran una buena atención de parte de ella. Con este préstamo de S/.  1000.00, comprará un exhibidor para poner las los repuestos, además, gatas hidráulicas, rayos de motokar, rodajes, aceites, grasa, tornillos, lleves, tuercas y cadenas de motos,  quiere tener surtido y bien presentable su negocio y dar una buena  atención a sus clientes para que ellos encuentren lo que necesiten y sientan que son bien atendidos. Eva, se siente con mucha energía y ganas  de seguir trabajando, y  aportando en su hogar, esta muy contenta, con la labor y el apoyo que le brinda el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse y seguir creciendo como personas.
texts.en:
Eva Raquel belongs to the "Las Triunfadoras" (The Triumphant) Group in the Bagua Grande district, Utcubamba province, Amazonas department. She is married and is 34 years old and has 2 children in her care who are in school. Eva Raquel is a hard-working woman with a great ability to cope with any working environment. A difficult situation which hit home motivated her to look for job alternatives so she could improve her quality of life. The support of her husband and her ability to perform this type of work helped her start selling spare parts. She began with little and with the small amount of capital that she acquired, she established her spare parts shop, which everyday is more stocked and bigger. Gradually she has earned customers. Currently, she has a great quantity of customers who buy on a regular basis because they receive good service from her. With this loan of S. 1,000, she will purchase a display case in which to show her spare parts, as well as hydraulic jacks, headlights, oil, grease, screws, nuts, motorcycle chains. She wants her business to be stocked and well presented and to give good customer service so that they find what they need and feel well taken care of. Eva wishes to continue working with a lot of energy and she is happy to be supporting her family with the work and support that the Manuela Ramos Movement provides helping women like her have opportunities to develop and continue to grow as people.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will purchase spare parts to increase her stock.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy es una mujer dinámica y colaboradora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa provincia de  Coronel Portillo, tiene 45 años, madre de una hija mayor de edad, ella trabaja junto a su esposo en su negocio de reparación de motos (mecánica), tienen su taller en su casa. Es socia del Banco Comunal “Manos Unidas” desde hace seis años. Su primer crédito fue de 300 soles, que invirtió en compra de alimentos balanceados para patos.
Con este préstamo de 1000 soles que será invertido en la construcción del techo de su taller . El sueño de Nancy es tener un instituto de Mecánica de motos.

loans.use: Invertirá en la construcción del techo de su taller de mecánica de motos

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 42 years of age, married and blessed with three children. Her children are presently in school and taking their studies. Remedios S. has been in this business for ten years. Her business is the retailing of goods in her general store at their village of San Rafael, Aurora, Isabela. The familys main source of income is farming, planting rice in their fields and planting vegetables in their backyard. The profits from her business are being used to improve her business and her family’s savings for the future and emergencies.

Her husband is busy with their farming activities. Remedios wishes to expand her business to earn additional income of the family. If she adds more items of goods in her store, she will also earn a bigger profit. She is asking to borrow the amount of Php 12,000 in additional capital for her business through the KIVA lenders. She believes that her dreams will someday be achieve .

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more goods to sell from her store

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a 42-year-old married woman. Of her five children, the oldest is 22 years old. Lorna has a fishing business that she wants to improve. Most of her income goes to her children’s education. She dreams that all of them will finish school and have a bright future.

To help her fund her business, she is borrowing Php8,000 from CEVI. This loan will be used to buy nets and other fishing materials she needs to sustain her business.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets

loans.name: Mrs. Ret Pha Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan, which consists of eighteen people, is located in Lvea Sa Kraom village in Kandal province and each member will use the loan for a different purpose.

Mrs. Ret P. is the village bank president. She is 31 years old and the mother of four children who are attending the local school. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land on which she grows vegetables.

Mrs. Ret P.’s husband, Mr. Un Sovann, is a vegetables middleman. Since his business is going well, he wants to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Ret P. decided to ask for a loan to buy more vegetables for him to resell to earn more income.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for her husband to resell

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 40-year-old married man, living with his wife and 4 children. He has been working as a van driver since 2005 to earn income to help satisfy the needs of the family. Today, Hussein is requesting to borrow US$ 1,000 to do some legal registration needed for the van.

loans.use: some legal registration needed for the van

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita T. is from the village of Calaran in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 63 years old. Anita is married and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Anita sells herbal medicine in the local community. Anita has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Anita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase more VITA PLUS herbal capsules. This loan will be Anita's first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional VITA PLUS herbal capsules

loans.name: Virgen De Fátima Group

texts.es:
El Comité Virgen de Fátima, es un excelente  comité conformado en fecha 19 de enero del 2.009, en  la Ciudad de Capiatá. 

Este grupo se formó  gracias a que la Sra. Gladys P., actual Directora de Finanzas, quien anteriormente ya integraba un comité, logró juntar a 18 integrantes, entre ellas vecinas y amigas, quienes se encuentran trabajando ya en el 4º ciclo del Programa del Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras. 

Las integrantes de este grupo destinan su crédito a diferentes actividades  tales como: compra de frutas y verduras, compra ingredientes para la preparación de alimentos, compra de mercerías, compra de mercaderías para la despensa (azúcar, arroz, yerba, panificados, lácteos, carnes, etc.), venta de gallinas caseras, venta de helados, elaboración de croché, compra de tela para la fabricación de ropas, compra de artículos de librería, compra de pescados, etc. 

Es un grupo muy activo, todas las integrantes demuestran compañerismo y solidaridad, asisten a las reuniones semanales y realizan actividades para recaudar fondos para el bien común del grupo. 

Es uno de los mejores grupos que se encuentra trabajando con la Fundación Paraguaya, ya que la mayoría de las integrantes del grupo siguen activas desde el primer préstamo y con eso demuestran solidaridad y compañerismo.
texts.en:
The Virgen de Fátima Communal Bank is an excellent bank that was formed on the 19th of January, 2009, in the city of Capiatá. This group was formed thanks to Galdys P., current Director of Finance, who was previously a member of a communal bank. She was able to get together 18 members. Her neighbors and friends are among the members. They are working in the fourth cycle with the Committee for Enterprising Women Program. The members of this group will use the loan for their different activities such as buying fruits and vegetables, buying ingredients to make food, buying notions, buying merchandise for the grocery store (sugar, rice, dried leaves for tea, pastries, dairy products, and meat, etc), selling home-grown chickens, selling ice cream, making crochet, buying fabrics to make clothes, buying articles for the bookstore, and buying fish, etc. This is a very active group. All of the members demonstrate camaraderie and solidarity. They attend weekly meetings, and they carry out activities to collect funds for the common good of the group. It is one of the best groups to be found working with the Paraguaya Foundation because most of the group members are continuing activities from the first loan. This way they demonstrate camaraderie and solidarity.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise, raw materials, and animals for their businesses

loans.name: Poeng

texts.en: Poeng L. is a seller whose main activity is selling cooking ingredients. She started in the grocery business in the beginning of 2005. She has a partner in her husband, who helps feed the family by fishing in the river. This couple is married and has been blessed with two children, who are working in the garment industry. To get extra income, Poeng L. is taking out her loan to buy more groceries to sell. Poeng L. was not available when the photo was taken so her husband is pictured instead.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa trabaja como comerciante de material escolar en la ciudad de El Alto, el esposo trabaja como taxista y así complementan sus ingresos con los que se  mantienen a su familia; tienen tres hijos que están en las edades de 5, 12 y 15 años. Su domicilio esta ubicado en la Zona 16 de Febrero Río Seco de la ciudad de El Alto. 

El préstamo lo destinará a la compra mercadería (más material escolar, cuadernos, lápices, gomas de borrar, etc.) para la temporada de inicio de clases.
 
Es su tercer crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago le permite solicitar otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Elsa sells school stationery supplies in the city of El Alto. Her husband works as a taxi driver, and by combining their salaries, they are able to pay household expenses and maintain their children. The couple have three children aged 5, 12 and 15 years respectively. Their home is located in the Zona 16 de Febrero, Río Seco area of the city of El Alto. The loan will be used to purchase more stationery supplies (notebooks, pencils, erasers, etc.) for the commencement of classes. This is Elsa's third loan with Impro. Her timely payments mean she is able to apply for another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase school supplies, such as notebooks, pencils, erasers, etc., for subsequent resale.

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es:
Roberto tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero y vive con su madre en el caserío Huertas Mariátegui de la ciudad de Lambayeque ubicado a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace un año se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte en su mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utilizado en el transporte de carga y pasajeros), el servicio lo brinda cubriendo rutas entre la ciudad de Lambayeque y sus caseríos. Este negocio es la única fuente de ingreso con la que cuenta y le sirve para solventar sus gastos personales y apoyar al sostenimiento de su familia.

El continuo uso brindado a su unidad móvil ha hecho que esta empiece a sufrir algunas fallas mecánicas que necesitan de urgente reparación. Por ello, se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en los gastos de mantenimiento y reparación de su vehículo.

Roberto es un joven responsable y trabjador, el ya ha trabajado anteriomente con nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser un cliente puntual y responsable.
texts.en:
Roberto, 22, is single, living with his mother in the Huertas Mariátegui suburb of the city of Lambayeque, one half hour from the city of Chiclayo. He has been providing transportation with his mototaxi (a motorized vehicle used to transport freight and passengers) for the last year. He has routes between the city of Lambayeque and its suburbs. This business is his only income, enabling him to take care of his personal expenses and help with the support of his family. The continual use of his vehicle has caused it to start having some mechanical failures that urgently need repair. Therefore he is requesting a loan of $425 from Edpyme Alternativa to cover the maintenance and repair expenses of his vehicle. Roberto is a responsible and hard-working young man, he has previously worked through our Institution and has shown himself to be a responsible and punctual client.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repair and maintenance

loans.name: Jina

texts.en:
Jina is 33 years old and lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with her husband. She has been running a sewing business for almost two years. She works from her house, repairing all type of clothes, and also making clothes, scarves, cushions covers and more. When Jina first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. She decided to start her business because of her experience – she has been sewing from an early age and likes her work. Jina is successful because she sews well and knows how to treat her customers, who are mostly friends and neighbors.
Jina is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase a new sewing machine for work. This is the first time that she has requested a loan. In the future, she plans on expanding her work, possibly by opening a sewing factory.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine for work

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing has been selling drinks and sachet water at retail prices for the past four years to make a living, and she loves this business because of the opportunity to interact with customers. Blessing is a 30-year-old married mother of two children, the eldest four years old and attending school, which makes her happy. Hoping to grow her business, she is requesting a loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more drinks and sachet to sell. Blessing says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and sachet water to sell

loans.name: Femmes Commerçantes N°11 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupement  Femmes Commerçantes (F.C) comme son nom l’indique est un réseau de femmes qui s’activent  dans le commerce.  Il est basé à Grand Thiès et il a été créé depuis 1992 par Madame Maty Niakh l’actuel président du réseau. Cette présidente a eu cette idée  à l’issue d’une formation qu’elle avait bénéficiée  de l’ONG OXFAM à Thiès. Elle connait, ainsi, bien la gestion de groupe, entreprenariat …etc.  Les membres du réseau sont extrêmement dévoués et se rencontrent une fois par mois. Ainsi, après des frais d’adhésion au groupement, chaque membre est tenu de cotiser mensuellement 200 FCFA pour une caisse de solidarité.
Souhaitant se financer, elles décidèrent  d’adhérer à  U-IMCEC. C’est ainsi que,  leur réseau se voit scinder en 19 sous groupes de 5 personnes  pour un meilleur profit des financements. Elles sollicitent pour une deuxième fois un prêt de 100 000 FCFA par membre,  soit 500 000 FCFA par sous groupe afin de développer leurs diverses activités.
Cependant, les règlements sont versés à la présidente assistée par la trésorière du groupe, Madame Coumba S., pendant leurs réunions mensuelles et ces deux se chargent à leur tour de rembourser U-IMCEC. Ce réseau qui, dit la présidente, n’a qu’un seul et noble objectif : combattre la pauvreté dans les ménages. Actuellement, le réseau compte 19 sous groupes avec chacun une présidente et une trésorière.
Ainsi, le sous groupe Femmes Commerçantes N°11 est dirigée par Madame Aïssatou D. commerçante au marché grand Thiès. Cette âgée de 51 ans vend des légumes, poissons fumés, de l’huile de palme et de la pâte d’arachide depuis 13 ans.Son activité s'était commencé avec la vente de tissus. Mais, vue que l'activité à cette époque ne générait pas trop de revenus, Madame Aïssatou D. s'est repentie ainsi sur la vente de légumes et autres cités au début.
 Elle est, enfin, dans ce sous groupe avec Madame Rokhaya D. la trésorière et vendeuse de poissons frais, Madame Diakhère S. vendeuse d’huile de palme et poissons, Madame Dior T.  qui vend du niébé (haricot) et poissons séchés et  Madame Aisse Diallo vendeuse ambulante de tissus et habillements.
texts.en:
The group “Femmes Commerçantes” (F.C.), as its name indicates, is a network of women who are active in commerce. It is based in Grand Thiès and was founded in 1992 by Ms. Maty Niakh, the network’s current president. She got the idea of forming the network after participating in a training session run by the NGO OXFAM in Thiès. She is therefore quite knowledgeable about group management, entrepreneurship, etc. The network members are extremely devoted and meet once a month.  Beyond a membership fee, each member must pay 200 francs CFA monthly into a solidarity fund. Desiring financing, they decided to join U-IMCEC. This is why their network was split into nineteen sub-groups of five persons each to ensure a better profit outcome. For the second time, they are requesting a loan of 100,000 francs per member, that is 500,000 francs per sub-group, to develop their various businesses. However, payments are made at the monthly meetings to the group president, assisted by the group treasurer, Ms. Coumba S., who are then responsible for reimbursing U-IMCEC. In the words of its president, the network has only one single, noble objective: to fight family poverty. The network currently numbers nineteen sub-groups, each with its own president and treasurer. And so, the sub-group Femmes Commerçantes N°11 is headed by Ms. Aïssatou D., a merchant at the Grand Thiès market.  She is 51 years old and has been selling vegetables, smoked fish, palm oil and peanut butter for thirteen years.  Her business had begun with fabric sales.  But, given that this business did not generate a lot of revenues at the time, she turned with regret to selling vegetables and in other districts at first. Ms. Aïssatou D. is actually in this sub-group with Ms. Rokhaya D., the treasurer and a vendor of fresh fish;  Ms. Diakhère S., a vendor of palm oil and fish;  Ms. Dior T., who sells niébé (black-eyed peas) and dried fish; and Ms. Aisse Diallo, an itinerant vendor of fabrics and clothing.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering their respective businesses

loans.name: José Guadalupe

texts.es:
El señor José Guadalupe P. esta agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior crédito, el cual pudo pagar los gastos escolares que tenia de sus hijos.
Esta nuevamente solicitando un préstamo ya que tiene que pagar el examen profesional de su hijo. El no cuenta con el dinero necesario para pagar y que su hijo termine su carrera profesional. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte del  ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo en una compañía de trasportes, ya que es la fuente de ingreso de su familia.
La persona que aparece en la foto es su hijo, del señor José Guadalupe P., el se encontraba en su trabajo.
texts.en:
José Guadalupe P. is grateful for your cooperation with his previous loan, with which he could pay his children’s school expenses.

He is asking for a loan again, since he has to pay for his son’s professional exam. He does not have the necessary money to pay for it and for his son to finish his professional degree course. He plans to pay for the loan with a part of his income that he obtains from his work in a transportation company, since it is his family’s source of income.

The person that appears in the photo is José Guadalupe P.’s son since he was at work.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Payments for university exit exam

loans.name: Chuchie

texts.en:
Chuchie S., 51, is making sure that her family has enough for their daily needs. She is married to Freddie, a driver, and they are blessed with 3 children. She helps her husband earn income so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own variety store.

Chuchie has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow five times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her businesses.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 10,000 loan. This amount will be used as additional capital to buy stock and maintain operation of her business.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide a happy and comfortable life for her family.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to provide additional working capital

loans.name: Horn

texts.en:
Horn H., 56, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for clay and ceramic products. She and her husband are farmers and earn an income of about $1.5  USD  per day. 

Horn H. is requesting a loan of $1000 USD to purchase cows and a plot of farmland. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. The photo shows Hom H. with her husband.

loans.use: buy cows and a plot of farmland

loans.name: Edwin Alejandro

texts.es:
Edwin Alejandro, tiene 29 años de edad, reside en El Transito, departamento de San Miguel, vive junto con su compañera de vida y un hijo de dos años de edad,  posee un negocio de joyería, compra, elabora y vende prendas de oro y plata.
Edwin atiende el negocio junto con un primo quien le ayuda hacer los trabajos, tiene tres años de atender su negocio un horario  de 8: 00 am -4: 00 pm hace tres años, gracias a su padre que siempre le inculco este trabajo.
Con ganancias de esta actividad ha logrado reunir dinero para alquilar un local donde atiende a sus clientes, el actualmente se ha visto en necesidad de solicitar por primera vez un crédito de $300.00 para compra de oro y seguir elaborando prendas que sus clientes le solicitan, Edwin es una persona que le gusta su trabajo y hace excelentes prendas de oro, el sueña con tener su propio local en su casa donde pueda vivir con su joven  familia, mejorar la calidad de vida de ellos y solventar necesidades básica de su hogar.
texts.en:
Edwin Alejandro is 29 years old and lives in El Transito, in the department of San Miguel. He lives with his partner and their two year-old son. Edwin has a jewelery business where he buys, makes, and sells pieces made of gold and silver. Edwin runs the business with his cousin, who helps him with the work. He has had this business and worked from 8:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. for three years, thanks to his father, who taught him this line of work. With the profits from his business, Edwin has been able to get enough money together to rent a space where he can serve his customers. He currently feels it is necessary to request a loan for the first time. He is requesting $300 in order to purchase gold and continue creating the pieces his customers request. Edwin is a person who enjoys his work and makes excellent pieces of gold jewelery. He dreams of having his own house where he can live with his young family, improve their quality of life, and meet the basic needs of their home.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy gold for jewelery-making

loans.name: Ndiga

texts.fr: Monsieur Ndiaga  B. est un commerçant  de 40 ans qui évolue  depuis plus de 25 ans dans l’achat et la vente de produits locaux divers (mil, mais, riz).Auparavant  il a démarré  avec l’activité  de charretier. Il est membre de la caisse de Yoff  depuis 2007 mais n’a jamais bénéficié de crédit. Il est marie et père  de  8 enfants qui ont entre 10 et 28 ans. C’est par l’intermédiaire  d’un ami qu’il s’est oriente dans ce commerce qui lui a beaucoup rapporte. Il sollicite un crédit  de 500 000 frs prévu pour l’achat des produits qu’il commercialise afin de développer  d’avantage son activité  de commerce. L’accroissement de ses bénéfices  lui permettra de mieux prendre en charge les besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Ndiaga B. is a 40-year-old storekeeper who has been advancing for the past 25 years in buying and selling diverse local products (millet, corn, rice). Before this, he had started selling things from a cart. He has been a member of the Yoff group fund since 2007 but has never taken a loan. He is a married father of 8 children between the ages of 10 and 28. It was the friend of a friend who introduced him to this business which has brought him a lot. He is seeking a loan for 500,000 francs to buy products that he sells in order to build up his business. The growth of his earnings will allow him to better meet the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase working capital

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn R. is from the village of Poblacion, Banisilan, South Cotabato. She is 28 years old. Jocelyn is married and has four school-age children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop in which she sells both food and daily use products in the local community. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Jocelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Jocelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mujeres De Serro Alto Group

texts.es:
GRUPO SOLIDARIO MUJERES  DE CERRO ALTO

Este grupo esta conformado por doña Olga Marina C. Suicajau  casada de 22 años  además tiene 3 hijos su esposo la apoya en todo lo que pueda,  se dedica a la venta de pollo destazado en aldea Cerro Alto tiene ya 5 años de hacerlo.  Doña Dora Leticia Meléndez Márquez  tiene 43 años, 2 hijos es madre soltera y se dedica a una  tienda que tiene  ya 15 años de tenerla.  Doña Evelyn Hortensia R. M. tiene 34 años 2 hijos, su esposo esta en los Estados Unidos y  tiene el negocio de perfumes, venta de cosméticos,  zapatos por catalogo y ahora ya tiene  su local en su casa en donde vende todos los días, tiene ya 15 años de tener su negocio y  esta muy contenta porque ha visto que su negocio ha prosperado  ellas nos cuentan que quieren agrandar su negocio porque ahora  en la aldea ya hay mas personas que están solicitando sus productos y por eso solicitan este crédito y confían en que fape les pueda brindar su apoyo
texts.en:
Women of Cerro Alto Solidarity Group

This group consists of three women:

Doña Olga Marina C. Suicajau is 22 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband supports her in every way possible. She sells butchered chickens in the Cerro Alto neighborhood and has been doing this for five years.

Doña Dora Leticia Meléndez Márquez is 43 years old and a single mother of two children. She manages a store that she has owned for 15 years.

Doña Evelyn Hortensia R. M. is 34 years old and has two children. Her husband in the United States. She has a business selling perfumes, cosmetics, and shoes through catalogs. Now she has a store where she sells her products every day. Evelyn says she is very happy because she has seen her business prosper.

The ladies say they want to expand their businesses because now there are more people in their neighborhood who are requesting their products. For this reason, they are requesting this loan and are confident that FAPE will provide them support.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to be invested into the business

loans.name: Battsengel

texts.en:
Battsengel D. is 37 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in the Huvsgul province of western Mongolia in their own ger, a traditional nomadic housing tent. Battsengel has been managing his taxi service between the countryside and the capital of the province since 2005, while his wife began selling firewood at retail prices in 2007 at her town market. 

As a result of a many years of business operation, Battsengel has become experienced at repairing vehicles as well. His wife has also created a wide customer base, which enables her to sell firewood fast. The two work very hard to provide for their family and are optimistic about their future. 

Battsengel and his wife hope one day to grow their businesses by creating their own workplace where they could sell firewood as well as operate a car-repair service. Batssengel is requesting a 1,000,000 Mongolian Tugriks loan to purchase parts for his automobile and a large amount of firewood for his wife's business in order to resell during the upcoming cold season.

loans.use: To purchase parts for his automobile and a large amount of firewood

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 22 years old. He runs Ngarua Boutique where he sells clothes, shoes, bags and belts. He got the skills for operating his business because he was previously employed in a boutique. He has been in business for four years. 

Michael joined Faulu Kenya under Mbagathi Corner Group. Through Faulu Kenya, he has been trained on business management. He has also managed to purchase new goods. He has requested a loan of 30,000 Kes to buy more clothes and shoes for resale. He dreams of expanding his shop into wholesale. In five years, he sees himself opening other outlets for his business.

loans.use: To buy more shoes and clothes for resale

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa R. is a married woman who lives in Upper Barangay Tubod, Toledo City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: a sari-sari (variety) store, P.O Card (cash cards) and a Natasha dealership (selling shoes, apparel, accessories and personal care products by catalog order). Her husband, Cirilo R., who is 50 years old, helps his wife in running the business. They have four children, ranging in age from 24 to 29. 

Elsa joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2001 because she wanted something better for her family. With the help of her past 18 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Elsa  has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 10,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of about $100, raising the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 19th cycle loan, she is borrowing 10,000 PHP again, to purchase inventory to sell in her sari-sari store and to buy more p.o cards to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future, to continue her businesses and to expand them for a lifetime. Elsa R. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more inventory to sell

loans.name: Libardo

texts.es:
Libardo C. P. es un hombre que sabe mucho de carnes, pues desde muy joven, hace 35 años, empezó a vender carne de res, huesos, vísceras,  al detal acompañando a su padre en el mercado público de la Población de Arjona, luego trabajó en sociedad con su hermana hace 5 años y desde el año pasado abrió su propio local donde tiene su expendio de carne llamado “El 25 Colorao” aplicando sus ahorros.
En la actualidad Libardo solicita su credikiva, que es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, porque quiere aumentar su negocio comprando al por mayor los productos cárnicos, porque en su punto de venta se termina la carne muy rápido y no puede responder a la demanda por falta de capital, así mismo ha realizado una preventa a tenderos y ya tiene contactados sus próximos pedidos. Libardo  planea  continuar ensanchado  su negocio para aumentar sus ingresos, porque con los esfuerzos de  su cónyuge y  los de él,  han logrado  educar  a sus hijos, que en la actualidad están  en la  Universidad, uno de ellos  ya es abogado y su anhelo familiar es que continúen  prosperando, mientras su meta   es adecuar el local y comprar un congelador y una nevera exhibidora para su negocio.
texts.en:
Libardo C. P. knows a lot about meat.  Since he was very young, 35 years ago, he began selling beef, bones, viscera and other products with his father in the public market of Arjona city.  Then for five years, he worked with his sister.  Last year he used his savings to open his own business, a meat store called “El 25 Colorao.”

Currently, Libardo is asking for a Kiva loan, his first funding by Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With it, he wants to improve his business by buying wholesale meat because he runs out of it very quickly in his store, he can’t respond to demand for lack of capital.  He has already pre-sold to shopkeepers and has already been contacted for the next orders.

Libardo plans to continue growing his business to increase his income because, with he and his wife's efforts, they have been able to educate their kids, who are currently in university.  One of them is already a lawyer and he wants his family to continue to prosper.  Until then his goal is to fortify his business and to purchase a freezer and a deli case for his shop.

loans.use: Purchase of wholesale beef.

loans.name: Es

texts.en:
Es H., 35, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. H. is a farmer and raises chickens, earning an income of USD 3.30 per day. Her husband is a construction worker and sells ice cream, earning an income of about USD 6.30 per day. The family has to spend USD 40 on food, USD 5 on electricity, and USD 40 on other necessary expenses every month.  

H. is requesting a loan of USD 200 to purchase more ice cream to resell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy ice cream to resell

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es: Guillermo, de 40 años, es un hombre muy humilde y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 3 queridos hijos y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. El arduo trabajo que Guillermo realiza en sus chacras, le ha traído como resultado una buena producción, ya que sus plantaciones de plátanos y café, han sido cosechadas abundantemente y con muy buena calidad.  Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que siente que sus esfuerzos están dando frutos, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus sembríos de las plagas que pueden afectarlas. Con el tiempo, espera comprar más tierras para incrementar su producción. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que poner todo de su parte y trabajar muy duro para pagar puntualmente sus cuotas y esta dispuesto a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es un socio muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy respetado. Con los dos mil trescientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará abono para mejorar su producción.
texts.en:
Guillermo, age 40, is a very humble and hard-working man.  He lives in his own house with his three beloved children.  What he wishes for most is to improve their quality of life.

As a result of his arduous work in his fields, he has gotten good production.  He grows bananas and coffee, and his harvests have been abundant and of a very good quality.  What he likes most about his work is harvesting his fields.  When he does that he feels like his efforts are fruitful.  He has been doing this activity for 20 years.  He considers the most difficult part to be taking care of the plants so that they are not affected by pests.  In time, he hopes to buy more land to increase his production.

This is his fourth loan with MFP.  He knows that he has to give it his all and work very hard in order to make his payments on time, and he is prepared to do so.  He is a very responsible member of his communal bank.  That is why he is very respected.  He will use the 2,300 soles he has requested to buy fertilizer in order to improve his production.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer in order to improve his production

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Mrs. Phalla N. (pictured above) is 43 years old and her husband, Mr. Soeung Sean is 38 years old. They have been married since 1991 and have three daughters. All of them are in school. The family lives along National Road Number One, approximately 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Phally and her husband are cauliflower farmers. She is asking for her first loan of $1,200 to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her cauliflower farm.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia V. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 49 years old. Lydia is married and has three children who are 21, 19 and 17 years old. To make a living, Lydia owns and operates a business selling health and medicinal products in the local community. Lydia has been engaged in her business for over three years.

Lydia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lydia has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Lydia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Touch P., 29, is a local farmer who lives in Kompong Chhnang Province. Touch P. earns about $1 per day. His wife, Mrs. Neang Sokunthea, is a 25 year-old farmer who also makes about $1.  With two young children and growing family expenses, Touch P. needs to increase his income. He is requesting funds to purchase and raise small pigs and to purchase ducklings for eggs. By using the Kiva loan, he will get a higher profit and will be able to support his family effectively.

loans.use: To purchase small pigs to rise and ducklings to lay egg.

loans.name: Juana Verónica

texts.es: Juana Verónica A. R. de 34 años de edad, es una madre muy responsable, quien reside en el departamento de Usulután, junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como agricultor y así mismo vive junto a sus cuatro hijos menores de edad. Juana posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos perecederos y de primera necesidad para el hogar. Este negocio es el cual le ha permitido poder contar con ganancias extras lo que le brinda la ayuda necesaria tanto a su esposo como a ella para pagar su casa a tiempo, y así mismo contar con los alimentos y todo lo necesario para vivir dignamente. Es por esto que Juana desea contar con más productos en la tienda, razón por la que solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar arroz, frijoles, azúcar, lácteos y otros más los cuales son necesarios en una buena tienda. Esto es muy importante para Juana ya que cuenta con mucha competencia en el lugar, es por esto que debe contar con todo lo necesario para satisfacer a sus clientes y así ganar otros más los cuales prefieran comprar en su negocio.
texts.en: Juana Veronica A. Rodriguez is 34 years old, and a very responsible mother. She lives in the department of Usulután with her husband who works as a farmer and her 4 young children. Juana has a store where she sells perishable and basic needs goods for the home. This business has allowed her to count with extra earnings which she uses to help her husband, make her house payments on time, and acquire food and all that is necessary to live a life a dignity. Because of this, Juana would like to stock her store with more products, and has requested a loan through which she will buy rice, beans, sugar, dairy products, and other goods which are necessary in a good store. This is very important for Juana given that she has a lot of competition in her area, and has to have all that is necessary to satisfy her clients and gain others who would prefer to shop in her business.

loans.use: To purchase perishable goods (rice, beans, sugar, dairy products, etc)

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos, de 51 años, vive en su casa que es  propia, junto a su esposo y dos de los cuatro hijos que tiene en total, pues los mayores son independientes.Esta emprendedora mujer  se dedica al comercio de  menús (comidas ofrecidas diariamente) para el comedor popular del estado, que funciona desde hace varios años en su casa. De esta manera se apoya, ya que a cambio de sus labores le proporcionan cinco platillos, con los cuales  subsiste su hogar  de lunes a viernes. Además se siente muy satisfecha con su negocio ya que dice que se entretiene mucho con  sus dos compañeras de cocina, y en esta labor lleva más de 15 años desarrollando esta  actividad que le gusta mucho. Paralelamente a esta labor  también realiza servicios de costura, confecciona polos y camisas con la ayuda de su hija. Ahora piensa coser buzos en grandes cantidades para el mes de marzo, pues desea cumplir con un pedido que tiene pendiente, de esta manera espera continuar progresando.Es el décimo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y como socia antigua esta comprometida en  pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. Además tiene planeado continuar apoyando en la directiva a su banco comunal.Santos  tiene planeado invertir el dinero  solicitado en la compra de cantidad de telas que necesita  para la confección de camisas y blusas, para las próximas labores académicas que empiezan en los  colegios, pues tiene varios pedidos pendientes por cumplir, y espera así  aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Santos is 51 years old.  She lives in her own home together with her husband and two of her four children.  Her eldest two children live independently.

This enterprising woman sells meals every day in the popular state eatery which has been running for several years in her home.  In this way she supports herself since, in exchange for her work, they provide her with five meals with which she feeds her household from Monday to Friday.

Santos feels very satisfied with her business since she says that she has a lot of fun with her two cooking companions.  She has been in this work for more than 15 years and she really enjoys it.  In parallel with this work, she also offers sewing services, making polo shirts and shirts with the help of her daughter.  She is thinking of sewing tracksuits in large quantities for the month of March since she would like to fill an order that she has pending.  In this way, she hopes to continue making progress.

This is Santos' tenth loan with MFP and, as a long-standing member, she pledges to make her repayments punctually.  She also plans to continue supporting her community bank.  Santos plans to invest her loan money in buying a quantity of fabric that she needs to make shirts and blouses for the upcoming school year as she has several orders to fill and she thereby hopes to increase her profits.

loans.use: To buy fabric to continue with her business

loans.name: Joeffer

texts.en:
Joeffer A., 32 years old, is married and has one beautiful daughter. Joeffer is a farmer. He plants and harvests rice then sells it at the market. He also raises hogs for fattening and sale. Joeffer works hard to provide a better living for his family.

Joeffer applied for a loan of 8000 PHP from CEVI. He will use it to purchase additional piglets that he will raise. Joeffer is hopeful that this loan will help his business immensely.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to raise

loans.name: Ceferina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” KANTUS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ceferina; ella tiene 42 años de edad, conviviente  y tiene 3 hijos; La socia tiene su negocio de tienda de abarrotes ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar y leche también vende golosinas, fideos, gaseosa, aceite y mas la socia está contenta con su negocio ya que mediante este ella saca a su familia adelante, la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de seguir adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más mercadería para su negocio y así poder tener más variedad de productos que ofrecer.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Introducing Ceferina, a member of “KANTUS”, a communal bank located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

Ceferina is 42 years old, she lives with her partner and has 3 children. She owns a grocery store where she sells basic supplies such as rice, sugar and milk; she also sells sweets, noodles, fizzy drinks, oil and so on. She is happy with her job, as thanks to this activity she is able to provide for her family. She is a very cheerful person with an activity she is determined to carry on.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more products for her shop, in order to have a wider variety of products to offer.
Ceferina is happy about the loan, and she commits to complying with the repayment of her shares.

loans.use: To buy more products for her shop.

loans.name: Sirajat

texts.fr: Dame  Sirajat  est  mariée  avec  3 enfants à  charge. Elle a  37 ans.  Elle  fait  le commerce  de  produits générique  et  savons.  Elle achète les  produits  à Togo  pharma  et  les savons  au grand  marché de Lomé. Dans cette  activité,  elle  cumule  10 ans  d’expérience.  Elle  revend  à  la devanture de sa  maison. Elle  demande   un prêt  pour   répondre  à la demande  sans  cesse  croissante.
texts.en: Sirajat is married and she has 3 children in her care. She is 37 years old. She sells general products and soaps. She purchases her products in Togo Pharma and she buys soaps in the large market in Lome. She has accumulated 10 years' experience in this business. She resells from the front section of her house. She requests a loan to the demands of her ever growing clientele.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
La Sra. Angela  tiene 40 años y  está casada con el Sr. Lucio E. D. 51 años, cuentan con 5 hijos (3 varones y 2 mujeres).
Siempre se dedicó al comercio, con el tiempo abrió su propia despensa, y su marido es constructor especialista en colocación D. pisos pero actualmente se dedica a la artesanía: sombreros, pantallas (especie D. abanico tradicional), escobas D. Palma (Karanday). Son personas muy humildes D. escasos recursos con ganas D. prosperar.
Le gustaría que sus productos se conozcan más en el extranjero poder exportar, pero ahora su prioridad es su despensa por eso solicita el préstamo, para poder comprar muchos comestibles y venderlos, a fin D. obtener medios económicos para superar la pobreza.
texts.en:
Sra. Angela is 40 years old and married to Sr. Lucio E., age 51. They have five children, three sons and two daughters.

Sra. Angela has always engaged in traD., but she eventually opened her own food pantry. Her husband is a builder who specializes in multi-story structures, but currently makes handicrafts such as hats, traditional fans, and palm brooms. Even though they are humble people with limited resources, Angela and her husband want to prosper.

Their products have been exported and are well-known abroad. However, her food pantry is her priority, so Angela is requesting a loan to buy more food products to sell. This will give her the financial means to overcome poverty.

loans.use: To purchase more food products to sell.

loans.name: Marina Del Carmen

texts.es: Marina del Carmen V. de cuarenta y cinco años de edad vive con su compañero de vida, su hija y su nieto  en San Marcos, departamento de San Salvador. Ella posee una venta de accesorios y cosméticos en un puesto  el mercado de San Marcos tiene mucha clientela, la gente de los alrededores que visita el mercado y los empleados de las maquilas cercanas; es famosa en el lugar por su amabilidad y porque siempre tiene lo que sus clientes necesitan a precios accesibles. Marina quiere seguir abasteciendo su negocio pues cada vez necesita más productos como labiales, esmaltes, ropa y accesorios como pulseras, prendedores y otros artículos novedosos; fue eso lo que la impulso a solicitar un crédito a INTEGRAL  pues así podrá crecer su negocio y la esperanza que mejorara su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Marina del Carmen V. is 45 years old.  She lives with her life partner, her daughter and her grandson in San Marcos, in San Salvador department.  Marina sells accessories and cosmetics from a stall in San Marcos market.  She has a lot of customers: people who live nearby and visit the market, and workers from the nearby assembly plants.  Marina is famous locally for her kindness and because she always has what her customers need at affordable prices.  Marina would like to continue stocking her store as she needs more and more products such as lipsticks, nail polish, clothes and accessories such as bracelets, badges and other new products.  This is what led her to request a loan from INTEGRAL.  She would like to grow her business and improve her own and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy lipsticks, clothes and accessories such as bracelets and badges

location.town: San Marcos, departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Blanca Alicia

texts.es:
La Señora Blanca C. es socia del banco comunal Loma de la Cruz, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es patrimonio cultural de la humanidad desde 1999 gracias a su hermoso centro histórico, su gente mantiene su cultura y tradiciones, cuenta también con una gran variedad en su gastronomía.
 
La Señora. Blanca tiene 65 años, es divorciada y tiene 4 hijos quienes son todos mayores de edad, tres son casados e independientes y su hijo soltero la ayuda en la atención de su tienda. No tiene casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
Doña Blanca se dedica a la atención de su tienda la cual la tiene hace 9 años, trabaja de domingo a domingo desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 2 años y los créditos le han beneficiado mucho en su tienda. El dinero de su nuevo crédito lo va ha invertir en la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos para tener más variedad.
  
Su meta es  tener una tienda mucho más grande.
texts.en:
Ms. Blanca C. is a member of the Banco Comunal Loma de la Cruz (Hillock of the Cross Communal Bank). She lives in the city of Cuenca, an UNESCO World Heritage site since 1999 thanks to her beautiful historical city center. Its inhabitants preserve their culture and traditions, and it also offers a great gastronomical variety.

Blanca is 65 years old, she is divorces and she has 4 adult children. Three are married and economically independent, while her son, who is single, helps her running her shop. She lives in a rented house as she doesn’t have one of her own.

Doña Blanca engages in running her shop, which she opened 9 years ago, working form Sundays to Sundays form 6 am to 10 pm.

She has been a member of the communal bank for 2 years and her shop has benefited a lot from the loans. This new loan she is requesting will be used to buy rice, sugar, oils, detergents, sausages and other products in order to offer a wider variety of items.
She wishes to own a much bigger shop.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oils, detergents, sausages and other products.

loans.name: Joann

texts.en:
What could possibly be better than having dessert as your business? Joann has spent the last 30 years perfecting her cheesecake recipe and prides herself on making her cheesecakes with the freshest and best ingredients. As a culinary student, she started a pastry business out of her home and, after much hard work, is now able to successfully support her family. More importantly, 30 years of practice and focus on quality have made her cheesecakes famous in the community. Numerous restaurants and groceries purchase her baked goods and she now rents a space at the local green market and sells her wares one day a week.

With this loan from ACCION USA, Joann will expand her advertising and purchase more quality products. In the future, Joann’s dream is to start a summer camp for kids. Combining cupcake making and sunshine, she hopes to pull them away from the TV and provide them the opportunity to enjoy the summer through baking.

loans.use: to purchase more advertising.

loans.name: Ainura's Group

texts.en:
Ainura T., 37, is the leader of this group. She resides in the town of Toktogul with her husband and their five children, the youngest of whom is 6. Ainura’s husband is a construction worker in a local company, while Ainura relies on cattle-reselling in order to make a living. 

Ainura considers having five children a luxury, therefore she invests a big portion of the family income in the children’s development costs like education, healthcare and social life. However she remembers a period five years ago, when the family faced a harsh financial downturn and Ainura had to sacrifice her monthly income by investing it in the--in those times--risky purchase of  livestock. The risk has paid back. 

A few years later, Ainura’s household increased, and so did sales. She has experience in coping with any kind of livestock except poultry. This time Ainura is eager to try something new like adding several types of poultry to her household. With this purpose she addressed Kiva lenders. She is full of enthusiasm and strength to work further and always try something new. 

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria lives in the Nakulabye Kiyaye Zone neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has five children, all of whom attend school.  Gloria has a business of knitting sweaters.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works seven days a week. Gloria sells her products in a shop by means of wholesale/retail. Gloria has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more threads and needles for making sweaters.  She also generates additional income through part-time teaching.

Gloria's main business challenges include defaulters and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to see her business expand so that she can hire employees to assist in knitting.  Gloria lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family and school fees.

loans.use: to purchase more threads and needles for knitting sweaters.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony lives in the Kibera slums in Nairobi, Kenya.  He runs his retail shop in the same neighborhood.  Being a married man with a two-year-old child, he works hard in his business to provide for his family.  He also sells milk to supplement his income.  

Anthony appreciates Faulu Kenya because he has been trained on business record keeping.  This has helped him run his business in a better way.  He hopes to grow his shop into wholesale in the future.  Anthony has requested a loan for 20,000 Kes to add stocks of sodas, baking flour, kerosene, sugar, soap and mobile phone credit cards for his shop.

loans.use: restock his store

loans.name: Digna

texts.en:
Digna is 44 years old and married with eight children. She earns a living by raising hogs in the Philippines. Digna is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional vitamins and feed for her pigs.

Digna has been raising hogs for six years and also earns additional income from rice farming.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional vitamins and feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to sell hand-crafted embroidery and shoes from a catalog.

loans.name: Katerine

texts.es: Katerine  de 21 años de edad es ya propietaria de un almacén donde vende uniformes y prendas de vestir especialmente para la policía. Su idea de negocio surgió después que dejó de trabajar en un almacén en el cual vendían la misma línea, que le dejaba buenos ingresos y por eso decidió emprender el suyo propio; así fue como inició en un local arrendado ubicado en el barrio los almendros, a pocas cuadras de la escuela de policía del mismo barrio.  Ella vive en casa con sus padres y su negocio funciona con el lleno de los requisitos legales, tiene cámara de comercio expedida a principios del presente año.   Sus  ventas son un resumen de todas las mercancías que vende, maneja bajas cuentas por cobrar, debido a que el grueso de las ventas se realiza de contado, al igual que las compras las cuales las maneja en esta misma modalidad .  En la actualidad requiere invertir capital de trabajo para aumentar inventarios, pues tiene buenos pedidos y un gran potencial, porque presenta bajo endeudamiento actual y esperado y  una buena autonomía financiera, lo que le permite cubrir los pagos de la solicitud realizada.  Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará mercancía para surtir su negocio, pues en su oferta   quiere contar con chapuza falega, elite, aérea, gorras, portacelular, pañoletas estampadas y moñas.
texts.en:
Katerine, 21, is the owner of a store that sells uniforms and clothing for policemen.  Her idea arose after working for a store that sold the same line of articles and she saw that it was a profitable business so decided to branch out on her own.  She rented a store location in the neighborhood of Los Almendros, just a few blocks from the police academy in the same neighborhood.  She lives with her parents, and her business operates within full legal requirements.  She has a licence from the chamber of commerce that was issued at the beginning of this year.

Her sales are the sum of everything she sells.  She has very few accounts receivable since most of her transactions are carried out in cash, just as most of her purchases.  She is need of capital to increase her stock since she has a number of good orders and great potential.  Her accounts payable are low, as was expected since she has good financial autonomy which allows her to make payments when needed.  The credikiva loan is her first through the Mario Santo domingo Foundation.  She plans to buy different merchandise to stock her business, such as Elite and Aérea brand holsters, caps, cell-phone holders, printed neckerchiefs and ties.

loans.use: To buy different brands of holsters, caps, cell-phone carriers, printed neckerchiefs and ties.

loans.name: Siah

texts.en: Siah is 19 years old and lives in the airport community. She stopped her education at only 5th grade. She is married and has a two-year-old child who is not attending school. She received money from her husband to start her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice, oil, pepper and charcoal for her business. She plans to build a house for her children in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, pepper and charcoal for her business

loans.name: Rosa Fidelina

texts.es: Rosa Fidelina D. cuarenta y siete años D. edad vive con su hijo D. 18 años en su casa. Ella se dedica a la venta D. productos D. primera necesidad en una pequeña tiendita que ha logrado establecer en su hogar D. residencia. Ya tiene varios años D. contar con este negocio y es el que le ha permitido llevar el pan D. cada día a su hogar ya que no cuenta con otra fuente D. ingresos. Rosa es muy conocida en la zona y su tienda es muy visitada ya que los clientes la prefieren por ser un lugar donD. encuentran todo lo que buscan y porque Rosa siempre los atienD. con una sonrisa. Además tiene  la ventaja D. que no cuenta con mucha competencia en la zona. El sueño D. Rosa es comprar productos al por mayor para surtir su tienda y poder abastecer a mas clientes D. manera que estos siempre encuentren lo que buscas. Para esto ha decidido solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para comprar productos D. tienda como: granos básicos, golosinas, detergente, condimentos, pan dulce, aceite, y D. mas productos que permitan atraer a mas clientes. Con esto espera lograr su sueño y así tener acceso a una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Rosa Fidelina is 47 years old and lives at home with her 18-year-old son. She sells basic necessities from a small store located in her house. Rosa has been in business for several years and it has allowed her to proviD. for her daily household needs since she has no other source of income. She is well-known in the area and her store is frequented by customers who want to shop at a place where they can find everything. Rosa always welcomes her customers with a smile. In addition, she has the advantage of not having much competition in the area. Her dream is to buy products in bulk so that she can restock her store and supply more customers with what they need.

For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral in order to buy products for her store such as basic grains, candy, detergents, condiments, sweet bread, oil, and other products that will help her attract more customers. With this she hopes to achieve her dream and be able to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, candy, detergents, condiments, sweet bread, oil, and other products.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en: Samwel has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the last six years. He is 32 years old, married to Tabitha and they have three school-going children. Samwel was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan, which he plans to use to buy potato seeds, fertilizer and spraying chemicals. In the future, he hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and chemicals.

loans.name: Tsetsegmaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Tsetsegmaa, 61, is a widow and lives with her daughter in a ger (a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent) located in the slum district of  Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

Since 1998 she has been running a business selling second hand shoes which have been imported from developed countries, and she has gained a lot of experience from it. She is a construction cost planner by profession, but she could not keep her work place due to illness. Now she rents a stall at Kharkhorin, the most crowded outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar city. Her daughter is a student at College, and Tsetsegmaa has to pay her annual fees and provides her with basic daily expenses. 

Tsetsegmaa buys her shoes from wholesalers who import them from abroad, and then cleans and fixes them and sells to customers. Since her daughter became a student she has started facing difficulties running her business due to lack of funds. Therefore she is requesting a loan to raise her income by increasing her working capital and selling more shoes to her customers.

loans.use: To increase her working capital and sell more shoes to her customers.

loans.name: Yuma

texts.en: Yuma is a single woman. She has two children with ages ranging from 7 to 13 years old. She describes herself as quiet. She operates a tailoring business where she provides tailoring services for skirts, shirts, dresses and shorts. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a commercial area and her primary customers are students and school pupils. She describes her biggest business challenge as the lack of capital to purchase more materials. She will use the KES 15,000 loan to add to her stock of material. Her business goal is to have a boutique within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to educate her two children up to the university level and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more fabric

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a married woman with two school  aged children. She has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

She has operated a vegetable grocery for the past five years.  Her potential clients are her neighbors and passers by. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation of commodities in the market. She dreams of expanding her business into a retail shop.

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase vegetables and fruits for her business. She decided to join Yehu to get capital for her business.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and fruits for her business.

loans.name: Paula Beatriz

texts.es:
Paula Beatriz tiene cuarentaiocho años de edad es soltera tiene cuatro hijos, vive con los hijos de veintiséis, catorce, diez, y ocho años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.
LA VRC SAN NICOLAS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Nicolás, Parroquia puerto Pechiche Perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz.
Paula se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol las compras y las ventas las realiza en san Jacinto. Solicita el Crédito para invertir en la agricultura, comprar semillas e insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos y posterior venderlos a un buen precio.
El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque se va a sembrar más y se va a obtener mejores utilidades.
Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuente son: la competencia, las plagas, enfermedades que se dan en los cultivos. El sueño para los próximos años es seguir trabajando y mejorar la calidad de vida.
En los tiempos libres le gusta practicar el deporte y jugar a los gallos.
texts.en:
Paula Beatriz is 48 years old.  She is single, and has four children, aged 26, 14, 10, and 8.  She lives with them in Ventanas Canton, in the Province of Los Ríos.

The San Nicolás communal bank is located in the San Nicolás precinct, in Puerto Pechiche parish, which is part of the Pueblo Viejo Canton.  The members of this group work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn.

Paula works in agriculture growing corn, rice and beans.  She makes her purchases and sales in San Jacinto.  She is requesting the loan to invest in her farming, buying seeds and agricultural supplies such as urea, Matamonte brand herbicide, fertilizers, and weed killer to keep her crops in good condition and to be able to sell them later at a good price.  The loan will be a great help for her, because she is going to increase her planting and gain more efficiency.

The challenges that she faces most frequently are: the competition, insect infestations, crop diseases.  Her dream is to continue working for the next five years and to improve her quality of life.

In her free time she likes to play sports and cock fighting.

loans.use: to invest in her agriculture by buying seeds and agricultural supplies such as urea, Matamonte brand herbicide, fertilizers and weedkiller.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes

loans.name: Eelzi Jen

texts.en:
Eelzi Jen is a 30-year-old married woman. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She has two little kids now.

She owns and operates a general store for a living. Her "sari-sari store" is growing fast. Through this business Eelzi Jen is earning a good income. She earns a total of PHP 12,500 a month in managing her store.

Eelzi Jen's first and second loans from the cooperative assisted her in expanding her business. Her grocery store is very successful. The net income generated is excellent. It helps very much in meeting her family's basic daily needs, and she has been able to promptly repay the loans. She's very grateful that there is a cooperative like GDMPC. She extends her wholehearted thanks to the people who supported her.  

Recently she came to the GDMPC office and applied for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy supplementary grocery products to sell in her general store.
 
Eelzi Jen wants to be able to support the study of her children till they finish their college degree, and to make her business more successful.

loans.use: to buy supplementary grocery products to sell.

loans.name: Tram

texts.en:
Tram is 33 and lives with her daughter and husband in Ho Chi M. city. Her husband makes money by repairing vehicles. 

Tram earns a living running a general store, which she has done for five years. Tram would like to take a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as soft drinks, instant food and noodles, to stock her general store. She hopes that this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan, her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money for her daughter's education.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as soft drinks, instant food and noodles, to stock her general store.

loans.name: Amani Group

texts.en:
