Greetings from Amani Group in Western Kenya! Rhoda is the facilitator of the Amani group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Rhoda takes care of one child at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Rhoda had an excellent maize yield harvesting 18 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Rhoda was only able to harvest four bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Rhoda and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Rhoda will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Amani group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Yamileth Del Socorro

texts.es:
Yamileth, habitante de la ciudad de Granada de 33 años de edad, casada, madre de 6 hijos, ella es comerciante se dedica a la venta de queso, mantequilla y crema. La idea del negocio nació por la necesidad de apoyar a su esposo para salir adelante con sus hijos ya que los ingresos que el ganaba no eran los suficientes para cubrir los gastos del hogar. Hoy en día lleva 4 años con este negocio , ella vende su queso de manera ambulante su esposo trabaja vendiendo leña y trabajando de acarreo. Es base a esta actividades que su familia vive el día a día. 
Ella solicita el crédito para comprar queso, crema, cuajada, mantequilla. Ella trabaja fuerte y duro cada día para lograr darle lo mejor a sus hijos pues desea lograr tener un tramo estable en mercado.
texts.en:
Yamileth lives in the city of Granada. She is 33 years old, married and the mother of six children. She is a merchant who makes a living selling cheese, butter and cream. The idea for this business was born out of the need to support her husband and to get ahead with their children, because the income that he was earning was not sufficient to cover the household expenses.  As of now she has had this business for four years. She sells her cheese door to door. Her husband works selling firewood and works in transport. It is based on these businesses that her family lives day to day. 

She requested the loan to buy cheese, cream, curd and butter. She works strong and hard each day to make enough to give the best to her children. She wants to achieve a stable market presence.

loans.use: to buy cheese, cream, curd and butter.

loans.name: Rogie

texts.en:
Rogie is married and is a father of three children. He is 48 years of age and a very industrious farmer. He has been involved in growing rice for over 10 years. He earns an income amounting to P10,000 from the sales of rice form his last cropping and has used it to improve their living situation.

He wants to earn a higher income to save for the education of his three school-aged children. For this reason, he is asking for a loan in the amount of P16,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides. He just hopes to benefit from a nice and precious harvest from the next cropping season to experience an enhanced lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides

loans.name: Carlos Alejandro

texts.es:
El señor Carlos Alejandro es padre de familia y solita un préstamo para poder construir una barda alrededor de sus casa. Y así tendrá mayor seguridad ya que por la calle donde viven es muy transitada y como tiene una niña pequeña, podrán dejarla salir a jugar con la confianza que no le pasara un accidente. 
Don Alejandro Trabaja desde hace dos años en un centro comercial, su esposa la señora Alma Rosa para apoyarlo en los gastos economía de su hogar, trabaja en una tienda departamental como vendedora. 
Desea la seguridad y protección de su familia y el patrimonio este en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Carlos Alejandro is a father and he is requesting a loan to be able to build a wall around his house. That way he will have better security as the street where they live has a lot of traffic. Since he has a small daughter, they will be able to allow her to go out to play with confidence that will not be in an accident. 

Alejandro has worked in a shopping center for two years. His wife, Alma Rosa, works in a department store as a salesperson to help out with expenses.

He wants security and protection for his family and wants his assets to be in a better condition.

loans.use: to build a wall around his house and install a gate in the front.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick, 47 years old, is married to Everline and they have seven children. Fredrick has operated a cushion making business for 15 years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000.

Fredrick is applying for his first loan with KADET ltd. He will use the KES 20,000 to purchase materials for making cushion covers. Fredrick will use the anticipated profit from the loan to repay the loan and to put the rest in savings. His hopes and dreams are to grow his business and employ more staff.

loans.use: To purchase materials for making cushion covers

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia owns a beauty salon in her local community. She is married to a welder who encouraged her to take a course where she learned how to cut and style hair along with other skills. With the money he has saved up he bought her all the necessary supplies for her beauty salon which they have built in a part of their home. Virginia now wants to invest in new products for her clients such as shampoo, conditioner, hair dye, perfume etc. She is hoping that she will receive this loan because her husband does not have any more money and he has already sacrificed most of the savings set aside to invest in his own business. They have 1 child and they both hope that with this loan they will be able to provide a better future for him.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in products to sell at her beauty salon such as shampoo and perfume

loans.name: Penina

texts.en: Penina S. is a young talented woman of thirty-two who believes in herself.  She is a mother of five children, and they spend most of their time with her husband developing their business. She strongly believes in her small farm because her husband and her two brothers are giving her support.  She sells her products at the market, and she has no doubt that she will succeed because of the growth of the customers each and every day of the week.  Penina suggested that her business would never fail because her family works full time to maintain their farm in good condition.

loans.use: To purchase organic fertilizers, pesticides, fungicides and farm implements

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.en:
Maria Guadalupe lives in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon. She is married and has four children aged 14, 16 and 18. To proviD. for her family she has worked for five years alongsiD. one of her sister-in-law making tamales. Later she prepared food for laborers doing construction near her home. She works hard to grow her business and little by little wins new customers. Right now Maria needs a $375 loan to buy ingredients for her tamales, which are much in demand. She proposes to repay the loan in 5 to 10 months. If you can help Maria with this, she and her family will sincerely appreciate your support.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Alexis Hult

Maria Guadalupe vive en Monterrey, Nuevo León, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos, D. 18, 16 y 14 años D. edad, L. necesidad D. ayudar con los gastos del hogar L. incentivaron a trabajar con una D. sus cuñadas ayudándole en L. elaboración D. tamales hace cinco años, después tuvo L. oportunidad D. hacer comidas para personas que trabajan en una construcción cerca D. su casa, y poco a poco se fue ganando clientes, ahora surte numerosos pedidos D. tamales, su negocio ha estado creciendo poco a poco y María se esfuerza día cada día por sacarlo adelante.

En estos momentos Maria necesita D. un préstamo por L. cantidad D. $ 375 dólares que utilizará para L. compra D. los ingredientes que requiere para elaborar pedidos D. tamales que tiene D. sus clientes, elL. ofrece devolver este crédito en un lapso D. 5 a 10 meses. Tú puedes ayudar a Maria a que continúe creciendo, elL. y su familia agradecen sinceramente tu apoyo.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients.

loans.name: Saidniso

texts.en: Saidniso has worked in the wholesale market for 12 years. Her business is the trade of sacks of flour. Her business is located in the centre of Panjshanbe market in Khujand, and she buys her goods from suppliers in Kirgizistan. Her elder son helps her in with the business. She became a client of Micro Invest in 2003, which helped her to increase the turnover of her business and today she is an experienced businesswoman. She has a lot of clients because her flour is of highest quality and she also sells 3 different varieties of flour. She has concluded an agreement with several bakeries and pasta workshops for a partnership. Now she wants to buy 200 sacks of flour and she needs 1000 USD for this purpose.

loans.use: Purchase of 200 sacks of flour

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 33 years old and has an electronic goods shop. He applied to get $1200 from AL-Aman to purchase more goods and develop his shop. He has a big family. He expects his third child in the next month. He wants to increase his sales and income and improve his living standard.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase more goods

loans.name: Zenaida Marcionila

texts.es:
Zenaida is 66 years old and has 10 children, but only her daughter and granddaughter are dependent upon her. She completed the third grade in elementary school. She married at 17 years old, and for a while suffered abuse from her spouse. She lives in the Agallpampa district, Otuzco province, Libertad state. She saw herself as obligated to begin a business at 8 years old, selling bread and bananas as she was orphaned without a father. Later she worked selling food in Quiruvilca in the Santiago de Chuco province.

Today she buys and sells fruits and candy, offering her products to all the cars that pass by Agallpampa, and she also raises pigs and sheep. She is a founding member of the Communal Bank "Mujeres del Mañana” (Women of Tomorrow), with her first loan of 300 soles (approximately $96), she began selling fruit and candy to the cars, and left the selling of food in Quiruvilca as it is a mining zone far from her community. With the current loan from Manuela Ramos of 800 soles (approximately $287), which she will pay in 6 monthly installments, she will buy pigs and guinea pigs to raise and sell at Christmas.

Senaida was supervisor of "the glass of milk," an initiative that she administered in the Trujillo province to benefit the children and aged of her community. She dreams that all her children live well economically. In addition she wishes to have an extended business in her home so she doesn't have to go to the sell to the cars because she is suffering from diabetes.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Zenaida tiene 66 años de edad y tiene 10 hijos pero solamente dependen de ella su hija y su nieta. Estudió hasta el tercer grado de primaria. Se caso a la edad de 17 años, por un tiempo sufrió el maltrato de su esposo. Vive en el Distrito de Agallpampa, Provincia de Otuzco Departamento de La Libertad. Se vio obligada a empezar a trabajar a los 8 años de edad en la venta de pan y plátanos debido a que se quedó huérfana de padre. Mas adelante trabajó vendiendo comida en Quiruvilca en la provincia de Santiago de Chuco.

En la actualidad se dedica a la compra y venta de frutas y golosinas subiendo a ofrecer sus productos a todos los carros que pasan por Agallpampa y a la crianza de cerdos y carneros. Es socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal “Mujeres del Mañana”, con su primer crédito de S/.300 (aproximadamente $96) empezó la venta de frutas y golosinas en los carros y dejó la venta de comida en Quiruvilca debido a que es una zona minera alejada de su comunidad. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 800.00 ($.267 aprox.) el cual cancelará en 6 cuotas mensuales, comprará cerdos y cuyes para engordarlos y venderlos en navidad.

La señora Zenaida fue fiscalizadora del vaso de leche que ella gestionó en la provincia de Trujillo para beneficiar a los niños y ancianos de su comunidad. Sueña con que todos sus hijos vivan bien económicamente, además desea tener un negocio más amplio en su casa para no tener que estar subiendo a los carros porque esta padeciendo de diabetes.

loans.use: Purchase of pigs and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Sulton

texts.en:
Sulton S. is a seller of construction materials in the Spitamen market, Tajikistan.  He is married and has 3 children.  His elder son is his business partner.  They together sells their goods.  Sulton has been engaged in the construction trade for over 6 years.  He bought his goods from supplies in Russia and orders goods brought by van / wagon.  He has a constant stream of clients from remote districts of Khujand,Tadjikistan.  Now he is requesting 4100 somoni for purchasing the next batch of goods.

(He is on the left in the photo)

loans.use: Business expansion.

loans.name: Micaela  Mercedes

texts.es:
Due to bad luck, Mrs. Hernandez lost her job, and started her business with loans for $200. For the past 20 years she has worked selling a variety of soft drinks, because of unemployment and the need to support her family.

With the financial support of CEPRODEL, she has been able to develop her business, which allows her to offer a better price to her customers because she can buy her merchandise in cash.

One of her goals is to establish her business in a locale at the market, because right now she sells her products under the shade of a tree, and this would allow her to improve her family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. H. por infortunios del destino pierde su empleo e inicia su negocio por prestamos de $200 y desde hace 20 años se dedica a la actividad de venta de refrescos variados al en desempleo y por la necesidad de sustentar a su familias.

Con el apoyo financiero de CEPRODEL ha logrado el desarrollo de su negocio, lo que le permite ofrecer un mejor precio a sus clientes por lo que compra su mercadería al contado.

Una de sus metas es establecerse en un local en el mercado ya que actualmente vende sus productos bajo la sombra de un arbol y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

loans.use: buying merchandise (En compra  de  mercadería)

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Mrs. Elena R. sells fast food which she prepares at home, then sells in her diner. Mrs. R. has had this business for 30 years, and this eatery is frequented by numerous patrons since it is located on a busy street in the city of León.

She has two children, one of whom is under her care, so she has to provide her with an education. For this reason, Mrs. R. so enthusiastically prepares the delicious meals that she offers for breakfast, lunch, and dinner.

Ceprodel has been giving her support with loans for a year, giving her the opportunity to invest in her business, increasing her profits, and improving her business space. She states that those loans have made a notable impact on her business because her profits have increased and her living conditions have improved. She is determined to continue with these loans that only Ceprodel provides her with.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio de la Sra. Elena R. es la venta de comida la cual la prepara en su casa para después proceder a su venta en su local de habitación. La Sra. R. tiene 30 años de tener su negocio y este comedor es visitado por varios clientes ya que está ubicado en un acalle muy transitada de la ciudad de León.

Es madre de dos hijas de las cuales una de ellas esta bajo su responsabilidad y tiene el deber de brindarle los estudios, por este motivo es que muy esforzadamente la señora R. se dedica a preparar los deliciosos platillos para ofertarlos en el desayuno, almuerzo y la cena.

Ceprodel le brinda apoyo por medio de financiamientos desde hace un año dándole oportunidad para invertir en su negocio, aumentar sus utilidades y mejorar su infraestructura. Según indica, los impactos de estos créditos para su negocio han sido muy notables ya que ha aumentado sus ganancias y mejorado sus condiciones de vida por lo que está dispuesta a seguir con estos financiamientos que solo Ceprodel le brinda.

loans.use: Purchase of fast food ingredients

loans.name: Thi Hoan

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hoàn, 47 years old, has 3 children. Two daughters have their own families and a son is a carpenter for hire. The family income is average of 3.5USD a day from tending few pigs at home and as hired labors. She would like to take out a loan of 150USD to buy piglets. It is convenient for her that the Binh Minh does not require credit.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Hoàn năm nay 47 tuổi, có 3 con, 2 đứa đã lấy chồng, còn một đứa đang làm thợ mộc. Thu nhập của gia đình chị chủ yếu là từ chăn nuôi, đi làm công (làm thợ), nhưng nhờ biết xoay sở chị cũng tích góp được 50000đồng/ngày. Chị vay 2006000 đồng để mua thêm lợn, tăng gia sản xuất. Chị rất thích vay vốn của Chương trình binhminh cdc vì không phải thế chấp lại có thể được vay lâu dài.

loans.use: Buy piglets

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Maria Luisa is a resident of the city of Montemorelos, Nuevo León. Her story is like that of so many other women who live on the outskirts of this metropolitan area, who have to struggle after finding themselves alone. Four years ago her 2 sons left to look for the American dream, and she has not heard from them since. Later she faced the death of her husband and was left without any economic support, as she could not find a job because of her age. She turned to the city government, who helped her so that she could open up a convenience store in her house.

She is now requesting a loan of US $350, which will be repaid in 4 month, to buy merchandise for her store. Maria thanks you for supporting her.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Maria Luisa es una habitante de la ciudad de Montemorelos, Nuevo León, su historia es como la de muchas mujeres de municipios fuera del área metropolitana, que tienen que abrirse paso y luchar al quedarse solas, hace 4 años sus 2 hijos se fueron en busca del sueño americano, no volviendo a saber nada de ellos, posteriormente tuvo que enfrentar la muerte de su marido, quedando desprotegida sin un sustento económico, al no encontrar trabajo debido a su edad busco apoyo por parte del alcalde de su municipio quienes la apoyaron para que pusiera una tienda de abarrotes en su casa.

Ahora ella solicita un crédito por US $350 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar mercancía para su tienda. Maria agradecerá tus aportaciones a su caso.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica N. is 37 years old. She is married with 4 children, and they are in school. She sells used clothes and corn dough. Corn dough is produced from milled maize grains, and it is used to prepare local foods like porridge and banku. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of maize and bales of used clothes to increase her stock. This she believes can help her to expand her business and make more income. Veronica is a member of the community group called Adoration Trust Group. The group members guarantee that each member repays her loans and act as a form of social collateral.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize and bales of used clothes

loans.name: Comité Koe´ju Group

texts.es:
This committee is composed of 15 hard working women who the majority are business women that sell yucca breads. The group is currently in the fifth stage of their program for women. The union of this committee is largely thanks to the efforts of Gloria C. who sought out each of these women in their homes and invited them to come to partake in an information session in their home.

This is how the Koe'ju Committee was born, in our second aboriginal language Guarani the name means "Sunrise". This committee is composed of 15 women of which 7 sell yucca breads (a traditional food in Paraguay widely popular and resembling cheese bread). Three of the women run grocery stores and the others sell clothing. They are all neighbours in the Kennedy region in the city of Caaupe. One of the virtues of this committee is the interest and loyalty in the rules and regulations of the program, and in the timeliness of the monthly payments. These women also hold a capital savings thanks to the work they carry out every weekend in the markets, for special events, sporting events, and any other occassion.

All of the members receive an equal sum of money and they will invest it in the purchase of ingredients and merchandise for their sales. The committee's objective for the short term is to improve the image of the region by keeping the public patios clean and by painting the fences along the streets and also to remodel the small plaza, in need of repair and repainting. In addition, the play structures need to be repaired so that the children might have their recreational area to play in safely.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

El comité está compuesto por 15 señoras trabajadoras que en su mayoría son comerciantes, la mayoría de ellas se dedican a la elaboración y venta de chipas, actualmente el grupo ya está en su 5to. ciclo del programa comité de mujeres. La unión de este comité se debió en gran parte por la buena predisposición de la señora Gloria C. quien fue la buscó a cada señora de sus casas y las invitó para la reunión de información que se realizó en su casa.

Así nace el Comité Koe`ju, que en nuestro segundo idioma nativo el Guaraní significa Amanecer. Este comité está integrado por 15 señoras de las cuales 7 se dedican a la venta de chipas (comida típica del Paraguay muy consumida parecida a un pan con queso), 3 poseen despensas y las otras se dedican a la venta de ropas. Todas son vecinas del barrio Kennedy de la ciudad de Caaupé, una de las virtudes de este comité es el interés y el cumplimiento de las normas y reglamento del programa, además de la puntualidad en los pagos de sus cuotas. Estas mujeres poseen además un interesante ahorro de dinero gracias a las actividades que realizan cada fin de semana como ferias de comidas, rifas, torneos deportivos, entre otras actividades.

Todas las integrantes reciben un promedio de gs. 580.000 y lo invierten para la compra de insumos y mercaderías para sus ventas. El comité tiene como objetivo a corto plazo la de mejorar la imagen del barrio con la limpieza de los patios baldíos, veredas y pintar los cordones de las calles al igual que embellecer la pequeña plaza del barrio que necesita pintura y reparación de los juegos para que sus hijos tengan un lugar donde recrearse sanamente y fuera de peligros.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, meats, eggs, milk, cookies, soft drinks, starch, cheese, vegetable oil, and to purchase clothing for adults and children such as shorts, t-shirts, nylons, and blouses.

loans.name: Naji

texts.en: Naji, 43, is married and has 3 children. He lives in the suburbs of Beirut. He is the owner of a small printing center. He needs a loan in the amount of US$ 1,200 to purchase new advanced machines for his shop and thus expand his business. This is the second time that Naji has requested a loan from Al Majmoua. He successfully repaid his previous loan on time.

loans.use: to purchase new advanced machines for his print shop

loans.name: Maguelewe

texts.fr:
Married to to Mr. Kossi Noulefanski, who is a soldier, Mrs. Maguelew G. was born on February 17, 1983 in Tém’dja in the Ogou prefecture. She has three children and her main business involves selling charcoal and corn in the market in Agoè. She is requesting this first-time loan to purchase 15 bags of charcoal and 2 bags of corn in order to sell more and draw an income.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariée à monsieur NOULEFANSI Kossi qui est un militaire, dame G. Maguelewe est née le 17 février 1983 à Témédja dans la préfecture de l’Ogou. Elle a trois enfants et a pour activité principale la vente de charbon de bois et de maïs dans le marché d’Agoè. Elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 15 sacs de charbon de bois et 2 sacs de maïs afin de mieux vendre et de tirer un revenu.

loans.use: To purchase corn and charcoal

loans.name: Juntas Podemos Group

texts.es:
The Juntas Podemos ("Together We Can") committee was formed in the Virgen de Caacupe neighborhood in the city of Ypane. There are 18 members, the majority of whom engage in their own separate businesses.

The committee has a solid organization and has strongly supported its members' business activities. Its members have demonstrated their unity by establishing rules and regulations. This committee has participated in training offered by the program.

It's been noted that all have grown impressively, the members, that is, showing responsibility for their obligations.

They have established various kinds of businesses: Among them are women who sell fruits and vegetables or own kiosks and shops. Others sell clothing, jewelry, sheets, towels, ice cream, soft drinks, food and bedspreads. The loan that they're applying for will be invested in the purchase of merchandise for their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

El Comité “Juntas Podemos” se formo en el Asentamiento Virgen de Caacupe de la Ciudad de Ypané, este comité cuenta con 18 integrantes la mayoría de ellas cuentan con actividades individuales.

El comité se encuentra sólido en cuanto a su organización y es muy constante en lo que respecta a actividades realizadas en la comunidad comité. Sus integrantes han demostrado su unidad estableciendo normas y reglamentos internos a ser cumplidos. Este comité ha participado de las capacitaciones brindados por el programa.

En todas se ha notado un gran crecimiento, en cuanto a lo personal se refiere, siendo responsables con sus obligaciones.

Ellas realizan distintos tipos de actividades entre ellas hay señoras que se dedican a la venta de frutas y verduras, otras poseen kioscos y despensas, otras venden ropas, joyas, sábanas, toallas, helados, gaseosas, comidas y colchas. El crédito que solicitan será invertido en la compra de mercaderías para las actividades nombradas.

loans.use: Miscellaneous businesses: Buy products for resale or supplies for making products for sale.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.en:
The Renacer ("Rebirth") group is maD. up of eleven women and two men who know one another from their neighborhood in the tropical Santa Cruz region of eastern Bolivia. The two men in the group, Oscar and Ignacio, are brothers, and Elvira and Erika are sisters.

Each of the group members has their own business: some sell clothing, shoes, handicrafts, dry goods, baked goods, and cosmetics; others work as tailors, make hammocks or run lunch counters. All of the group members have one to five years of experience in their respective businesses, except for Doña Candelaria Maria, who has been running her lunch counter for twenty years!

The group members say they will use this loan to buy more ingredients to make their products or tools for their businesses. Most of the group members have had previous experience with group loans at other Bolivian microfinance institutions. They all promise to make their repayments on time.

loans.use: Buy more materials to make products and tools for businesses

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary M., a 33 year old woman, is married with three kids, and a very hard working trader. She enjoys selling cosmetics products, which has been her major source of livelihood for the past four years. She says selling cosmetics is lucrative and her experience in the market has enabled her to gain many loyal customers. 

At the moment, she does not have a shop so she sells at the community market. Mary believes that with the loan, she will possess sufficient resources to purchase more cosmetics goods and jewelries. She is a member of the St. John Group, where members provide assistance to one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy additional cosmetic products and jewelry

loans.name: Hope

texts.en:
Hope is an industrious woman who owns a salon. She styles hair for people and also sells styling creams and combs. She has been in this business for the past five years. Apart from this salon business, Hope also owns a tailoring business where she sells tailoring materials and also mends clothes for her customers. Hope needs the loan amount of N140, 000 to purchases a generator to help her cope with electricity problems.

Hope is a LAPO client. Hope is 41 years old and married with two children. She says thank you to all her Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a generator and hair materials

loans.name: Marie Gisèle

texts.fr: Originaire de Porto-Novo,capitale politique du BENIN,dame AGASSOUSSI Marie Gisèle est née en 1968 à Cotonou .Mariée à ACCLOMBESSI Albert ,entrepreneur, elle est mère de 06 enfants.Après son échec au Certificat d'Etude Primaire(CEP), elle aida sa mère dans la vente de divers articles :savons, les conserves,les fruits.Ensuite elle alla en apprentissage de couture -layette pour 3 ans .Elle reçut son diplôme de fin de formation et parallèlement à l'exercice de son métier ,elle ouvre une boutique dans laquelle elle  vend différents articles de mercerie .Elle sollicite ce 3ème prêt de 150000fcfa pour renforcer son activité en la diversifiant avec la vente de soja et d'huile.
texts.en:
A native of Porto-Novo, the political capital of Benin, Mrs. Marie Gisèle A. was born in 1968 in Cotonou. Married to Albert Acclombessi, entrepreneur, she is the mother of 6 children. After she failed the Primary School Leaving Certificate, she helped her mother sell various items: soap, tinned foods, fruit. Then she did an apprenticeship in sewing layettes for three years.

Marie Gisèle received her diploma at the end of this course and, while plying her trade, she has also opened a shop where she sells various sewing necessities. She is requesting this third loan in the amount of 150,000 F CFA to bolster her business by diversifying and selling soy and oil.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: 1 sack of soy, 1 tin of 10 liters of peanut oil, 6 rolls of poplin, etc.

loans.name: Mot

texts.en: S. is 26 years old and earns a living growing rice crops. She lives in a village in the Pursat Province and is married to Kimsen (shown in the photograph), 28, who also grows rice. The young couple has two children, both of whom are teenagers. Because rice farming is the family's main source of income, S. and Kimsen work hard every day. At present, however, they only own a piece of farmland that was given to them by their parents. To expand their farming business, therefore, S. would like to ask for a loan to be able to purchase an additional plot of farmland.

loans.use: Purchase of a plot of farmland

loans.name: Chheung

texts.en:
Chheung S. is 55 years old and resides in the Prey Veng province with her husband and two of her children. She grows and sells rice to earn approximately $1 of profit each day. 

Her husband had been retired from work for a year and currently receives $1 per day for his retirement. Two of their children are employed and share the income to help raise their standard of living as well. Mrs. Chheung is asking for a loan so that she can purchase a motorbike for her husband to operate a moto-taxi and increase the family's well-being.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to operate a taxi business

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: Doña María Mercedes, es casada, trabaja como docente en la escuela Vigarmy Flores, tiene 3 hijos: el mayor tiene 27 años de edad, trabaja como docente igual que su mamá, la otra hija tiene 20 años estudia 1er año en la universidad Uraccan y el menor tiene 13 años estudia su 6to grado de educación primaria, esta solicitando su 8vo crédito a AFODENIC para inventirlo en cambiarle zinc a su casa de habitación (compra de zinc y perlines) ya que se encuentra en malas condiciones, su compañero de vida trabaja en la finca como agricultor, ambos comparten los gastos del hogar y los compromisos adquiridos con AFODENIC, a pesar que son una familia de escasos recursos económicos, se caracterizan por ser muy responsables y humildes, esta familia son muy queridos por su comunidad ya que esta maestra tiene 21 años de impartir el pan de la enseñanza a los niños de su comunidad,  su sueño es tener salud, trabajo y una vivienda bonita para su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Mercedes is married and she is a teacher in the Vigarmy Flores school. She has 3 children: the eldest is 27 years old and works as a teacher, like his mother; her daughter is 20 years old and is in her first year of university at the University of Uraccan; and, the youngest is 13 years old and is in grade 6. She is requesting a loan for the 8th time through AFODENIC (Kiva Field Partner) to invest in changing the zinc and purlins of their roof (to purchase zinc and purlins) because it is in need of replacing. Her life partner works as an agriculturer, both sharing the household expenses and the compromises made to AFODENIC. Eventhough they are a family of limited financial resources they are known as very responsible and humble people. This family is very loved by their community especially because she has been a teacher for 21 years teaching the children of their community. Her dream is to be in good health, to have work and to have a beautiful home for their family.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To replace the roof, to purchase purlins

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana tiene 29 abriles, lleva conviviendo con su pareja cerca de 8 años, de los cuales tiene una hija de 7 años, viven en la casa heredada de sus suegros. Desde hace 8 años y todos los días se dedica pastar sus animales como: vacas, carneros y cabras, mientras que su esposo cultiva sus chacras, sembrando mayormente papas. En los días de cosecha Ana empieza a preparar el menú a las 5.00am hasta las 8.00am y en seguida acude a la chacra para recoger las papas, preparar la carga y finalmente comercializarla en el mercado. En esta época, a sus vacas las sujeta a una estaca y a los carneros los ata de las patas para evitar  que se dispersen y puedan perjudicar cultivos ajenos. Ana está muy contenta de criar animales y cultivar sus plantas, ahora quiere incursionar en la venta de leña, por contar con terrenos de muchos árboles, a lo que piensa sacarle ventaja y captar más ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida. La permanencia de Ana en MFP ha sido por 5 préstamos consecutivos, y en todo este tiempo a demostrado ser puntual en sus pagos, está muy contenta con las políticas del banco comunal y tiene el cargo secretaria donde en cada reunión se encarga tomar apuntes en el libro de actas. Con el dinero que ha solicitado comprará fertilizantes para su chacra, así como corderos pequeños de buena raza, con la finalidad de que crezcan, engorden y los pueda revender a mejor precio para ganar mucho más de lo invertido.
texts.en:
Ana is 29 years old. Ana is married and she has been with her husband for nearly 8 years. She has a 7 year old daughter. They inherited the house that they live in from her in-laws. Ana has been making a living taking care of her farm animals for the past 8 years. She has cows, sheep, and billy goats. Her husband cultivates a type of vegetable called a "chacra" and he also grows potatoes. During harvest Ana begins to prepare meals for her family at 5 o'clock a.m until 8 o'clock a.m and afterwards she gathers the potatoes and the vegetables and prepares them to get them ready to sell at the marketplace. Before she leaves to go to the market she ties up her cows and her billy goats to posts so that they will not escape and ruin her neighbors' cultivations. Ana is really happy with raising her animals and cultivating her plants, and now she wants to start selling firewood. She wants to take advantage of having a lot of trees around her home. With the firewood sales she wants to improve the quality of life for her family. Ana has received 5 consecutive loans through MFP and she has shown that she is punctual in making the payments. She has been really happy with the policies of the communal bank and she is in charge of taking notes during each of their meetings. With this loan she wants to buy fertilizers for her vegetables, and buy more baby sheep of a good breed. Her plan is to raise the animals to grow and get fat and then resale them at a better price so that she can earn more money.

(Translated by Mariela of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and small billy goats

loans.name: Ni Ketut Tiyarmini

texts.id: Pada periode pertama, Ni Ketut Tiyarmini menggunakan uang hasil pinjaman dari Dinari untuk memperbaiki kandang babinya. Kemudian sisanya digunakan untuk membeli pakan babi peliharaannya. Kini kandang babi Ni Ketut Tiyarmini sudah bagus. Di kandang tersebut awalnya Tiyarmini hanya memelihara 2 ekor babi penggemukan. Pada saat panen, Tiyarmini mendapatkan keuntungan kurang lebih Rp. 100.000,- dari 1 ekor babi. Dari keuntungan itu Tiyarmini membeli 3 ekor bibit babi penggemukan. Pada periode kedua ini, Tiyarmini mengajukan pinjaman lagi untuk modal pakan dan membeli 2 ekor bibit penggemukan. Sehingga Dia bisa memelihara lebih banyak babi dan dapatkan keuntungan yang lebih banyak lagi.
texts.en:
Ni Ketut Tiyarmini used the funding from her 1st Dinari loan to build a pig hut and to buy pig feed. She initially had 2 piglets and she earned a total of USD 17.6 from them. She used that money to buy another 3 piglets.

Ni Ketut Tiyarmini is planning to participate in her 2nd Dinari loan. She wants to use the loan money to buy pig feed and to buy another 2 piglets. She is hoping to earn more money by raising more piglets.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy feeds and piglets

loans.name: Idowu

texts.en: Idowu is 31 years old and married with 4 children. She sells baby things like soap, cream, flasks, diapers, and clothes. She is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more baby things to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more baby things to sell

loans.name: Kyarukowa A Faista Kebarasa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Faista K. is 36 years old and married with four children, all in school. She has operated her retail business for over five years.

Faista is requesting a loan to purchase sugar, salt, soap and other items to increase her retail business. She is a hard worker and dreams of prospering in her business.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, salt, soap and other items to increase her retail business

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josephine started her local restaurant a year ago in Kasoa, Ghana where she lives. She is one of the most popular food vendors in her neighborhood. She is 42 years old and married with three children, all of whom are currently in school.

She serves many kinds of local dishes, like fufu, rice balls, and banku, among others. Fufu is a starchy dumpling that is prepared from pounded cassava and plantains and is eaten with soup. Banku is prepared from ground maize grains and is eaten with hot pepper or soup.

Josephine wants to use this loan to buy more raw materials, such as maize, cassava, plantains, meat, fish, and firewood. She also hopes to use part of the proceeds to finance her children's education. She is a member of the Ruth Trust community group . In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans and provide peer pressure to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials, like maize, cassava, plantains, meat, fish, and firewood.

loans.name: Noralyn

texts.en:
Noralyn T. is from the village of Biasong. She is 37 years old. Noralyn is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Noralyn owns & operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Noralyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Noralyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Noralyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Noralyn is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Noralyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment

loans.name: Lucia Adelaida

texts.es: Doña Lucia Adelaida B. de 51 años de edad, reside en el barrio Laureles Norte en la capital de Managua, casada y con tres hijos dos trabajan y uno esta estudiando, su esposo trabaja como guarda de seguridad. Su negocio es una repostería que administra desde hace tres años el cual inicio  con préstamos y ha ido creciendo. Sus planes es terminar de hacer su casa y apoyar a  su hijo que estudia. Con este préstamo es para comprar mesas de trabajo y poder fortalecer su inventario, este es su cuarto ciclo de préstamo  en Afodenic y da las gracias por los logros alcanzados. Su objetivo es poner una panadería el cual le generara mejores utilidades.
texts.en:
Doña Lucia Adelaida B. is 51 years old, lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood in the capital of Managua, is married and has three children, two work and one is studying. Her husband works as a security guard. Her business is a confectionery which she has been managing for the past three years; she started it with loans and it has been growing. Her plans are to finish building her house and to support her son who is studying. With this loan she will buy work tables so that she can increase her inventory. This is her fourth loan with Afodenic and she is thankful for the achievements reached. Her goal is to start a bakery, which will generate better profits.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tables for her business.

loans.name: Soeng

texts.en: Mrs. Soeng Y. lives in Trapaing Kok village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she makes a living growing rice. It is now the rainy season and time to plant new crops, but she is unable to do that because she does not have money to buy two oxen to do the plowing. That is why she has decided to apply for a loan to buy oxen. Her husband, Mr. Mork Seak, is a traditional healer and also helps his wife with their planting. Mrs. Soeng Y. is 54 years old and has three children, two of whom are farmers while the third works as a security guard. Her husband is seen here in the photo.

loans.use: To buy two oxen to plow her farm

loans.name: Tereise

texts.en:
Tereise T. (0) is a 41-year-old woman living in the town of Sapapalii. She is married and has seven school-aged children.

Tereise owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting cocoa for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 200 WST a month.

In 2008, Tereise joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

Tereise is now requesting a new loan of 1,150 WST which will again be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. The loan will be her 2nd from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Aurea

texts.en:
Aurea R. is 43 years old.  She is married to Pedrito, who works as a farmer in their village. They have two children: Precious Ayse - 16 years old, second year college and Ashley, 3 years old. The family is living a simple life in the rural village of Cutog Grande, Reina Mercedes, Isabela. Aurea aims to give her family with a progressive living.  This is the reason why she is doing her best in the business to become successful.

Aurea is a soft drink dealer. With her desire to become more productive, she is now requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP25, 000.00.  She is also hoping that someday, she could have her own delivery truck to further serve her customers. At the moment, Aurea is catering most of the community stores in their village with their need for soft drinks. The business is good and she believes that it will grow with her patience and hard work.

loans.use: Business Improvement

loans.name: Perlas Doradas Group

texts.es:
“Perlas Doradas” es el nombre elegido por este grupo de nueve socias que han dedicado ya gran parte de su vida al comercio de todo tipo de mercadería según la temporada, lo que hace que la proximidad de la primavera, el día del estudiante, día de la amistad, y  otras connotaciones que tiene el 21 de septiembre en nuestro país, se convierta en una gran oportunidad de generar importantes recursos para ellas y sus familias.
Este es el primer año que estas señoras trabajan dentro de la organización, pero con la tenacidad, compromiso y responsabilidad, estamos seguros que lograran realizar una buena inversión en sus rubros para beneficio y mejora de la calidad de vida  de todas ellas y sus familias.
texts.en:
"Golden Pearls" is the name that this group of 9 members has chosen. These 9 members have dedicated a large portion of their life to the sale of all kinds of merchandise depending on the season. Soon, the 21st of September will arrive in their country which because it is the first day of spring, student's day, friendship day, and has other connotations, this day will allow for to a great opportunity for to generate important financial security for them and their families. This is the first year that these women have worked with the organization, but with care, responsibility and commitment, we're sure that they will be able to achieve a good investment in their areas to benefit and make their and their families' quality of life better.

Translated from Spanish by Mitchell Usher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise to sell

loans.name: Monico

texts.en:
Monico M. is from the village of Sto. Nino, Manolo Fortich Bukidnon. He is 43 years old. Monico is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Monico owns and operates a clothing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling ready to wear items and used clothing to local community members. Monico is just starting this business.

In 2008, Monico joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Monico has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Monico is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Monico from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to grow the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Zenab

texts.en:
Zenab M. is 21 years old and married. Her husband is a business man. They have 3 children who go to school. Zenab owns a taxi that carries passengers from one area to another area within Juba town. She  is requesting a loan to purchase spare parts and more fuel.  With the extra profits from her loan, Zenab hopes to be able to buy another taxi that will always carry passengers from Juba to Torit town in the east of Southern Sudan.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education,  human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts and more fuel

loans.name: Zaur

texts.en: Zaur lives in Fuzuli region. He was born in 1974. This man has been farming for 5 years.  He is married and has 2 children. Now he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy pesticides to improve his farming business.

loans.use: To buy pesticides

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora, 45, became a widow when she was twenty-five years old. Her principle in life is that no matter what happens, life must go on for the sake of her children. Nora is now living with Samuel Gonzales and she has two children with him. Their family lives together in the village of Zone III, San Mariano, Isabela.

Nora operates her own variety store in their village and in her small store she also sells frozen foods for additional income. She hopes that her store will further expand because it is very helpful to their family. Nora is requesting a loan of Php 5,000 in order to have additional capital for improving her business. She will use the loan to buy more commodities to sell. She hopes that through the help of the loan, her business will grow.

loans.use: To use as additional capital to improve her business

loans.name: Khady Youssouf

texts.fr: Kadhy est mariée, elle a 50 ans et 5 enfants dont deux qui vont à l'école.Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 8 ans et a reçu 16 prêts qui lui permettent jusqu'à présent de développer une activité de vente d'huile de palme. Elle achète en gros par futs de 200 litres et revend au détaille pour se créer des ressources additionnelles qui lui permettrons de participer à la prise en charge de sa famille.
texts.en:
Khady is married and 50 years old. She has five children, of whom two attend school. She has been a member of a village bank for eight years and received 16 loans, which helped her to develop her palm oil business. She buys palm oil in 200-liter barrels and retails it. The additional resources from this activity enable her to participate in the family expenses.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen her commercial activity

loans.name: Seam

texts.en: Seam P., 29, is a widow and lives with four children in the Phnom Penh. To earn a living, she sells clothes and shoes at the local market for US$5 of profit a day. Seam P. would like to take out a loan of US$1000 which she needs to purchase more clothes and shoes for resale.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for resale

loans.name: Crescencio

texts.es:
El  Sr. Crescencio Gustavo M.  es de la ciudad de San Estanislao, del Barrio Monte Alto, tiene 28 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra. Graciela Beatriz Lopez Rojas con 28 años de edad, Actualmente tienen 2 hijos todos en  edad escolar.
 
       Se dedica en las compras y ventas de menudencias en el Mercado Municipal de Santani, con clientela formada, buen ingreso, buenas referencias comerciales y personales , señor muy trabajador, excelente cliente con nosotros y con otras entidades financieras.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción ya que pretenden ampliar el salón de ventas y comprar mas mercadería para satisfacer a sus cliente.
texts.en:
Mr. Crescencio Gustavo is from the Barrio Monte Alto neighborhood of the city of San Estanislao. He is 28 years old and married to Graciela Beatriz, also 28 years old. They have two school-aged children. He buys and sells the offal (entrails and internal organs of butchered animals) at the marketplace in Santani. He has an established clientele, a good income, and comes with good business and personal references. He is hard working and has an excellent reputation with us and other financial entities. He is requesting this loan in order to buy building materials so that he can expand his sales area and invest in more merchandise to satisfy his customers needs.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Salah

texts.en: Salah has worked as a truck mechanic since 1998. A father of 2 young children, he works hard to provide better life conditions for the family. Over the years, he has been able to have a growing number of customers. Today, Salah is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy new mechanic’s tools because he is planning to enlarge his business by taking on more projects.

loans.use: To buy new mechanic's tools.

loans.name: Carlos Adonis

texts.es: Carlos Adonis tiene 25 años, el negocio del Señor Carlos es una pulpería donde ofrece arroz, frijoles, azúcar, golosinas, pan, jugos, refrescos naturales, detergentes jabón entre otros productos, son productos para el consumo del hogar. Además de esto Carlos es profesor ya que el poco salario que gana no es suficiente es por eso que con el poco dinero logra establecer muy pocos productos, es así que obtiene clientes en su propio vecindario, ya que no tenia mucha competencia en su cuadra poco a poco fue aumentando su inventario y así obtener su pulpería. El financiamiento es para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos y jugos. Su deseo es obtener la estabilidad económica necesaria para su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos Adonis is 25, and his business is a mini-market. He sells rice, beans, sugar, sweets, bread, juice, natural cold drinks, detergent, and soap, among other products. They are products to use in the home. Also, Carlos is a teacher. The small salary he earns is not enough. That is why he used this small amount of money and was only able to carry a few products. He gets customers from his own neighborhood. He did not have much competition on his block. Little by little, he started increasing his inventory and that is how he got his mini-market. The loan is to buy basic grains, sweets, cold drinks, and juices. His wish is to obtain the necessary economic stability for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Nemesia

texts.es:
La señora Nemesia es socia del Banco Comunal “San Juan de Dios” desde hace 3 años, vive en el distrito y provincia de Lampa, departamento de Puno, tiene 39 años de edad, es casada y tiene 02 hijos. Ella estudio hasta quinto de secundaria, se dedica a la venta de pokor (bocadito de maíz).

Nemesia nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital e iniciar su negocio.

Con este crédito  de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles comprará maíz, aceite, sal, etc.

Su sueño para el futuro es agrandar su negocio y así mejorar sus ingresos.

Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las capacitaciones que dan las promotoras y la organización de las socias.
texts.en:
Nemesia has been a member of the communal bank "San Juan de Dios" for 3 years. She lives in the district and province of Lampa, in the Puno department. She is 39 years old and is married with 2 children. She completed her secondary studies through the 5th year, and she has a business selling pokor (corn snacks.) Nemesia tells us that with the first loan she requested from the Movimiento Manuela Ramos organization, which was for 300 Peruvian soles, she was able to increase her capital and start her business. With this loan of 500 Peruvian soles she will buy corn, cooking oil, salt, etc. Her dream for the future is to increase her business and in this way improve her income. What she likes most about her communal bank are the training sessions that are given by the promoters and the organization.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy corn, cooking oil, salt, etc.

loans.name: Silveria

texts.en: Silveria, 53, owns a 'sari-sari' (variety) store. She sells various types of goods in her store to provide the daily needs around her neighborhood. She started this kind of business a long time ago. Now she’s a member of Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to gain access to a loan of 25,000 Php, enough to provide additional capital to fill her store with groceries. She has one child to support in her family. This loan will be of great help to provide more groceries for her store.

loans.use: groceries

loans.name: Chathurika

texts.en:
Chathurika is a 28-year-old married woman living in the town of Yakabadda, Sri Lanka with her two children.

Chathurika helps her husband in managing a floral shop that he owns. She uses the income from the family business to help support daily living expenses.

They have managed this shop for eight years now, and provide employment for two men in the village. Chathurika is known as a very honest and hardworking woman who is willing to help others in her community when needed.

Chathurika is seeking a 50,000 LKR loan from BRAC to improve her husband's floral business.

Thank you very much for taking the time to consider supporting this loan!

loans.use: To purchase materials and supplies for her husband's floral business

loans.name: Femmes Commerçantes N°9 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupement  Femmes Commerçantes (F.C) comme son nom l’indique est un réseau de femmes qui s’activent  dans le commerce.  Il est basé à Grand Thiès et il a été créé depuis 1992 par Madame Maty Niakh l’actuel président du réseau. Cette présidente a eu cette idée  à l’issue d’une formation qu’elle avait bénéficiée  de l’ONG OXFAM à Thiès. Elle connait, ainsi, bien la gestion de groupe, entreprenariat …etc.  Les membres du réseau sont extrêmement dévoués et se rencontrent une fois par mois. Ainsi, après des frais d’adhésion au groupement, chaque membre est tenu de cotiser mensuellement 200 FCFA pour une caisse de solidarité.
Souhaitant se financer, elles décidèrent  d’adhérer à  U-IMCEC. C’est ainsi que,  leur réseau se voit scinder en 19 sous groupes de 5 personnes  pour un meilleur profit des financements. Elles sollicitent pour une deuxième fois un prêt de 100 000 FCFA par membre,  soit 500 000 FCFA par sous groupe afin de développer leurs diverses activités.
Cependant, les règlements sont versés à la présidente assistée par la trésorière du groupe, Madame Coumba Seck, pendant leurs réunions mensuelles et ces deux se chargent à leur tour de rembourser U-IMCEC. Ce réseau qui, dit la présidente, n’a qu’un seul et noble objectif : combattre la pauvreté dans les ménages. Actuellement, le réseau compte 19 sous groupes avec chacun une présidente et une trésorière.
Les Femmes Commerçantes N°9 est dirigé par Oumy N. vendeuse de couscous  à base de mil  depuis 20 ans. Madame Awa G. est mariée mère de 3 enfants âgés respectivement de 28 ans, 25 ans et 20 ans. la marche de son activité lui a maintenu dans le commerce nous confie t-elle.
La trésorière est Madame Awa G. vendeuse de petits déjeuners dans son quartier. Les autres membres sont Madame Fatma D.  qui vend du couscous et du riz, Madame Fatim D. vendeuse de légumes et Madame Maréme D.  qui vend des produits de lessives et de l’huile de palme.
texts.en:
The Association of "Femmes Commercantes" (F. C) as its name indicates is a network of women who engage in trading. It is based in Grand Thies and was set up since 1992 by Madam Maty Niakh, the current chairwoman of the network. This woman got this idea at the end of a training course that she had received from an NGO OXFAM in Thies. Thus, She knows group management, entrepreneurship etc. The members of the network are extremely dedicated and they meet once in a month. So, each member is required to make a monthly contribution of 200 FCFA to a mutual fund after subscription fees to the network. Hoping to finance themselves, they decided to join U-IMCEC. Their network was thus split to 19 sub-groups of 5 individuals in order to take better advantage of the funding. They are each requesting for the second time a loan of 100 000FCFA that is 500 000FCFA for each sub-group in order to grow their various businesses. Meanwhile, payments are made to the chairwoman assisted by the treasurer of the association, Madam Coumba Seck, during their monthly meetings. These two are required, in turn, to repay U-IMCEC. This network, says the chairwoman, has only one noble objective: fight poverty in the household. Currently, the network has 19 sub-groups with each having a chairwoman and a treasurer. Femmes Commercantes No 9 is directed by Oumy N.. She 's been selling couscous made of millet for 20 years. Madam Awa G. is married and the mother of 3 children, aged 28, 25 and 20 years respectively. She confided in us that running of her business kept her in the trade. The treasurer is Madam Awa G. who sells breakfast in her community. The other members are Madam Fatma D. who sells couscous and rice, Madam Fatim D. who sells vegetables and Madam Mareme D. who sells laundry products and palm oil

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply products

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
For Ana, the owner of 'My Other Home' daycare, one of the most rewarding parts of her job is staying in contact with a child who has grown up and is no longer in her care. “It is almost like they are my children. When you take care of them from infancy, you are living all their first experiences with them. Some that are now grown still come to visit me.” 

Ana’s own children are also grown. Her son lives nearby and helped her to make a website for her business, but her daughter and other relatives live in Peru.  Ana loves that she is able to visit her family each year for the holidays. Before opening her daycare she held a number of jobs, and her schedule was determined by the needs of her bosses rather than her own. 

She began taking Child Development classes and discovered that it was something she not only was passionate about, but also could turn into a profession. After receiving her certification as a childcare provider, she established her in-home daycare business in 2004. “Every child has their own history and needs help to come out of their shell. Every day I can hug and pay each one special attention. Preschools are bigger, and they just don’t have the capacity to provide such close care.”

This will be Ana’s third loan from Opportunity Fund since 2007.  The financing has helped her to install new recreational equipment, including a swing set in her back yard, and to hire an employee to help her with the children. With an $8,000 loan, Ana will continue to make safety improvements to her facility and upgrade the education materials she uses each day.

loans.use: Safety improvements to her daycare center and education materials for the children

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph C. is 36 years old and married to Janet C. who is a business lady. They have one child, Jepchumba, 7 months old.

Joseph owns a shop, which he started six years ago. The shop gives him a monthly profit of Kshs 12,000. Joseph also has a workshop which gives him a profit of  Kshs 5,0000 monthly. Joseph's business is in Seretunin. His clients are residents of this area.

He has borrowed a loan of Kshs 15,000 from KADET. This is Joseph's first source of funds from a financial institution. He will use Kshs 7,000 to expand the shop and Kshs 8,000 for the expansion of the workshop.

If this loan boosts his business, Joseph will use the extra profit to expand his business.  Joseph dreams and hopes to own a big business.  He describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase stock for the workshop

loans.name: Meoun

texts.en:
Meoun L., 34, is married and lives with her husband and two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for its Angkorean Temples.

L. sells Cambodian noodles for an income of USD 5 per day. Her husband sells ice-cream, earning an income of USD 7 per day. She is requesting a loan of 800 USD to purchase more ice-cream boxes to expand her husband’s business. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

In the future, L. would like to use any additional profits to support her children’s study.

loans.use: To buy more ice-cream boxes for her husband's ice-cream business

loans.name: Myriam Magali

texts.es:
Myriam de 22 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Guayaquil, vive aun con sus padres pero trabaja  como vendedora Yambal (es una compañía de venta de cosméticos por catalogo que ayuda a las mujeres del Ecuador a ser vendedoras potenciales). 

Para comenzar como vendedora Yambal, sus padres le prestaron dinero para comprar productos y cosméticos. Poco a poco con esfuerzo y dedicación las ventas de cosméticos han sido su primer ingreso para comenzar a independizase. Vende perfumes, cremas, shampoo y cosméticos su horario es variado. 

Para tener mas variedad en sus productos quiere comprar perfumes, cremas con el préstamo. En el futuro quiere tener su propio local de cosméticos.
texts.en:
Myriam, 22 years old, lives on the outskirts of Guayaquil. She still lives with her parents but works as a Yambal vendor (Yambal is a company that sells cosmetics by catalog, which helps the women of Ecuador become potential vendors). To get started as a Yambal vendor, Myriam's parents lent her money to buy products and cosmetics. Little by little, with effort and dedication, cosmetics sales have become her main income so she can begin to become independent. She sells perfumes, creams, shampoo and cosmetics. Her schedule varies. To have a greater variety of products, Myriam wants to buy perfumes and creams with the loan. In the future, she wants to have her own cosmetics store.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Perfumes, creams

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 31 años de edad, ella comparte su vida con su pareja e hijo. Todos ellos viven en su casa propia. Hace mas de 3 años se dedica a vender  productos de belleza y esto es gracias al consejo de una amiga, que la motivo a incursionar en la venta de cosméticos. Esta actividad le ha sido muy rentable, gracias al tiempo disponible que tiene para dedicarse a su negocio, es así que durante las mañanas realiza las labores del hogar, en donde recoge a su hijo del colegio y por las tardes se dedica íntegramente a su negocio. Rosa nunca pierde el tiempo su gran carisma le ayuda a ofrecer y ganarse la confianza de la gente, siempre lleva consigo sus catálogos por si alguna madre de un compañero de su hijo le hace algún pedido. En un futuro desea instalar un bazar. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual con sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mayor cantidad de cosméticos y tenerlos en stock.
texts.en:
Rosa is 31 years old. She shares her life with her partner and son. They all live in their own home. She has been selling beauty products for more than 3 years, and she started doing this thanks to some advice from a friend who motivated her to get into cosmetics sales. This activity has been very profitable as a result of the time that she has available to dedicate to her business. She does her housework during the mornings and picks up her son from school, and in the afternoons she dedicates herself to her business. Rosa never wastes time, and her great charisma helps her to win people's confidence. She always carries her catalogs with her in case the mother of one of her son's schoolmates wants to place an order. In the future, she'd like to open a stall. This is her first loan with MFP and she promises to be very punctual with her repayments. With the loan that she is requesting, she will buy a large quantity of cosmetics to have in stock.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of cosmetics to have in stock

loans.name: Julieta's Group

texts.en:
Julieta S. is from the village of Upper Bayao, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 52 years old. and the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Julieta is married and has two adult children. To make a living, she has a retail store selling daily-use products such as eggs, noodles, shampoo, soap and toothpaste. Julieta has had her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Julieta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julieta is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Julieta from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Marteriano

texts.es: El Sr. Marteriano se dedica a la venta de productos de  limpieza como detergentes, champús y otros de esta línea se dedica a esta actividad ya desde hace dos años y le va bien en el negocio, ya cuentan con un vehículo que compraron en sociedad con su hermano,  debido a que le ofrecieron comprarse una caseta para la venta de sándwiches se apersono para solicitar el crédito, tiene una familia reducida que esta compuesta por su esposa y su hijito de 3 años, tienen deseos de superarse, para lo cual piensan comprar la caseta y su esposa hacerse cargo de la elaboración y venta de sándwiches, esta muy agradecido con emprender y kiva por la confianza brindad en la otorgación del credito
texts.en:
Senor Marteriano works selling cleaning products, such as detergents, shampoos and others in this line. He has been doing this activity for 2 years and his business is going well as he now has a vehicle which he purchased together with his brother. He has been offered to purchase a cart to sell sandwiches so is seeking a loan. He has a small family composed of his wife and small son, 3. They want to improve their situation and are thinking of buying the cart, with his wife taking charge of making and selling the sandwiches. He is thankful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence they have shown in granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cart to sell sandwiches

loans.name: Pring

texts.en:
Pring P. is a 24-year-old villager who earns a living by sewing clothes in the garment factory. Pring P. is married to Mr. Noeuv Pirin, age 24, who works as a security guard. This couple has two small, school-aged kids. 

Pring P. and her husband currently reside together in a parent’s house. They wish to live independently by building a new house to live in, but their wish doesn’t come true because of a lack funds. To help achieve their goal, Pring P. is pursuing a loan to add with her personal savings in order to build a new house.

loans.use: To build a new house

loans.name: Grace Jennifer

texts.es:
Grace de 20 años, vive en una zona periurbana llamada Paraíso de Guayaquil (caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y montañas), no ha tenido un ingreso propio por esos ha comenzado a vender ropa por catalogo. 

Debido a la falta de oportunidades ella vende todo tipo de ropa para solventar sus gastos personales, trabaja en grupos de vendedoras de lunes a viernes, ellas recorren las calles de Paraiso promocionando la ropa por catalogo. Como a veces se va a otos lugares a vender la ropa tiene miedo de los accidente de transito ya que no tiene un vehiculo.  

Par seguir con sus ventas ella quiere comprar con el préstamo ropa y perfumes. En el futuro quiere comprar su propia casa y hay ubicar su negocio.
texts.en:
Grace is 20 years old, and lives in an area called Paraíso de Guayaquil on the outskirts of that city. The area is characterised by its mountains and dirt roads. Not having her own income before, Grace has started selling clothes through a catalogue. Owing to the lack of other opportunities, she sells all kinds of clothes to meet her personal expenses. She works in a team of sales women from monday to Friday, going round the streets in Paraíso promoting the catalogue's clothing. She occasionally goes to other locations to sell the clothes, although she worries about bus crashes because she doesn't have her own transport. To continue her sales, Grace wants to buy clothes and perfumes with the loan. In the future she would like to buy her own home and locate her business there.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purses, clothes, perfumes

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa M. sells bags of water, biscuits and other things in Elmina. Hawa has received a senior high school education. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a mason. She responsibly helps her husband look after the general welfare of the home. Her loan will be used to buy additional goods to sell. She hopes to save the new profits from her business to further her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy additional goods to sell

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta B. is from the town of Santa Josefa. She is 50 years old and married. She has nine children and some of them go to school. To make a living, she plants and harvests rice to sell. Julieta wishes to send all her children to school, and she also wants them to finish college someday.

Julieta joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. 

She is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm supplies such as fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers

loans.name: Jamila's Group

texts.en:
Jamila G. is the leader of this group. She is 46 and married. She has a daughter who is 23 and works in the radio station “Min Kiyal”. Jamila works as a nurse and her husband went off to work in Russia. Jamila hopes to obtain the loan because she needs money to purchase building materials in order to finish their house construction. 

Gulaiym A. is the treasurer of the group.  She is 37 and a widow.  She has two daughters and a son.  Gulaiym earns money by selling fruit and vegetables at the market.  In this way she makes 6400 soms per month.  With money received from the loan she wants to purchase convenience goods in order to resell them at the market.  In the future she wants to repair her house.

Aizada K., 40, is married.  She has two daughters and three sons.  All the children are students.  Aizada and her husband are engaged in cattle breeding.  With money received from the loan they want to purchase cattle for breeding. 

Buapiza G., 36, is married. She has two daughters and three sons. Buapiza is engaged in cattle breeding and her husband works in construction. With money received from the loan Buapiza wants to purchase cattle for breeding. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously).
